34237.title: Business Systems Analyst – Payments Modernization
34237.description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Systems Analyst to join a large-scale Payments Modernization initiative. The successful candidate will work within an Agile Scrum team to gather, document, and manage business requirements, translate them into actionable specifications, support testing efforts, and contribute to continuous improvement of processes and systems.
SECRET CLEARANCE - Mandatory

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate within a Scrum team to convert business requirements into detailed specifications and user stories.

  • Facilitate refinement sessions and ensure development teams fully understand requirements.

  • Write, plan, and execute test scenarios; coordinate and support user acceptance testing.

  • Maintain process, procedure, and training documentation.

  • Analyze and validate solutions for complex business problems.

  • Identify and recommend improvements to business processes and system capabilities.

  • Participate in the Business Analysis Community of Practice to share knowledge and best practices.

  • Provide subject-matter expertise and guidance on relevant projects.

Required Skills & Experience

  • University degree or college diploma in business administration, commerce, computer science, or a related field.

  • Minimum 5 years experience developing business requirements and delivering business systems analysis for large IT-enabled projects.

  • Minimum 3 years experience in an Agile environment as a business analyst.

  • Strong facilitation skills for meetings and workshops.

  • Demonstrated adaptability to change and ability to work with diverse stakeholders while managing multiple priorities.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of high-availability banking and payment systems.

  • Professional certifications such as CBAP or CCBA.

34236.title: Project Manager
34236.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Manager for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 5+ years overall experience
- Experience with the ADKAR (Prosci) Framework
- Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
- Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The client is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to lead complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong blend of project management expertise, leadership capabilities, technical awareness, and change management proficiency to ensure successful project outcomes aligned with business objectives and enterprise standards.
34236.publicDescription:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Project Manager for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

IMPORTANT NOTE: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. Local candidates only - Candidates must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission.

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 5+ years overall experience
- Experience with the ADKAR (Prosci) Framework
- Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
- Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
- Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
- Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

Job Summary:
The State of Michigan is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Project Manager to lead complex, large-scale IT initiatives. This role requires a strong blend of project management expertise, leadership capabilities, technical awareness, and change management proficiency to ensure successful project outcomes aligned with business objectives and enterprise standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide strategic oversight, leadership, and accountability for one or more large, complex IT projects, typically lasting longer than 6 months, involving 20 or more team members, and requiring executive-level communication and coordination.
  • Ensure alignment with State of Michigan project management methodologies, including SUITE, investment management, and systems engineering methodology.
  • Lead cross-functional teams through all phases of project planning and execution, including the development of integrated schedules, risk management plans, and budget tracking.
  • Monitor and report on project progress regarding scope, quality, schedule, and budget, and escalate issues and risks to executive leadership as necessary.
  • Perform long-term release planning to support organizational strategic goals and ensure alignment with broader enterprise initiatives.
  • Evaluate technical requirements in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, proposing solutions that meet business needs while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
  • Apply structured change management practices grounded in the ADKAR (Prosci) framework to ensure stakeholder alignment and successful adoption of project deliverables.


Technical Competencies:
  • Strong knowledge of APIs, system interfaces, and multi-system integrations across complex IT environments.
  • Working knowledge of IT infrastructure components and their interactions within networked environments (e.g., firewalls, VIPs, F5 listeners, ports).
  • Familiarity with core infrastructure environments including networks, servers, storage, web platforms, and virtual/cloud solutions.
  • Ability to effectively collaborate with technical teams and external vendors to support solution design, integration, deployment, and issue resolution.


Change Management and Stakeholder Engagement: This position plays a critical role in driving change adoption through:
  • Integration of change management principles from the outset of the project.
  • Close collaboration with stakeholder engagement leads to develop and implement communication plans, facilitate training sessions, and monitor organizational readiness.
  • Supporting stakeholders at every level to reduce resistance, align expectations, and ensure long-term user adoption of new systems and processes.


Ideal Candidate Profile:
  • Proven ability to lead large, cross-functional teams and manage high-visibility projects with medium to high risk.
  • Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills with experience interacting with Agency Leadership.
  • Ability to manage both technical delivery and change management efforts within complex environments.
  • Demonstrated success managing vendor-supported projects with integrated technical components and stakeholder groups.

34224.title: Business Systems Analyst/Product Owner
34224.description:
Bill Rate: $102.30hr

Myticas direct client is seeking Business Systems Analyst/PO for a 6 month contract role. This is Hybrid (3 days onsite) at Waukegan, IL

Duration: 6 months (with a possibility of extension)

Top 3-5 skills needed:

  1. Good Business Analysis experience, writing requirement, and working with stakeholders
  2. Product Management/Product Owner
  3. Knowledgeable on HR systems-Workday/HCM/ServiceNow/HR management
  4. Familiarity and comfort with Scrum meeting, Agile mindsets, skillsets, and methodologies.
  5. Proficient in project management, stakeholder management, Customer and Employee Experience management - approach of managing both customer and employee interactions
 
Description:
  • We are seeking a talented and experienced Business Systems Analyst to join our team.
  • The ideal candidate will be responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating business systems and user needs, and will document requirements, define scope and objectives, and formulate systems aligned with our overall business strategies.
  • This role requires a bachelor's degree in a related area and 3-5 years of experience in the field or a related area.
 
** Key Responsibilities **
  • Analyze business systems and user needs to develop requirements and documentation.
  • Define the scope and objectives of business systems projects.
  • Formulate systems that parallel overall business strategies.
  • Support mainstream skills or common HR platforms, including ServiceNow, Workday, UKG, as well as tools like
  • Adobe Analytics, Power BI, and PowerApps.
  • Perform effective tech/vendor/solution scouting and assessment.
  • Engage in CX/EX management with experience or a base level understanding.
  • Utilize AI tools to enhance quality and throughput, maintaining a critical approach without relying on 'autopilot.'
  • Manage programs and stakeholders effectively.
  • Plan and accomplish goals relying on experience and judgment, and perform a variety of complicated tasks.

  • Proficient in program management and stakeholder management.
  • AI savvy with the ability to leverage AI tools critically.
 
** Traits & Behaviors **
  • A natural learner and self-starter.
  • Detail- and process-oriented.
  • A doer and builder, showing initiative and proactiveness.
  • Deeply collaborative, able to catalyze progress by leading through example.
  • Outcome-oriented with a focus on achieving practical results.
  • Demonstrates creativity and flexibility in task execution.

34235.title: Senior Java EE Developer
34235.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Senior Java EE Developer for 12+ Months Contract role. (Potential of Extension).

100% Remote.
USC only

TOP Skills:
  1. Java EE Technologies, Java 1.8 version (prefer Java 7.7)
  2. Springboot
  3. Microservices
  4. Web Services
  5. Kubernetes, Docker

Job Summary:
Seeking to hire a senior level software engineer, a skilled Java EE developer that possesses extensive solution development knowledge with the ability to work on a defined set of business systems. 
The goal is to reduce the technical debt and modernize various applications and tools within our portfolio.
Some of the common tasks that are to be performed on an application will be: migrate our Java EE portfolio to a container’s environment.
 
The candidate will:
  • Conduct group discussions with key players.
  • Work with the product teams to help determine requirements and understand the design of each product.
  • Refactor, build, and test each product.
  • Design, build, and test integrations for each product.
  • Complete all required client training.

  • Comprehensive knowledge of Java EE Technologies, Java 1.8 version or above, including JMS.

34234.title: Director of Information Technology (IT)  – Cloud Technology & Infrastructure
34234.description:
We are looking for a forward-thinking IT leader to guide our technology operations and spearhead the strategic growth of our cloud-first environment. This role will oversee the planning, delivery, and continual improvement of enterprise IT services, with a strong focus on cloud platforms, SaaS applications, and modern infrastructure solutions. You’ll have the opportunity to shape technology direction in a dynamic, expanding organization while staying hands-on with critical initiatives.
The successful candidate will combine leadership, technical expertise, and business alignment to ensure our technology landscape remains secure, scalable, and optimized for performance. This is both a strategic and execution-focused position, requiring a proven ability to deliver results in a high-growth setting.

Key Responsibilities
  • Lead, mentor, and inspire the IT team to foster innovation, accountability, and collaboration.
  • Manage and optimize cloud platforms and applications, including Microsoft 365, AWS, and Azure, ensuring alignment with organizational priorities.
  • Oversee the delivery of IT projects such as infrastructure upgrades, security enhancements, and modernization programs.
  • Maintain the security, availability, and scalability of network and cloud environments through best practices and proactive risk management.
  • Drive process improvements through automation, integration, and innovative technology solutions.
  • Establish and enforce IT policies, compliance measures, and security standards to protect organizational data and systems.
  • Partner with senior leadership to define and execute a technology roadmap that supports business growth.
  • Provide hands-on support for high-priority issues and initiatives to minimize operational disruptions.
  • Stay ahead of emerging technologies and industry developments to maintain a competitive edge.

Qualifications
  • 7+ years of progressive IT experience, including at least 3 years in a leadership role.
  • Deep knowledge of cloud services, infrastructure, and enterprise technology ecosystems.
  • Strong technical foundation in networking, security, and systems administration.
  • Demonstrated success in delivering complex IT projects in evolving or scaling organizations.
  • Solid understanding of cybersecurity, compliance frameworks, and risk management practices.
  • Proven leadership and communication skills with the ability to inspire and manage high-performing teams.
  • Strategic mindset with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to align IT initiatives to business outcomes.
  • Experience identifying cost efficiencies, automation opportunities, and process improvements in cloud environments.

34232.title: Business Process Reengineering Consultant
34232.description:
Job ID#145662

Job Title: Business Process Reengineering Consultant
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid – Onsite 2 Days/Week)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client

Please NOTE: 

  • Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. 
  • 30-40 hours per week.


Top Skills & Years of Experience:
  • Deep understanding of practical metrics and how to help business areas seamlessly integrate and monitor metrics
  • Understanding of Lean tools and expertise in PDCA (Plan Do Check Act), used for iterative problem-solving and process refinement.
  • Deep understanding of guiding business to document ROI.
  • Experience in crafting research plans, white papers and synthesizing research outcome reports.
  • Skills in crafting digestible summaries for executives and developing accompanying info graphics for wider communication


Job Summary:
As a Research Analyst, you will be responsible for researching best practices that help define and drive changes to improve the State’s current continuous improvement efforts. The position will serve as an expert on the development of ROI for continuous improvement efforts and for identifying or developing tools to help with improvement efforts.  You will conduct research, work with cross-functional teams, and perform research studies independently.  These responsibilities also include delivering oral and written presentations, evaluating qualitative and quantitative data, and helping the OCI team better understand what would make our methods more intuitive and seamless.
Job Responsibilities:
1.Conduct best practice research across private and public sector for OCI Leadership
2.Organize and evaluate quantitative and qualitative research.
3.Work with cross-functional teams to identify and evaluate research topics and approaches
4.Craft reports, presentations and other communication materials on the research conducted.
5.Generating insights from data and recommend follow up actions.
6.Present and promote research findings to program owners and business stakeholders.
7.Develop customized approaches, plans, and workshops to help address Business Area problems and issues.
8.Lead initiatives, coordinate with senior leadership, and align improvements with broader business strategy and KPIs
9.Lead user workshops and facilitating sessions, both in-person and virtual.

Skills/Requirements:
•Four more years of research experience.
•Deep understanding of guiding business to document ROI.
•Deep understanding of practical metrics and how to help business areas seamlessly integrate and monitor metrics
•Experience in crafting research plans, white papers and synthesizing research outcome reports.
•Skills in crafting digestible summaries for executives and developing accompanying info graphics for wider communication.
•Understanding of Lean tools and expertise in PDCA (Plan Do Check Act), used for iterative problem-solving and process refinement.
•Experience in leading workshops to gather information, synthesize information and developing metrics.
•Generating insights from data and effectively sharing research results.
•Communication & Stakeholder Engagement - Conveying findings simply and persuasively in reports, dashboards, and presentations to diverse audiences—from frontline workers to senior executives
•Collaborating effectively with stakeholders and acting as a strategic partner in decisions.

Certifications (Not required but good to have):
  • Certified Analyst Professional
  • Certified Financial Analyst
  • Financial Risk Manager


  • Examples of Projects:
    -Explore and design SOP’s using AI for supporting continuous improvement activities
    -Explore tools for process mining for better data gathering and decision making.  
    -ROI of OCI HCD projects
    -ROI of OCI LPI program
    -ROI of OCI Customer Experience Strategy implementation

34233.title: Business Development Leader (Google)
34233.description:
We are seeking an accomplished and results-driven sales leader to accelerate growth within our technology business. This pivotal role will focus on uncovering and winning new business opportunities, while deepening our engagement and influence within the Google technology space. You will be instrumental in shaping and executing our go-to-market approach, collaborating with internal teams across sales, delivery, and partnerships to bring impactful solutions to clients.

Leveraging your deep knowledge of Google’s offerings and your ability to sell complex, solution-based services, you will establish credibility quickly, identify value-creation opportunities, and harness our organization’s full technology capabilities to address our clients’ most critical needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively identify, pursue, and develop new client relationships in targeted accounts.

  • Partner with cross-functional teams to lead pursuit strategies and sales initiatives.

  • Build strong, trust-based relationships with decision-makers and influencers at prospective and existing clients.

  • Establish and maintain collaborative relationships with key contacts within Google, ensuring alignment and joint growth opportunities.

  • Support the development and execution of a targeted Google partnership strategy aligned to business goals.

  • Work with clients to understand business challenges and design tailored, high-impact solutions using the organization’s complete service portfolio.

  • Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to design and deliver effective go-to-market programs.

  • Represent the company at industry events, partner functions, and strategic meetings to showcase capabilities and identify new opportunities.

Success Indicators

  • Demonstrates integrity, collaboration, and professionalism in every client and partner interaction.

  • Develops a strong understanding of client industries, priorities, and challenges, earning recognition as a trusted advisor.

  • Engages curiosity and strategic thinking to diagnose client needs and deliver actionable solutions.

  • Promotes a collaborative and inclusive environment that inspires top performance.

  • Adopts and champions digital tools, data-driven selling, and innovative business practices.

  • Continues to expand market and technical expertise through ongoing learning.

Qualifications

  • Proven track record of building trust and credibility with stakeholders at all levels within client and partner organizations.

  • Demonstrated success in generating new business, leading strategic pursuits, and closing complex deals.

  • Strong background and hands-on experience in the Google ecosystem, including knowledge of product capabilities and partner programs.

  • 10+ years of progressive sales or business development experience within mid-market and enterprise environments.

  • Documented success selling professional services, cloud-based solutions, or digital transformation initiatives.

  • Highly results-oriented with a proactive, solution-focused approach to business challenges.

  • Experience selling across multiple industries in the Canadian market is an asset.

  • Post-secondary education or equivalent professional experience.

  • Team-oriented mindset with an appreciation for individual contributions to collective success.

32188.title: 100% Remote - SOX Compliance Coordinator/Analyst (A-28631)
32188.description:
Job Title: SOX Compliance Coordinator/Analyst
Location: 100% Remote
Duration: 6+ Months Contract (Possible further extension)

Job Summary:
The SOX Compliance Coordinator/Analyst will work closely with the Enablement SOX team to help with the execution of the SOX program.
This individual will assist the senior members of the team with scheduling meetings, gathering documentation, analysing information provided by teams for completeness, and tracking and following up when documentation is past due.

Responsibilities:
  • Schedule walkthrough, follow up, and team meetings.
  • Assist with identifying and tracking missing documentation.
  • Update the system of record (Workiva) with any new or changing information.
  • Assist with reporting team metrics and weekly status reporting.

Requirements:
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of management.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving abilities with customer service orientation.
  • Self-starter and flexible team player.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing processes and procedures.
  • Experience in auditing is a plus.

Tools:
  • MS Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook)
  • OneNote
  • SharePoint
  • Power BI would be a plus.

SOX Compliance Coordinator/Analyst (100% Remote - Contract)

Location: 100% Remote
Duration: 6+ Months Contract (Possible Extension)

Job Summary:

Myticas' direct client is seeking a SOX Compliance Coordinator/Analyst to support the Enablement SOX team in executing the SOX compliance program. This role will involve scheduling meetings, gathering and analyzing documentation, tracking deadlines, and ensuring timely follow-ups. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, organized, and capable of working in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Schedule walkthroughs, follow-ups, and team meetings.
  • Identify, track, and manage missing documentation.
  • Maintain and update the system of record (Workiva) with new or changing information.
  • Assist in generating reports on team metrics and provide weekly status updates.

Required Qualifications:

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact effectively across all levels of management.

  • Adaptability to a fast-paced environment with evolving processes and procedures.

This is a 100% remote role with the potential for contract extension. If you are a detail-oriented professional with an interest in SOX compliance and process coordination, we encourage you to apply!

34085.title: Full-Stack Developer
34085.description:
We are seeking a Full Stack Developer with strong expertise in Angular, Java/Spring Boot, and cloud-native development to join a purpose-driven organization. In this role, you’ll contribute to the design, development, and deployment of secure, scalable, and resilient web applications and backend services used across Canada.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Develop, test, and maintain modern web applications using the Angular framework.
  • Design and implement RESTful services using Java and Spring Boot.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including DevOps, QA, and business stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions aligned with organizational goals.
  • Build and deploy applications to cloud environments using Azure AKS, OpenShift, or Kubernetes.
  • Create and manage Helm charts for Kubernetes-based deployments.
  • Work with relational databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, or SQL Server to support application data needs.
  • Ensure code quality and maintainability through automated testing, peer reviews, and adherence to development best practices.
  • Contribute to architectural decisions and provide technical guidance on cloud-native strategies and DevOps integration.
Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience as a Full Stack Developer or Software Engineer.
  • Proficiency with Angular (v10+), TypeScript, and front-end best practices.
  • Strong backend development experience with Java, Spring Boot, and RESTful API design.
  • Hands-on experience with container orchestration platforms such as Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), OpenShift, or vanilla Kubernetes.
  • Experience deploying applications using Helm and working in CI/CD environments.
  • Solid understanding of relational databases (e.g., Oracle, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and writing performant SQL queries.
  • Familiarity with security, compliance, and performance requirements in regulated or healthcare environments is a strong asset.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to thrive in a collaborative, mission-focused team environment.

34227.title: Network Verification & Test Engineer
34227.description:
We are seeking a Network Verification & Test Engineer to validate the performance, reliability, and compliance of advanced networking systems. This role involves creating verification plans, executing system-level tests, automating configurations, and working with industry-standard traffic generation tools. The ideal candidate will bring a strong networking background, hands-on testing expertise, and the ability to work both independently and in collaborative team settings.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop system and subsystem verification matrices to ensure full coverage of all system requirements.

  • Coordinate and participate in system-level testing activities, including planning, execution, and reporting of results.

  • Design, develop, and maintain test cases and test beds to support various testing scenarios.

  • Execute tests using traffic generators (e.g., Spirent, IXIA, Test Center), packet capture tools (tcpdump), and performance tools (iPerf).

  • Validate networking features and performance across OSI layers, including TCP, UDP, IP networking, routing protocols, and network optimization techniques.

  • Implement and manage NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI for automated network device configuration.

  • Work with structured data formats such as JSON, JSON IETF, XML, YAML, PROTO, and REST APIs to support automation workflows.

  • Utilize Kubernetes (POD) and Docker containers for test environment setup and management.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance and functional issues, ensuring timely defect identification and resolution.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with traffic generation and analysis tools such as Spirent, IXIA, Test Center, tcpdump, and iPerf.

  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including OSI layers, TCP/UDP/IP protocols, routing protocols, and optimization methods.

  • Experience configuring and automating network devices using NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI.

  • Proficiency with structured data formats (JSON, XML, YAML, PROTO) and REST API integration.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker environments.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python or Ansible for network automation and orchestration.

  • Prior experience in network verification, system integration testing, or telecom/network equipment validation.

  • Exposure to performance benchmarking and large-scale test environments.

The ideal candidate will bring a strong networking background, hands-on testing expertise, and the ability to work both independently and in collaborative team settings.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop system and subsystem verification matrices to ensure full coverage of all system requirements.

  • Coordinate and participate in system-level testing activities, including planning, execution, and reporting of results.

  • Design, develop, and maintain test cases and test beds to support various testing scenarios.

  • Execute tests using traffic generators (e.g., Spirent, IXIA, Test Center), packet capture tools (tcpdump), and performance tools (iPerf).

  • Validate networking features and performance across OSI layers, including TCP, UDP, IP networking, routing protocols, and network optimization techniques.

  • Implement and manage NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI for automated network device configuration.

  • Work with structured data formats such as JSON, JSON IETF, XML, YAML, PROTO, and REST APIs to support automation workflows.

  • Utilize Kubernetes (POD) and Docker containers for test environment setup and management.

  • Troubleshoot and resolve performance and functional issues, ensuring timely defect identification and resolution.

Required Qualifications

  • Proven experience with traffic generation and analysis tools such as Spirent, IXIA, Test Center, tcpdump, and iPerf.

  • Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including OSI layers, TCP/UDP/IP protocols, routing protocols, and optimization methods.

  • Experience configuring and automating network devices using NETCONF and gRPC/gNMI.

  • Proficiency with structured data formats (JSON, XML, YAML, PROTO) and REST API integration.

  • Familiarity with Kubernetes and Docker environments.

  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

  • Ability to work independently and within cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python or Ansible for network automation and orchestration.

  • Prior experience in network verification, system integration testing, or telecom/network equipment validation.

  • Exposure to performance benchmarking and large-scale test environments.

34124.title: Project Managers – Real Property
34124.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking intermediate and senior-level Project Managers with experience in Real Property for upcoming federal government initiatives. 

Responsibilities:
Candidates must demonstrate experience in managing real property projects, which may include asset acquisitions, fit-ups, construction, renovations, or remediation of buildings, land, or infrastructure.

Tasks include:

  • Developing and gaining acceptance of project scope, budget, and schedule

  • Implementing communication plans with stakeholders

  • Coordinating multi-stakeholder engagement

  • Managing scope, budget, and schedule changes throughout the project lifecycle

  • Tracking and reporting with:

  • Time schedules

  • Work breakdown structures

  • Project scopes

  • Budget forecasts and cash flows

  • Status reports

Mandatory Requirements:

  • Intermediate Level: Minimum 3 years of real property project experience in the last 10 years

  • Senior Level: Minimum 5 years of real property project experience in the last 10 years

Additional Point-Rated Assets:

  • Experience preparing or leading the creation of:

  • Project Charter / Statement of Work

  • Project Management Plan

  • Risk Management Plans / Feasibility Studies

  • Project reporting, commissioning plans, and lessons learned

  • Experience managing:

  • Multi-disciplinary teams

  • Construction contracts

  • Cost and time control processes

  • Change management protocols

    Security Clearance:
    All candidates must hold an Enhanced Reliability clearance (or be eligible).

    Location Requirements:
    Preference for candidates in the Ottawa region. Work model (hybrid or on-site) is to be confirmed.

32266.title: Back-End Developer - Intermediate/Senior
32266.description:
RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Thoroughly understand the requirements and design.
  • Collaborate with internal teams on various deliverables.
  • Understand High Level Design and prepare the Low-level design (the Integration / Interface modules) for the module assigned.
  • Code reviews and other project documents developed by juniors / peers.
  • Collaborate & work closely with Product teams, Project Managers, Architects, Software Engineers, Business Analysts & QA teams in different locations.
  • Review and report the status of development & proactively address issues/challenges which might impact the timelines.
  • Embed & enforce quality and standards with Development team.
  • Continually improve quality of delivery and capability by building and growing a high-performance team.
  • Review and report the deliverables to manager.
  • Contribute to company’s KB and Process improvements.
  • Adhere to company core standards & guidelines.
  • Assign accurate & detailed tasks regularly to the team.
  • Conduct model level effort estimation and integrate for complete application.
  • Performance Engineering, Tuning, and architecting scalable

MUST HAVE/REQUIREMENTS
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Minimum 6 years of work experience, along with equivalent lead experience.
  • Strong database and query building knowledge across multiple databases, with experience in PostgreSQL and Oracle.
  • Experience with Apache Kafka for building real-time, scalable data pipelines and handling event-driven communication within microservices architectures.
  • Knowledge on Application Servers like JBoss, Websphere, and Weblogic.
  • Domain knowledge of banking and financial institutions and/or large enterprise IT environment will be a strong asset.
  • Proficient in core development tools such as Spring Boot, Eclipse, Maven, Sonar, JUnit, and Docker.
  • 5+ years of experience with enterprise software development.
  • Product implementation experience, with a focus on deploying and managing microservices using Spring Boot and Kafka.
  • Experience with enterprise software development in JAVA, J2EE, Spring (including Spring Boot), Hibernate, Web Services, MQ, REST-based APIs, Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, and Apache Kafka.
  • Strong experience in multi-threaded server-side Java programming, including Kafka producers and consumers to manage high-throughput messaging and event-driven systems.
  • Proven experience in the use of Eclipse, Maven, Sonar, and JUnit tools for development, testing, and continuous integration.
  • Experience working with agile methodologies, including continuous integration and deployment in Java-based microservices with Kafka as the backbone for event streaming.
  • Experience with Java development using JBuilder, Java, Servlets, EJB, J2EE, and frameworks like Spring, Hibernate, Struts, and Kafka for real-time event-driven architecture.
  • Proficiency in HTML, DHTML, JavaScript, XML, and CSS for building front-end interfaces, as well as integrating those with back-end Spring Boot APIs and Kafka for data synchronization.
  • Experience working with MS SQL, Oracle, DB2, OOAD, UML.
  • Ability to work in remote and/or office settings, with the flexibility to support offshore hours/time zones and adapt to client needs.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines, while maintaining focus on product quality and timely delivery.
  • Flexibility with working hours based on team and client needs, including support for distributed teams and different time zones.

NICE TO HAVE
  • Strong, clear, and concise written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and can foster team collaboration.
  • Out of the box thinking approach ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions 
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate to achieve positive outcomes 
  • Detail-oriented and strong ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
  • Aptitude to solve problems
  • Ability to conceptualize and articulate new approaches and solutions in analysis at all levels of organization
  • Pro-active and has a strong desire to learn.

34222.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer
34222.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience

32539.title: Business Intelligence Business Objects SQL Developer
32539.description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/SQL Developer
Job Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Business Objects/SQL Developer
Location: Remote (with occasional travel to Springfield, IL) HAS TO BE IN THE US, can be anywhere inside the us. 

Functional Description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced BI BusinessObjects/SQL Developer to design, develop, and maintain business intelligence solutions using SAP BusinessObjects and SQL. This role supports Medicaid/CHIP claims and other healthcare data systems, ensuring accurate reporting and data integrity for state and federal stakeholders. Key

Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain BusinessObjects reports using Medicaid/CHIP claims and subsystem data.
Write, optimize, and maintain complex SQL scripts and queries for data marts and reporting.
Create and manage BusinessObjects Universes and metadata layers.
Develop and maintain database systems to support efficient data storage and reporting.
Manage server backups and ensure system reliability.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and recommend technical solutions.
Participate in unit, integration, and system testing.
Provide regular project updates to customers and maintain strong communication.
Mentor junior team members and provide technical training as needed.
Stay current with emerging technologies and industry best practices.
Perform additional duties as required to support project and organizational goals.

Required Qualifications:
5+ years of experience in SAP BusinessObjects development and reporting including report Universe designing.
5+ years of SQL development, including 4+ years of performance tuning.
2+ years of experience in data warehouse projects.
2+ years of experience with Teradata (v15+), including SQL Assistant.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work directly with clients.
Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities.
Strong team collaboration and adaptability. Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of experience as Business Objects server administrator
Familiarity with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare-related applications.
Experience with Tableau or BusinessObjects version upgrades. Exposure to Agile development methodologies.
This is a remote role. We are considering any candidate in the US that meets the criteria above.

34225.title: Windchill Solutions Consultant
34225.description:
We are looking for a Windchill professional who knows Java.  Not a Java developer that has worked in Windchill.
most important exp is with Windchill (both tech work but also understanding the business processes that the tool supports).  Looking for exp leading implementation of ProjectLink and/or SUMA, not just participating in the implementation.

Windchill Solutions Consultant
We are seeking a Windchill solutions consultant to support the deliverables of our global team and initiatives. As a member of our team, using Agile practices, you will lead us to timely delivery of high-quality technical solutions that drive cross functional business strategies and initiatives.

What You Will Be Doing:
Key Responsibilities:
  • Envisioning, implementing and supporting solutions (technical or non-technical) to resolve business problems or improve business processes
  • Building relationships with and consulting with client groups
  • Developing system requirements and identifying alternatives for solutions that use PLM technologies  
Specifically:
  • Implement functionality for Supplier Collaboration through Windchill ProjectLink and Supplier Management (SUMA).
  • Assist in other PLM initiatives involving MPMLink & Process Plans, Plant/Enterprise Data, and our SAP S4 to Windchill Migration
 
Key Skills/Abilities
  • Knowledge and understanding of Product Life Cycle Management business processes
  • Deep Windchill background that includes Workflow Design, Type and Attribute Management, Container Strategy and Access Control Policies, Object Initialization Rules, Life Cycle Definition, Team Templates, Change Process and Templates, Vaulting and Replication, Queue Management, 3D Publishing, CAD Data Management, XBOM Management, Visual Work instructions, Parts Classification, Installation, Preferences and Properties, etc. 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as: 
·PTC Products:  Windchill, Creo, ThingWorx
·ERP Systems:  SAP ECC, SAP S/4
·Programming Skills:  Java, JavaScript, SQL
·Other:  MS Office Suite, MS Azure DevOps
 
Minimum Qualifications
·Bachelor’s Degree in a related field required. 
·Five years of experience working with Windchill and PLM business processes.
·Experience with integration between Windchill and ERP systems.
·Experience implementing ProjectLink for supplier collaboration.
·Experience implementing Windchill SUMA for supplier management.
Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred
34225.publicDescription:
Windchill Solutions Consultant
Contract to Hire
Hybrid - Grand Rapids, MI

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is seeking a Windchill solutions consultant for a contract to hire opportunity with a large, direct client.  This role aims to support the deliverables of the global team and initiatives. As a member of the team, using Agile practices, you will lead the company to timely delivery of high-quality technical solutions that drive cross functional business strategies and initiatives.

The team you will be part of     
Our Engineering Systems team is a diverse and global team, supporting the people and systems in Product Lifecycle Management (PLM). Our mission is to empower our global PLM users to bring high quality products to market faster, using best-in-class technology, consistent processes and services, and trusted data that improves the product design, launch, manufacturing, and overall lifecycle management.

What You Will Be Doing:

Key Responsibilities:
  • Envisioning, implementing and supporting solutions (technical or non-technical) to resolve business problems or improve business processes
  • Building relationships with and consulting with client groups
  • Developing system requirements and identifying alternatives for solutions that use PLM technologies  
Specifically:
  • Implement functionality for Supplier Collaboration through Windchill ProjectLink and Supplier Management (SUMA).
  • Assist in other PLM initiatives involving MPMLink & Process Plans, Plant/Enterprise Data, and our SAP S4 to Windchill Migration
 
Key Skills/Abilities
  • Knowledge and understanding of Product Life Cycle Management business processes
  • Deep Windchill background that includes Workflow Design, Type and Attribute Management, Container Strategy and Access Control Policies, Object Initialization Rules, Life Cycle Definition, Team Templates, Change Process and Templates, Vaulting and Replication, Queue Management, 3D Publishing, CAD Data Management, XBOM Management, Visual Work instructions, Parts Classification, Installation, Preferences and Properties, etc.
  • Open minded, positive, can-do attitude
  • Ability to build trust with peers and help others when needed
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Accomplished Project Management and organizational skills
  • Expert in communication of all forms (written, verbal, 1:1, large groups) to any audience (internal, external, peers, executives, etc.).
 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as: 
·PTC Products:  Windchill, Creo, ThingWorx
·ERP Systems:  SAP ECC, SAP S/4
·Programming Skills:  Java, JavaScript, SQL

Minimum Qualifications

·Five years of experience working with Windchill and PLM business processes.

·Experience implementing Windchill SUMA for supplier management.
Experience working in an Agile (SCRUM) environment preferred

32476.title: ASIC Development Engineer
32476.description:
Myticas' direct client team is expanding and looking for highly motivated and experienced professional engineers to join us to develop next generation systems, in a very fast growing and competitive environment. All positions require a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.

Main responsibilities:

-Ability to develop state of the art electronic devices and IP for Optical communication
-Proven experience in the deep sub-micron silicon technologies
-Ability to work in multi-site international development team
-Design of ASIC devices for processing of optical signals

Skills:

-Masters degree or PhD in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or related discipline
-8+ years of demonstrated experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design
-Skills in VHDL\Verilog development and ASIC verification
-Experience in DSP and FEC design is preferred
-Experience in high speed analog design
-Analytical thinking and problem-solving
-Team work and ability to work with international teams in multiple time zones
-Communication
-Ability to communicate in English
32476.publicDescription:
Myticas' direct client is expanding and seeking highly motivated, experienced professional engineers to join in the development of next-generation systems within a fast-growing and competitive environment. Candidates must hold a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or possess equivalent experience.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Design and development of state-of-the-art electronic devices and intellectual property (IP) for optical communication systems
  • Demonstrated experience working with deep sub-micron silicon technologies
  • Collaboration within multi-site international development teams
  • Design of ASIC devices for optical signal processing

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree or Ph.D. in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or a related discipline
  • Minimum of 8 years of proven experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design
  • Proficiency in VHDL/Verilog development and ASIC verification
  • Preferred experience in digital signal processing (DSP) and forward error correction (FEC) design
  • Experience in high-speed analog design
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Effective teamwork and ability to collaborate with international teams across multiple time zones
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in English

34220.title: Application Project Manager
34220.description:
JOB ID#145367-Project Manager 3

BR: $109.65/hour_Local to Lansing, MI Only_Sub Due Date: 08/14/2025 

Duration: 12 Months+ Contract with Possible Extensions After

IMPORTANT NOTE: This resource will be working on a project associated with the Federal Government. The individual hired for this position will need to pass a high level, federal, Background and Fingerprint check in addition to our standard onboarding requirements.
  • Accepting local candidates within 2 hrs of Lansing, MI ONLY. Position will be hybrid, in office 2 days a week upon start and there is NO REMOTE ONLY option.
Top Skills & Years of Experience:
  • Strategic project oversight and accountability
  • Large-scale project execution (6+ months, 20+ team members)
  • Budget, scope, and schedule management
  • Executive-level communication and reporting
  • Risk and issue management
  • Long-term release and resource planning
  • Vendor coordination and contract oversight


Other Required Skills:
  • Leadership and team coordination
  • Strong verbal and written communication
  • Problem-solving and decision-making
  • Adaptability in dynamic environments
  • Relationship-building across diverse stakeholder groups


  • Job Summary:
    This role that the resource hired for this role will function mostly as an Application Project Manager versus an Infrastructure PM.
    The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills and a basic understanding of IT Application/infrastructure and how the IT components interact via network communications. (Firewall, VIP, F5 Listener, Port, etm.)  
    • Possess a basic understanding of IT infrastructure components, including networks, servers, storage, web and virtual/cloud environments.
    • Assist in evaluation of technical requirements and propose solutions that meet business objectives while adhering to SOM best practices and industry standards.
    • This position provides oversight, leadership, accountability, and project management functions for one or more large size, complex projects.
    • These projects typically utilize vendor participation and require complex schedules and integration with other systems.  
    • Large sized projects typically have durations longer than 6 months with 20 or more team members, require communication at the Agency Leadership level and have a medium to high risk.  

    This position will:
         • Ensure consistency with the client project management methodology (SUITE), investment management and systems engineering methodology.
         • Perform long-term release planning based on organizational direction.
         • Regularly interact with the project management teams for status of budget, quality, and schedule.
         • Escalate issues and risks as needed to executives and exercise project quality control activities to ensure project scope expectations are met.

32638.title: DevOps Technical Analyst
32638.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking a self-motivated Technical Analyst to support a long-term engagement with our non for profit client. This is a two-year contract opportunity ideal for a DevOps-savvy analyst with a strong foundation in system analysis and cloud/infrastructure operations. The ideal candidate will thrive in a collaborative environment, have a passion for automation and modern DevOps practices, and be eager to take ownership in a hands-on technical role.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage, maintain, and enhance cloud and on-premise environments

  • Implement and optimize CI/CD pipelines

  • Conduct system and integration analysis to ensure high performance and availability

  • Collaborate with development and infrastructure teams to support environment configuration and deployment

Qualifications:

Education:

  • Certifications such as AWS, ITIL, or similar are an asset

Experience:

  • 5+ years in system analysis, environment management, or software engineering

  • Experience with cloud platforms and managing hybrid infrastructure

  • Hands-on with DevOps tools and CI/CD processes

Technical Skills:

  • Proficient in APIs, RESTful services, and system integration

  • Skilled in containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)

  • Experience with version control tools (Git)

  • Scripting capabilities (Python, Bash)

  • Familiarity with monitoring and automation frameworks

Soft Skills:

  • Leadership qualities and ability to mentor others

  • Self-starter mindset with strong organizational abilities

34134.title: Google Cloud Practice Leader – Delivery Consulting
34134.description:
Overview
We are looking for a strategic and hands-on leader to spearhead our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) practice. This senior-level role is designed for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical delivery, client consulting, and business growth. You’ll be instrumental in shaping and scaling a high-performing GCP services organization—overseeing delivery excellence, building innovative cloud offerings, and enabling client success across industries.

This is an ideal opportunity for a consulting-oriented leader who not only understands the GCP ecosystem but is also energized by building teams, solutions, and long-term client relationships.

RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  • Practice Leadership & Growth
  • Build, scale, and oversee the GCP services practice with accountability for delivery success, client satisfaction, and team development.
  • Guide strategic initiatives and collaborate with cross-functional leaders to align cloud offerings with business priorities.
  • Technical Leadership
  • Serve as a senior technical authority for GCP engagements—able to lead architecture discussions and solution reviews without needing to operate at a granular API level.
  • Drive high-level design and implementation strategies, working closely with technical teams and client stakeholders.
  • Client Engagement & Delivery Oversight
  • Act as a trusted advisor for enterprise customers, helping them realize the value of GCP technologies within their digital transformation journeys.
  • Ensure best-in-class delivery execution across projects—owning accountability for timelines, outcomes, and quality standards.
  • Business Development & Sales Enablement
  • Support pre-sales activities including opportunity shaping, proposals, solutioning, and go-to-market efforts.
  • Partner with internal teams and external clients to evangelize service offerings and identify new revenue opportunities.
  • Innovation & Enablement
  • Develop reusable delivery frameworks, methodologies, and assets to accelerate service delivery.
  • Represent the GCP practice in external forums and internal strategy discussions—helping raise visibility and influence roadmaps.
    EXPERIENCE
    • 10+ years of experience in IT consulting, cloud delivery, or professional services environments.
    • Strong technical foundation in GCP, with a proven ability to guide architectural conversations and lead multi-disciplinary delivery teams.
    • Background in services delivery, including experience designing and scaling cloud-based solutions for enterprise clients.
    • Experience in client-facing roles, with excellent communication and stakeholder engagement capabilities.
    • Demonstrated ability to contribute to sales cycles—providing solution input, influencing outcomes, and driving growth.
    • Proven success in building service offerings and bringing new solutions to market.
    • A leadership style that emphasizes accountability, ownership, and collaboration.
    • Familiarity with Google Cloud partnerships, certification paths, and ecosystem programs is an asset.
    • Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or equivalent experience.

32661.title: Sharepoint Jira Systems Administrator Trainer
32661.description:
Max Bill Rate: $117.00

Job Title: Sharepoint/Jira Systems Administrator / Trainer
Location: Irvine, CA (Dupont Drive) – Hybrid (3 days onsite, 2 days remote)
Duration: 12+ months (possibility of extension)

Required Skills:

***2-4 years of experience with SharePoint, building sites or administration
***1-2 years of experience administering Atlassian products (primarily Confluence or Jira)
***Experience in leveraging tool APIs to build custom integrations (Slack API, Jira API etc.)
32661.publicDescription:
Location: Irvine, CA (Dupont Drive) - Hybrid - 3 days Onsite / 2 Remote
Contract: 1 year - based on performance and business needs

What are the top 3-5 skills, experience or education required for this position:
• 2-4 years of experience with SharePoint, building sites or administration
• 2-4 years professional experience in at least one of the following roles: Functional Systems Administrator / Configuration Manager / Solution Architect / Project Manager / Consultant / Trainer
• [Preferably] 1-2 years of experience administering Atlassian products (primarily Confluence or Jira)
• Effective interpersonal relationship building and influencing skills
• Ability to effectively communicate and partner with key stakeholders


Technical Systems Administrator / Trainer (Contractor)

We’re looking for a Contractor role for a Technical Systems Administrator / Trainer who will be responsible for the development, management, and operations of our SharePoint sites as well as help administer our Atlassian instance. This role is key in providing technical support, guidance, and mentoring for our cross functional team members. The Technical Systems Admin will work with users of the tools to support adoption, enhancements, use, and navigation of the solutions. They will also develop training materials and lead training sessions, promoting user onboarding and skillset development for the tools. They will proactively work with the different business units to identify needs and help create new processes and scale up existing ones.
The ideal candidate will have a strong background in SharePoint, Atlassian products and is interested in working in a high energy, creative, and collaborative environment. They enjoy wearing many hats, are a people-person and a problem solver.

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL
? Collaborate with Business Technology and Implementation partners to understand how AbbVie's SharePoint platform works and what areas of opportunity and customization are available.
? Working with the different business units to customize and build folder structures, SharePoint sites and help build a tools eco-system.
? Be the gatekeeper for our Atlassian and SharePoint instances with responsibility to ensure systems operation, content quality and implementation (and refinement) of processes and workflow adjustments
? Run weekly, monthly and ad hoc metric reports for management and business teams to measure systems performance and other KPIs
? Design workflows, standards, processes and set goals that will leverage the systems
? Translate business requirements into workflow improvements within the systems
? Gather input from user groups to assess potential integrations of additional platforms and tools
? Partner with IT professionals to ensure systems functions properly, updates are applied and tested, and new functionalities are tested and implemented.
? Manage special operations assignments, which can include but are not limited to training and development, project management, executing reporting
? Ongoing training of users and support of the systems
? Maintain relationships with tool vendors, specifically on technical support and training issues. Act as project point-of-contact for communication.
? Train team on proper usage and best practices of the systems

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
? 2-4 years of experience with SharePoint, building sites or administration
? 2-4 years professional experience in at least one of the following roles: Functional Systems Administrator / Configuration Manager / Solution Architect / Project Manager / Consultant / Trainer
? [Nice to have] 1-2 years of experience administering Atlassian products (primarily Confluence or Jira)
? [Nice to have] experience in leveraging tool APIs to build custom integrations (Slack API, Jira API etc.)
? Able to think creatively to build unique workflow and digital asset management solutions to address business needs
? Able to drive customer projects, manage timelines and personal workload
? A track record of planning, executing, and delivering results for complex and cross-functional projects
? Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to design, structure, and lead projects
? Effective interpersonal relationship building and influencing skills
? Ability to effectively communicate and partner with key stakeholders
? The ability to manage multiple priorities and work independently

32646.title: Systems Configuration Identification Specialist
32646.description:
Main Responsibilities

Configuration Identification

  • Support and coordinate activities to establish rules for configuration item (CI) selection and baseline content definition.

  • Assist in selecting configuration items at appropriate levels of the product structure, including determining required configuration documentation for each CI.

Asset and Physical Systems Configuration Management

  • Define, develop, and manage processes, procedures, and tools to identify, document, and control physical assets for a large-scale communications system.

  • Provide support for export control compliance processes such as ITAR.

  • Maintain an inventory of system assets (hardware).

  • Control and document system, hardware, and software configurations, including both "as-designed" and "as-built" baselines.

Software Configuration Management – Release Monitoring

  • Collaborate with technical teams and project management to define roles and responsibilities for configuration and release management.

  • Work with development, test environment, and verification teams to define and document processes for managing software releases.

  • For each release, verify required documentation is complete, approved, and captured, and ensure release packages are created in accordance with established procedures.

  • Confirm that pending or outstanding changes do not impact planned test or release activities.

  • Support development, lab, and test teams to ensure timely and accurate release execution.

  • Assist with impact assessments and update the CI Tree and related configuration documentation to reflect approved changes.

  • Support preparation and execution of configuration item status accounting and configuration audits.

  • Provide subject matter expertise on configuration management (CM) processes, standards, and systems.

  • Contribute to requirements management and traceability process documentation and improvement.

  • Develop training materials for CM identification, software/release management, and general CM procedures.

  • Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance CM process efficiency, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.

Document and Library Management Support

  • Initiate updates to documentation based on approved change requests.

  • Collaborate with document management personnel to track and complete implementation of documentation updates.

  • Ensure all released documents are logged, captured, and statused in the document management system.

  • Act as backup support for document management responsibilities when needed.

Education & Experience – Required

  • Bachelor’s or college degree in engineering, science, or a related field (or equivalent combination of education and experience).

  • 3–6 years of experience in an engineering design environment working with systems, hardware, software, and test teams.

  • 2+ years of experience in configuration and/or data management.

  • 2+ years of experience in release management.

  • Formal training, certification, or experience with CM standards (e.g., CM2, ANSI-EIA 649, ISO 10007).

Education & Experience – Assets

  • Experience with software configuration management tools and processes.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences.

  • Experience in high-performing, multidisciplinary development teams.

  • Collaborative, team-oriented, and self-driven.

  • Skilled in Microsoft Office at an intermediate level.

  • Bilingual in English and French is an asset (but not required).

34084.title: Cloud Site Reliability Engineer - Azure AWS
34084.description:
Cloud Site Reliability Engineer – AWS & Azure


Responsibilities
  • Oversee the design and improvement of infrastructure using SRE best practices, including IaC, recovery automation, and systems that detect and resolve issues independently.
  • Manage and fine-tune critical services across both cloud and on-prem environments: Kubernetes clusters, CI/CD pipelines, artifact registries, and custom workloads.
  • Enhance observability through intelligent logging, metrics, tracing, and alerting.  Ensuring systems are transparent and actionable in real time.
  • Champion automation by eliminating repetitive tasks, from deployment workflows to security audits, through scripting and tooling.
  • Elevate the developer experience for 80+ engineers and researchers by streamlining secure, reliable workflows across hybrid and cloud-native platforms.
  • Take ownership of IAM governance across platforms like Azure AD and AWS IAM. Implement lifecycle automation, auditing, and access controls.
  • Foster a culture of operational excellence with strong practices around security, incident management, and resilience engineering.
  • Act as a trusted partner to developers and researchers, enabling their speed and innovation without compromising stability.

Experience
  • Experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Systems Engineering within fast-paced, technically demanding environments.
  • Strong background in Linux systems and cloud infrastructure, with hands-on experience in AWS (primary) and Azure environments.
  • Solid command of Kubernetes and container orchestration in production environments.
  • Expertise in Infrastructure as Code tools such as Ansible, building reproducible, scalable infrastructure is second nature to you.
  • Deep experience in observability and incident response: you know how to set up effective monitoring, handle incidents, and lead blameless post-mortems.
  • A security-first mindset, especially when it comes to protecting distributed systems and developer workflows.
  • Proven ability to support and optimize CI/CD pipelines, container image builds, and artifact lifecycle management.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.  You build trust across teams and advocate for thoughtful, scalable solutions.
  • Bonus if you’ve worked with event-driven architectures using technologies like Kafka.

34082.title: Legal Analyst Attorney
34082.description:
Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis MN
Duration: 6+ month contract-to-Hire


NOTE: MUST HAVE, Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree.
 
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:
  • Prior experience in a legal services or legal invoice auditing environment.
  • Prior experience with direct communication with law firms in a legal billing context.
  • Experience with handling conflict with law firms, in writing and telephonically.
  • Highly developed communication skills, including both excellent written and verbal skills.
  • Firm grasp of the Federal and/or State Rules of Civil Procedure.
  • Insurance defense and civil litigation experience preferred.
  • Prior legal invoice auditing experience either in-house or with a third party legal invoice auditing company strongly preferred.
 
JOB SUMMARY:
The Legal Invoice Analyst for client, Fulfilment Center of Excellence will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE).  The Legal Bill Analysis (“LBA”) process involves the prompt, accurate and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices submitted by law firms and vendors of our clients. 
  
  • Strong understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Using sound discretion and legal expertise, analyze and condense legal service agreements to produce effective operational outputs meeting and in some cases exceeding customer expectations.
34082.publicDescription:
Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D. for a hybrid contract position.

Job Title: Legal Analyst/Attorney with J.D.
Work Location: Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week at either of locations - St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis MN

Duration: 6+ month contract-to-Hire


NOTE: MUST HAVE,
  1. Juris Doctor (J.D.) degree.
  2. Ability to review documents.
  
JOB SUMMARY:
The Legal Invoice Analyst for client, Fulfilment Center of Excellence will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE).   
  
  • Understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Using sound discretion and legal expertise, analyze and condense legal service agreements to produce effective operational outputs meeting and in some cases exceeding customer expectations.

32649.title: Ambulatory Clinical Informatics Analyst - Oracle Health Cerner
32649.description:
Our client is seeking an experienced Ambulatory Clinical Informatics Analyst to support the OPOR (One Person One Record) Program’s Ambulatory Portfolio. This role requires a strong background in Oracle Health (Cerner) and will involve collaboration with clinicians, project leadership, and Oracle Health consultants to design, configure, and translate clinical workflows.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Support ambulatory care design and configuration initiatives.

  • Facilitate strategy execution and knowledge translation to subject matter experts (SMEs).

  • Engage with clinicians to review and validate workflows.

  • Participate in organizational change management and co-facilitate design sessions.

  • Collaborate with Oracle Health consultants and internal project teams.

  • Identify risks/issues and contribute to resolution strategies.

  • Provide ongoing updates to OPOR project leadership.

Requirements:

  • Degree/diploma in a health-related discipline (or equivalent experience).

  • 5+ years of experience in a health-related field.

  • 2+ years in Clinical Informatics or supporting large-scale CIS implementations (Oracle Health/Cerner strongly preferred).

  • Deep understanding of ambulatory/medicine clinic workflows and interdisciplinary coordination.

  • Familiarity with healthcare terminology, CIS systems, and clinical transformation projects.

  • Ability to influence and collaborate with a range of stakeholders.

  • Excellent communication and documentation skills.

  • Strong problem-solving and process analysis capabilities.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior knowledge or experience working within the Nova Scotia Health OPOR program.

  • Graphic design/communications experience is a plus.

  • Background in change management or healthcare IT adoption initiatives.

Work Model:

  • Hybrid role with approximately 70% remote work.

  • Travel across Nova Scotia (up to 30%) as needed.

34110.title: Lead & Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps & Platform Engineering
34110.description:
Lead + Senior Machine Learning Engineer (MLOps & Platform Engineering)
We are seeking a highly experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join a fast-paced, client-facing environment focused on delivering scalable ML solutions. This role is hands-on and deeply technical, involving the modernization and migration of mature ML models within a complex production ecosystem. You’ll be leading architectural efforts, implementing robust MLOps practices, and supporting the integration of ML applications into SaaS platforms. Strong communication skills are essential, as the position requires regular collaboration with stakeholders and mentoring of junior team members.
This opportunity is open exclusively to candidates located in Canada with a solid background in production-grade ML engineering—not recent graduates.

Role/Responsibilities
Platform Engineering & MLOps
  • Architect and deliver ML pipelines end-to-end using tools like Databricks and MLflow.
  • Create and maintain large-scale data processing and feature engineering workflows within Databricks.
  • Automate and manage the full ML lifecycle: model training, testing, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Introduce CI/CD automation with platforms such as GitHub Actions or Azure DevOps.
  • Ensure high availability, security, and scalability across ML workflows.
  • Migrate models to SaaS environments and support cross-platform integrations.
Leadership & Collaboration
  • Act as a technical leader on ML-focused client engagements, driving delivery and alignment with business outcomes.
  • Translate strategic objectives into practical ML implementations and delivery roadmaps.
  • Partner with data scientists, engineers, and product stakeholders to embed ML models into production environments.
  • Mentor junior team members and champion ML engineering best practices across engagements.
ML Application Engineering
  • Convert experimental models into scalable, production-ready solutions.
  • Apply and optimize ML algorithms across a mix of structured and unstructured datasets.
  • Measure model performance, run experiments, and iterate for improvement.
  • Maintain documentation and contribute to internal knowledge-sharing frameworks.
  • Assist with the scale-up and migration of 25+ models in a production environment already housing over 100 ML models.

Experience
Mandatory
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field.
  • Strong academic and practical foundation in ML algorithms, distributed computing, and data engineering.
  • 5+ years in software/data/DevOps engineering roles, with 3+ years specifically in ML engineering or MLOps.
  • Demonstrated experience launching and managing machine learning solutions in production.
  • Expertise with Azure-based ecosystems (Azure ML, Data Lake, AKS, Azure DevOps).
  • Databricks proficiency is a must—especially working with Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark.
  • Advanced Python coding capabilities and experience with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools and infrastructure-as-code frameworks (e.g., Terraform).
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada and currently residing in the country.
Nice to Have
  • Certifications in Azure or Databricks (e.g., Databricks Certified Professional, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solution Architect).
  • Exposure to LLMs and frameworks like Transformers, TRL, or DeepSpeed.
  • Background in migrating ML models to SaaS platforms.
  • Prior experience in a consulting role, with a track record of effective client engagement.
