  • Ensure high availability, security, and scalability across ML workflows.
  • Migrate models to SaaS environments and support cross-platform integrations.
Leadership & Collaboration
  • Act as a technical leader on ML-focused client engagements, driving delivery and alignment with business outcomes.
  • Translate strategic objectives into practical ML implementations and delivery roadmaps.
  • Partner with data scientists, engineers, and product stakeholders to embed ML models into production environments.
  • Mentor junior team members and champion ML engineering best practices across engagements.
ML Application Engineering
  • Convert experimental models into scalable, production-ready solutions.
  • Apply and optimize ML algorithms across a mix of structured and unstructured datasets.
  • Measure model performance, run experiments, and iterate for improvement.
  • Maintain documentation and contribute to internal knowledge-sharing frameworks.
  • Assist with the scale-up and migration of 25+ models in a production environment already housing over 100 ML models.

Experience
Mandatory
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a closely related technical field.
  • Strong academic and practical foundation in ML algorithms, distributed computing, and data engineering.
  • 5+ years in software/data/DevOps engineering roles, with 3+ years specifically in ML engineering or MLOps.
  • Demonstrated experience launching and managing machine learning solutions in production.
  • Expertise with Azure-based ecosystems (Azure ML, Data Lake, AKS, Azure DevOps).
  • Databricks proficiency is a must—especially working with Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark.
  • Advanced Python coding capabilities and experience with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools and infrastructure-as-code frameworks (e.g., Terraform).
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in Canada and currently residing in the country.
Nice to Have
  • Certifications in Azure or Databricks (e.g., Databricks Certified Professional, Microsoft Certified: Azure Solution Architect).
  • Exposure to LLMs and frameworks like Transformers, TRL, or DeepSpeed.
  • Background in migrating ML models to SaaS platforms.
  • Prior experience in a consulting role, with a track record of effective client engagement.

32662.title: D365 Trainer - SharePoint
32662.description:
Our client is seeking a highly experienced D365 Trainer with SharePoint expertise to support a national training and information management initiative. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Microsoft 365 (D365), SharePoint (on-premise and online), and experience in developing training programs, videos, and instructional content for users across varied departments and time zones. 
Mandatory Active SECRET clearance

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver training videos and step-by-step guides for users on SharePoint (on-premise) and Defence 365 features.

  • Build and maintain a SharePoint Online Training site with how-to content, videos, and best practices.

  • Conduct training sessions for new Site Owners using training packages and sandbox environments.

  • Collaborate with the Communications (CO) and Information Management (IM) teams to design onboarding/orientation training for new team members.

  • Design and deploy Power Apps for automating team member intake forms and leadership processes.

  • Create an internal Wiki with approval workflows to replace DWAN-only resources on D365.

  • Support users in navigating the Microsoft Tenant environment post-launch.

  • Perform daily web administration for over 1,200 SharePoint sites.

  • Lead biweekly Information Management Working Groups and L1/L2 sessions to distribute updates and training.

  • Host monthly deployed Information Management sessions for field IMOs.

Qualifications:

  • Proven expertise in D365 and SharePoint (Online & On-Premise)

  • Experience in instructional design and e-learning/training video creation

  • Strong experience with Power Apps and workflow automation

  • Comfortable presenting to and training users of varying technical skill levels

  • Ability to manage and administer large-scale SharePoint environments

  • Active SECRET clearance required

32655.title: Workflow Application Engineer
32655.description:
We are seeking a Workflow Applications Engineer. This role bridges engineering and operations, requiring technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for continuous learning. You will design, develop, and implement efficient, automated workflows across a variety of platforms and applications, ensuring smooth integration, optimized performance, and high customer satisfaction.
Essential Functions
  • Design and implement automated workflows tailored to customer requirements.
  • Develop and deliver reliable, scalable solutions using object-oriented principles and API integrations.
  • Program using proprietary tools based on Java and other scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including software engineering, product, and customer service to gather requirements and identify automation opportunities.
  • Ensure seamless integration across cloud and on-premise systems and applications.
  • Monitor application performance for availability and troubleshoot workflow issues as needed.
  • Clearly communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Maintain comprehensive documentation of workflows, codebases, and technical solutions.
  • Manage multiple concurrent projects, tasks, and requests in a dynamic environment.
Requirements
Required Qualifications and Skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience.
  • Strong grasp of object-oriented programming and coding fundamentals.
  • Hands-on experience with APIs, integrations, scripting, and command-line tools in Linux/Unix environments.
  • Proficient in Java or scripting languages such as Python or Bash.
  • Experience working with XML and JSON data formats.
  • Excellent debugging, testing, and troubleshooting capabilities.
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  • Familiarity with workflow automation tools and platforms.
  • Proven ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail in multitasking environments.
Preferred Experience
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP and related virtualization strategies.
  • Experience with databases such as PostgreSQL and Elasticsearch.
  • Background in technical support, solution architecture, or project management.
  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies or startup environments.
  • Experience in the media, entertainment, publishing, or digital media sectors.
Additional Requirements
  • Availability for occasional work during weekends, nights, or early mornings.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with a customer-focused mindset.
  • Enthusiasm for continuous learning and adapting to emerging technologies.

34107.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - MLOps & Platform Engineering
34107.description:
We’re currently seeking a seasoned Machine Learning Engineer who thrives at the intersection of data science, engineering, and operations. This role is ideal for someone who has not only mastered the craft of building and scaling ML solutions, but also knows how to put them into production, and keep them running smoothly.

What You’ll Be Doing:

The role is a mix of MLOps, platform development, and hands-on model engineering. You’ll be responsible for designing automated workflows that take ML models from development to deployment with minimal friction. This includes developing robust CI/CD pipelines (preferably using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions) and managing model lifecycle tasks such as versioning, monitoring, and retraining.

A large portion of your time will be spent working within Databricks—developing feature pipelines, optimizing model workflows, and integrating ML components with existing SaaS systems. You’ll also help migrate and scale models within an environment already hosting over 100 ML models, with another 25+ targeted for transition.

On the application side, you’ll work closely with data scientists to productionalize machine learning prototypes. You’ll select appropriate algorithms, build scalable ML systems using Python-based frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, and help tune and evaluate performance over time.

The Ideal Candidate Brings:
  • 5+ years of experience in software, data, or DevOps engineering roles—with at least 3 of those focused on MLOps or ML engineering.
  • Expertise in Python, and confidence working with key ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
  • Hands-on experience working in the Microsoft Azure ecosystem—particularly Azure ML, AKS, and Azure DevOps.
  • Deep familiarity with Databricks (including Delta Lake, MLflow, and Apache Spark) is non-negotiable.
  • An understanding of infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform), version control, and CI/CD practices in ML workflows.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally across technical and business teams.
  • You must be located in Canada and able to work with Canadian teams.

Additional:
  • Certifications from Databricks or Microsoft (e.g., Azure Solution Architect).
  • Experience working with LLM libraries or frameworks like transformers, trl, or deepspeed.
  • Prior involvement in ML model migration projects or SaaS ML platform integration.
  • A consulting background or client-facing role where clear communication and stakeholder management were key.

34132.title: Privileged Access Management - PAM – BeyondTrust SMR
34132.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking a Privileged Access Management (PAM) Subject Matter Resource (SMR) specializing in BeyondTrust Password Safe for a 3-month contract engagement with a leading client in the engineering and construction industry.

The ideal candidate will have deep technical expertise in PAM technologies, particularly in implementing and managing BeyondTrust solutions, as well as a strong understanding of identity governance frameworks.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement and manage BeyondTrust Password Safe solutions

  • Onboard and integrate applications with BeyondTrust (must have)

  • Ensure compliance with security protocols and governance frameworks

  • Collaborate with IT and security teams to manage privileged access

  • Support governance initiatives and best practices related to PAM

  • (Nice to have) Support and manage CyberArk Self-Hosted solutions

Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in PAM or related cybersecurity roles

  • Strong hands-on experience with BeyondTrust Password Safe

  • Proven experience with application onboarding using BeyondTrust

  • Deep understanding of IAM principles and PAM governance frameworks

  • Familiarity with CyberArk Self-Hosted is a strong asset

Certifications (Required/Preferred):

  • BeyondTrust BCIE – Password Safe Certification (Mandatory)

  • CyberArk CDE – Self-Hosted Certification (Preferred)

34099.title: Mid level Business Systems Analyst
34099.description:
Bill Rate: $100.00hr

Myticas direct client is seeking Mid level Business Systems Analyst for a 6 month contract role. This is 100% remote

Duration: 6 months (with a possibility of extension)

Job Description Summary: 
The Business Systems Analyst will provide direct support to the Crown Jewels program within Information Security Risk Management. This individual will apply relevant principles to support projects and ongoing activities.

Required Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree plus 3-5 years technical experience in Business Systems Analysis.
Strong experience with Jira and Sharepoint.
• Exceptional interpersonal and communication and strong analytical skills.
•Proven ability to build trust, listen and ask effective questions.
• Proven track record of effective project leadership and positive results.
•Ability to self-manage time and priorities.
34099.publicDescription:
Job Title: ISRM-Business Systems Analyst
Location: 100% remote
Duration: 6 months (with a possibility of extension)

Description

The Business Systems Analyst will provide direct support to the Crown Jewels program within Information Security Risk Management. This individual will apply relevant principles to support projects and ongoing activities.

 

Responsibilities: Office of Crown Jewels

• Applies analytical thinking skills to diagnose and make recommendations on systems. Incorporates knowledge of business and technology to make recommendations. Translates data gathered from user discussions into business requirements.

• Identifies business/system needs and recommends solutions. Assists with the testing strategies and develops preliminary findings. Work is performed and technical decisions are made with a high degree of independence and performance is judged by results obtained.

• Manages Crown Jewel asset lifecycle including onboarding and offboarding processes

• Maps and updates Crown Jewels data flows

• Uses appropriate tools to collect, correlate and analyze data; records and maintains technical data for use in developing operating and instruction manuals. Conducts tests; develops preliminary findings for review by experienced analysts.

• Assists in the development of standards and procedures. Prepares written reports of work. Applies and executives’ standard information systems theories, concepts, and techniques.

• Determines approach and solution to problem when issue is within scope of own ability. Develops solutions to problems where casual relationships can be identified, and precedents exist.

• Train others when needed.

• Works effectively with team/group to accomplish organizational goals. Actively participates in client or team meetings by offering suggestions. Provides leadership to project planning.

• Monitors and organizes the efforts of technical and business support staff. Manages projects according to milestones and completes tasks assigned by more experienced analysts and managers. Guides the efforts of less experienced staff.

• Exercises latitude in approach to problem and solution. Work is reviewed for soundness of business judgment and to determine if overall results and objectives have been achieved.

• Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

•

Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree plus 5 years technical experience, or Masters degree plus 4 years experience preferably in Business Systems Analysis or Cybersecurity

• Systems Testing and IT Implementation experience.

• Exceptional interpersonal and communication and strong analytical skills. Proven ability to build trust, listen and ask effective questions.

• Proven track record of effective project leadership and positive results. Ability to self-manage time and priorities.

34100.title: Associate Business Systems Consultant
34100.description:
Bill Rate: $98.50hr

Myticas direct client is seeking Associate Business Systems Consultant at South San Francisco, CA (Hybrid-3 days onsite)

Duration: 12 months (with a possibility of extension)

Required Qualifications/Experience:

  • Bachelor’s Degree with 6 years’ experience; Master’s Degree with 5 years’ experience; PhD with 0 years’ experience.
  • Pharma familiar and life science awareness
  • Linux and cloud familiarity

Job Description Summary: 

Experienced Business Systems Consultant to work across multiple business areas (Precision Medicine, Genomic Research Center & Corporate Business & Strategy OIice) gathering requirements, helping the business to form strategy roadmaps and providing

informal project management duties.
Default point of contact for BTS with the business; brokers contracts between BTS and the business and resolves client and BTS relationship issues.
Manages and provides expert advice on, the selection, design, justification, implementation and business use of information systems. Analyzes business processes; elicits, analyzes, and documents business requirements; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility and makes recommendations typically seeking to exploit and leverage new or existing technology components.
Translates business requirements into functional requirements; performs data and process modeling; manages change; and leads, coordinates / performs testing, verification, and validation of requirements.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Elicits and communicates the organization’s business strategy; works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy.
  • Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.
  • Identifies current and emerging business needs and evaluates alternative technology solutions using standard information systems methodologies and best practices.
  • Proactively seek out strategic business opportunities with business unit executives for the application of new or existing technology capabilities.
  • Develops technology strategies that meet the requirements of the business. Identifies the business benefits of alternative strategies. Ensures compliance between business
  • strategies and technology directions. Prepares testing plans to confirm that requirements and system design are accurate and complete.
  • Conducts training. Identify process disconnects and translate them into improvement opportunities with cost savings or avoidance, productivity improvements, or revenue generating business benefits. Develops business relationships and integrates activities with other BTO's to ensure successful implementation and support of project eIorts.
  • Manages relationships between clients involved and BTOs to assure eIective communication between the groups is occurring. Brokers services within BTS community on behalf of customers; coordinates system solutions.
  • Allies with other BTS functional areas to remain current on project status, and inform customer management of progress; conversely, keeps BTS managers aware of user issues and resolves conflicts.
  • Identifies the impact of any relevant statutory, internal or external regulations on the organization's use of information.
  • Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives of assignment. Has defined authority and responsibility for a significant area of work, including technical, financial and quality aspects. Establishes organizational objectives and delegates assignments.
  • Accountable for actions and decisions taken by self and subordinates.
  • Accountable for the accuracy of the fit of the proposed solution to the business needs and the information upon which the business justification and prioritization decisions are made. Also accountable for communicating the business need and drivers to development groups to assure the implementation phase can fulfill the business need.

32659.title: Drupal Developer
32659.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Drupal Developer who would be interested in a long-term remote contract opportunity offered within Canada (originally headquartered in Ottawa, ON).

Previous experience required:

  • Experience building web applications in the Drupal (7) CMS
  • Understands key server-side web development concepts through experiences such as:
  • Interpreting graphic visual or interaction designs in HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  • Creating visually appealing web pages or interfaces.
  • Creating, editing or modifying templates for a CMS or web development framework.
  • Programming interaction with JavaScript and/or a lipary such as jQuery, YUI or Prototype.
  • Testing cross-powser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies.
  • Testing for compliance to specified standards such as accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0) in the clients region or domain.
  • Conducting observational user testing, or reviewing designs against usability heuristics.
  • Domain specific knowledge or transferable skills
  • Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.
  • HTML
    • Familiarity of HTML syntax for multiple specifications, including HTML 5.
    • Knowledge of the semantic meaning of all HTML elements.
    • Familiarity with the semantic markup for display of lists, tabular data, forms, articles, etc.
    • Knowledge of markup used for layout such as dividers.
    • Knowledge at the level to be able to hand-code markup.
    • Including media and images.
  • PHP
    • Familiarity with modifying Drupal Theme hooks to display data
    • Understanding how to utilize PHP to filter, process and output html, json, xml
  • CSS
    • Specifying different CSS for various media, devices and displays.
    • Best practices in CSS file organization and structure.
    • Methods for including CSS inline, internal and external via linked style sheets.
    • How to define, combine and group CSS selectors for HTML elements, ID, classes, pseudo classes, child or sibling.
    • Syntax of CSS declarations, properties and attributes.
    • CSS box model and methods for CSS positioning, absolute and relative.
    • Knowledge of properties and attributes to control the display.
    • Familiarity with differences in CSS 2 and CSS 3.
    • Proficient with a CSS Preprocessor such as Sass or LESS.
  • Best practices
    • Drupal standards and modules
    • Methods to ensure powser & device compatibility
    • Methods for degrading gracefully for older powsers and displays.
    • Methods to ensure accessibility.
    • File compression techniques for improving speed.
  • JavaScript
    • Knowledge of the operators, variables, datatypes, objects, properties and methods.

    • Familiarity with development and debugging tools for cross-powser issues.

32659.publicDescription:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Drupal Developer who would be interested in a long-term remote contract opportunity offered within Canada (originally headquartered in Ottawa, ON).

Previous experience required:

  • Experience building web applications in the Drupal (7) CMS
  • Understands key server-side web development concepts through experiences such as:
  • Interpreting graphic visual or interaction designs in HTML, CSS and Javascript.
  • Creating visually appealing web pages or interfaces.
  • Creating, editing or modifying templates for a CMS or web development framework.
  • Programming interaction with JavaScript and/or a lipary such as jQuery, YUI or Prototype.
  • Testing cross-powser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies.
  • Testing for compliance to specified standards such as accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0) in the clients region or domain.
  • Conducting observational user testing, or reviewing designs against usability heuristics.
  • Domain specific knowledge or transferable skills
  • Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.

    • Familiarity of HTML syntax for multiple specifications, including HTML 5.

32629.title: High Speed Analog Principal Engineer
32629.description:
Our client is seeking a Principal Engineer - High Speed IC Research & Development. This role offers the opportunity to contribute to the development of high-performance analog ICs  that enable next-generation communication networks.

Responsibilities:
  • Design, lay out, and bring up ultra high-speed analog ICs
  • Drive the development and validation of custom ICs for high-capacity networking systems
  • Collaborate with verification, CAD, product, and test engineering teams to define and execute DVT and characterization plans
  • Evaluate and optimize circuit performance using RF probing and lab tools
Qualifications:
  • Proven experience designing high-speed analog ICs using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS
  • Solid grasp of transmission lines, passive high-frequency structures, and device physics
  • Hands-on skills with RF lab equipment and analog IC evaluation
  • Familiarity with VerilogA and CAD scripting languages (Skill, Python, Shell) is a plus
  • Strong communication and teamwork abilities
  • Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of relevant experience
  • Master’s degree with 3+ years
  • PhD candidates welcomed
Location:
Hybrid, United States

32628.title: Lead Custom Analog Layout Engineeer
32628.description:
Our client is seeking a Lead Custom Analog Layout Engineer to support the development of high-performance analog and mixed-signal ICs for next-generation communication and data center systems. In this hybrid U.S.-based role, you'll collaborate closely with circuit designers to ensure optimal layout quality, performance, and delivery timelines.

Responsibilities:
  • Partner with circuit designers to optimize block- and chip-level floorplans.
  • Perform daily layout editing, verification (DRC/LVS), and quality checks using industry-standard tools.
  • Apply best practices and efficient layout methodologies to streamline design cycles.
  • Contribute to chip-level integration, including P&R and top-level planning.
Key Qualifications:
  • Extensive experience using layout tools such as Cadence Virtuoso and/or Laker.
  • Proficiency in DRC/LVS/ERC verification flows (e.g., Calibre, PVS, IC Validator).
  • Solid understanding of layout challenges including IR drop, EM, RC delay, crosstalk, self-heating, and analog matching techniques.
  • Hands-on experience designing layouts for precision analog blocks like SD-ADC, SAR-ADC, bandgaps, and regulators.
  • Familiarity with analog design methodologies and layout constraints.
  • Experience with RC extraction and EM/IR analysis is a plus.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional, distributed teams.
Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience.
  • 10+ years of experience in analog/mixed-signal layout design.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

32627.title: Mixed Signal IC Design Engineer
32627.description:
Our client is seeking a Lead Mixed-Signal IC Design Engineer- High-Speed Circuits to join a cutting-edge team building advanced analog and mixed-signal IP for next-generation communications and data center systems.

Responsibilities:
  • Design, implement, and simulate high-speed analog blocks such as ADCs, DACs, and PLLs.
  • Optimize floorplans, supervise layout teams, and provide layout guidance (including hands-on layout work when needed).
  • Evaluate and select circuit topologies to meet stringent performance goals in terms of power, area, linearity, and bandwidth.
  • Develop test plans and collaborate with product and test engineering teams for validation and characterization.
  • Follow established design flows and contribute to process improvements.
  • Model analog circuits using Verilog-A/AMS for system-level simulations.
Key Qualifications:
  • Strong experience with CAD tools: Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre, Incisive, Calibre, EMX, Totem EM/IR.
  • Proven track record designing and bringing to production high-speed analog/mixed-signal IPs in deep submicron CMOS (e.g., high-speed ADCs, DACs, low-jitter PLLs).
  • In-depth understanding of analog circuit methodologies, layout effects, and device physics.
  • Experience with behavioral modeling (Verilog-A/AMS).
  • Ability to work collaboratively with distributed design teams.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and effective communication.
  • Experience with Matlab and/or optical communication theory is a plus.
Education & Experience:
  • M.S. in Electrical Engineering with 12+ years of experience, or
  • Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering with 8+ years of experience.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

32626.title: Senior Mixed -Signal ASIC Design Engineer
32626.description:
Our client is seeking a Senior Mixed-Signal ASIC Design Engineer to join a dynamic team working on next-generation integrated circuits for high-performance communication and data center applications.


Responsibilities:
  • Design and simulate high-resolution data converters (DACs/ADCs) and low-power analog circuits such as bandgap references, opamps, and output buffers.
  • Develop layout floorplans, supervise layout activities, and provide clear guidance to layout engineers (hands-on layout work may be required).
  • Create analog test plans and collaborate with product/test engineering teams for characterization and validation.
  • Follow established design methodologies and release processes to ensure product quality and consistency.
  • Model circuit behavior using Verilog-A/AMS for design verification.
Key Qualifications:
  • Strong expertise with analog/mixed-signal design tools (Cadence Virtuoso, Spectre, Layout XL, Mentor AFS, Calibre).
  • Proven experience in taking data converters from design to production.
  • In-depth understanding of CMOS and high-voltage (BCD) design, layout effects, and ESD protection.
  • Skilled in circuit analysis, device physics, and analog design methodology.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional, distributed teams.
  • Capable of mentoring junior engineers and independently resolving complex design challenges.
Education & Experience:
  • Staff Design Engineer: M.S. in Electrical Engineering with 8+ years of experience or Ph.D. with 8+ years.
  • Principal Design Engineer: M.S. with 12+ years or Ph.D. with 12+ years of experience.
Location:
Hybrid – United States

32625.title: Principal ASIC Verification Engineer
32625.description:
Our client is seeking a Principal ASIC Verification Engineer to join a high-performing team developing leading-edge technology for next-generation optical networks and data centers.

Responsibilities:
  • Drive the development of verification infrastructure using SystemVerilog and UVM.
  • Create protocol/traffic generators, checkers, and testbenches aligned with functional and standards-based requirements.
  • Define and implement test plans at the block and sub-chip levels for advanced digital ASICs.
  • Develop and execute self-checking test environments to ensure thorough validation.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a geographically distributed environment.
  • Optionally lead small teams or verification efforts for key deliverables.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
  • 10+ years of experience in ASIC verification with hands-on expertise in UVM and SystemVerilog.
  • Solid knowledge of assertions, functional and code coverage, and formal verification tools.
  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.
  • Experience with DSP and/or FEC is a plus.
Location:
Hybrid – Canada

32624.title: High-Speed Analog ASIC Engineer
32624.description:
Our client is seeking a talented High-Speed Analog ASIC Engineer to join their innovative team building next-generation >100Gbaud integrated circuits for high-performance data center and communication products.

Responsibilities:
  • Lead the design, layout, and bring-up of ultra-high-speed analog ICs.
  • Contribute to all phases of IC development, including validation and characterization.
  • Collaborate with verification, CAD, product, and test engineering teams to execute design verification test (DVT) plans.
  • Support product performance evaluation and refinement in the lab environment.
Required Skills and Experience:
  • Experience designing high-speed analog ICs using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies.
  • Solid understanding of transmission lines and high-frequency passive structures.
  • Strong grasp of device physics and its impact on analog performance.
  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing and lab evaluation of high-speed ICs.
  • Familiarity with VerilogA and scripting (Skill, Python, shell) is an asset.
  • Effective communicator and strong team player.
Qualifications:
  • BS in Electrical Engineering or related field with 5+ years of relevant experience
  • MS with 3+ years of experience
  • PhD in a related field (experience level flexible)
Location:
Hybrid – United States

32623.title: Senior ASIC Design & Product Integration Engineer
32623.description:
Our client is seeking a Senior ASIC Design and Product Integration Engineer to join their team working on cutting-edge ASIC technology.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Translate high-level system requirements into detailed IC specifications.
  • Drive ASIC design validation, performance evaluation, and reliability testing.
  • Serve as the technical liaison between ASIC designers and hardware integration teams.
  • Manage the delivery of prototype silicon for validation and analysis.
  • Perform statistical data analysis on large datasets to assess and enhance IC performance.
  • Troubleshoot silicon issues and drive resolution collaboratively with design teams.
  • Support manufacturing ramp-up with yield, capability, and supply planning assessments.
  • Develop technical documentation and application notes for IC integration support.Hands-on experience in analog ASIC product or application engineering, across multiple product development cycles.
Required Skills and Qualifications:
  • Strong understanding of analog circuit behavior and device physics, with a proven track record in failure analysis and performance optimization.
  • Proficiency in statistical data analysis and large dataset handling.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams.
  • Programming and process development experience is a strong asset.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Physics.
  • MS with 4+ years, or PhD with 2+ years of relevant experience in analog ASIC product or application engineering.
Location:
Hybrid, United States.

32569.title: IP Network Architect
32569.description:
The Senior IP Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the Network design and works with internal teams and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the program.
Networking
  • Lead the design of complex IP network architectures, considering business requirements, scalability, and performance.
  • Possess a strong command of network platforms and appliances, including routers, switches, firewalls, SDWAN controllers, IPSEC VPN gateways, and deep packet inspection tools.
  • In coordination with the Network and System Engineering teams attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for Network Engineering related activities.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for network equipment deployment and operation.
  • Develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, service validation and product demonstrations in lab.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, OSPF, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Maintain familiarity with transport network technologies including Segment Routing (SR-MPLS) and Software Defined Networking (SDN).
  • Assess, evaluate, and recommend network platforms and appliances, hardware, and software solutions to meet business requirements.
  • Represent the Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements.
Security and Compliance
  • Security and Compliance:
  • Design and implement secure network solutions with a focus on firewall configurations, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection techniques.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and best practices for network security.
  • Optimization and Performance:
  • Continuously monitor network performance, analyzing metrics and conducting assessments to identify bottlenecks, vulnerabilities, and areas for improvement. Develop strategies to optimize network performance, enhance security, and ensure high availability.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance network performance and reliability.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Emerging Technologies:
  • Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to IP networking and network appliances.
  • Proactively recommend and lead the adoption of new technologies that align with business goals.
Vendor Management
  • Collaborate with vendors to evaluate products, negotiate contracts, and ensure the successful deployment and operation of network appliances.
  • Technical Leadership:
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to junior network engineers, sharing your expertise and promoting professional growth.
  • Troubleshooting and Support:
  • Lead in-depth troubleshooting and root cause analysis of network issues, providing timely and effective resolutions.
Education & Experience
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field or equivalent work experience.
  • 10+ years of progressive experience in designing and architecting IP networks, with a focus on routing, firewalls, SDWAN, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection.
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Professional certifications such as CCIE, CCNP, CISSP or equivalent are highly desirable.
  • Expertise in network appliance evaluation, selection, and integration.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience with network troubleshooting, performance optimization, and security enhancement.
  • Strong knowledge of industry-leading routing protocols, firewall technologies, SDWAN solutions, IPSEC VPNs, and deep packet inspection methods.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Leadership experience and the ability to mentor junior team members.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.
Working Conditions
  • Working conditions are generally comfortable typical of an office environment with occasional work within Data Centres.
  • Occasional international travel is anticipated.

32513.title: Software Architect – System Model Application
32513.description:
Software Architect – System Model Application

Our Software Development team architects, develops, tests, and maintains a state-of-the-art engineering software tool that runs on high-performance computing (HPC) infrastructure. This application is designed to model resource allocation and end-to-end communication system performance for a next-generation satellite constellation.

As a Software Architect, the selected candidate will play a key leadership role in the software’s development, productization, and ongoing maintenance. This position provides critical day-to-day technical direction to team members, fostering a cohesive and productive development environment. The Software Architect will also collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with organizational goals.

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead the design, development, and deployment of the System Model suite, enhancing its readiness as a production-grade engine for operational business applications running in HPC environments—both cloud-based and on-premise.

  • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and support to the development team, encouraging innovation and collaboration.

  • Develop and propose solutions to complex technical challenges, including recommendations on software architecture and technology stacks.

  • Collaborate with system engineers, product owners, and testing teams to gather requirements and deliver robust software solutions.

  • Produce clear technical documentation for internal stakeholders and external collaborators.

Education and Experience Required

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

  • Extensive hands-on experience in software development.

  • Prior experience in a technical leadership or architecture role.

  • Proficiency in programming languages including C/C++, Golang, Java, Python, SQL, and Bash.

  • Experience with tools and technologies such as Kubernetes (including Helm charts), Terraform, Packer, Ansible, containerization, and secret management (e.g., Azure Key Vault, HashiCorp Vault).

  • Familiarity with Azure Cloud services, including fundamentals, IAM, and networking.

  • Experience with Matlab and related best practices is an asset.

  • Comfortable working within Agile development environments.

  • Experience with cluster job managers.

  • Background in satellite or communication systems is beneficial but not required.

  • 10+ years of professional experience in software development or system architecture.

Additional Skills and Abilities

  • Strong problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.

  • Collaborative team player who fosters a positive, innovative team environment.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Proven ability to effectively engage with stakeholders, engineering teams, and partners.

  • Solid understanding of the business context and constraints of software system design and deployment.

  • Ability to manage competing priorities and project demands.

  • Passion for learning and working with complex systems and technologies.

  • Fluency in English (written and spoken); French is an asset.

34098.title: Cyber Posture Management Analyst
34098.description:
Job Purpose

 

The Cyber Posture Mgmt. Analyst I, as a part of Jackson Information Security & Privacy, provides security analysis for the company's Identity and Access Management (IAM) Operation's program. This role requires knowledge across multiple platforms, applications, processes, and procedures to enable access management of business initiatives across the enterprise.

 

Essential Responsibilities

 

  • Familiar with identity and access management, with a focus on Privileged Access Management (PAM), Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).

  • Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Python) for automation and customization of IAM solutions.

  • Understanding of identity protocols and technologies: OpenID Connect (OIDC,) OAuth, SAML, AD-Fed, API Gateways, SCIM, and platforms such as, Sailpoint, CyberArk, and MS Entra.

  • Knowledge of identity & access management vulnerabilities, threats and mitigations.

  • Ability to determine how a security system works (including its resilience and dependability capabilities) and how changes in conditions, operations, or the environment will affect these outcomes.

  • Familiar with modern software life cycle development and automated cloud infrastructure deployment.

  • Understanding of network architecture, operating systems, and security protocols.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

  • Supports initiatives and projects that will improve the organization’s cyber posture.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

  • Understanding of security controls, risk management, and regulatory compliance (NIST CSF/SOX/GDPR/etc.).

 

Other Duties

 

  • Extended hours, including on-call may be required.

  • Performs other duties and/or projects as assigned.

 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

 

  • Ability to receive and incorporate feedback.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Strong attention to detail.

  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

  • Flexibility in day-to-day work.

  • Ability to learn the company’s supported systems and their interfaces with other systems.

  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft software applications.

  • Ability to communicate technical concepts in an understandable fashion.

  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and execute efficiently and effectively while demonstrating a clear sense of urgency when appropriate.

  • Excellent customer service focus and skills.

  • Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment to achieve desired results.

  • Scripting knowledge preferred.

 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience and/or education required.

  • 1+ years knowledge of financial products, regulatory requirements, and business process preferred.

  • Cloud Identity experience preferred.

  • SC-300 Microsoft Certified Identity and Access Administrator Associate preferred.

  • CISSP Certified Information Systems Security Professional preferred.

34105.title: MuleSoft Developer & Integration Consultant
34105.description:
Our client is seeking a seasoned MuleSoft Developer & Integration Consultant to join their Integration and Data Management team. The successful candidate will be responsible for redesigning an existing integration model by introducing MuleSoft to interact with SAP systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to redesign integration architecture

  • Develop and implement MuleSoft solutions using Anypoint Platform

  • Build APIs, configure schedulers, and design event-based integration patterns

  • Leverage DataWeave for complex data mapping, transformation, and design

  • Integrate SAP systems with MuleSoft for seamless data exchange

  • Participate in Agile delivery cycles and contribute to architectural planning

  • Support CI/CD processes and version control using modern DevOps tools

Required Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in integration development roles

  • 4+ years of hands-on experience with MuleSoft Anypoint Platform

  • Expertise in MuleSoft APIs, configuration, customization, and patterns

  • Strong proficiency with DataWeave for advanced data mapping

  • Demonstrated experience integrating SAP using MuleSoft

  • Solid understanding of integration architecture and methodologies

  • Proven success delivering large-scale enterprise projects in Agile environments

  • Technical background in Java, HTML, XML, Kafka, GitHub Actions, Confluence, Jira

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field

Nice-to-Have:

  • MuleSoft Certified Developer – Level 1 or Level 2

Additional Notes:

  • Preference for candidates located in Calgary with hybrid availability (3 days/week onsite)

  • Remote candidates across Canada will also be considered if not based in Calgary

34125.title: Financial/Cost Specialist – Real Property (Intermediate & Senior)
34125.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking intermediate and senior-level Financial/Cost Specialists to support a contract with a Federal Government department. These specialists will provide financial and cost analysis services in support of Real Property (RP) projects.

Mandatory Requirements:

  • Intermediate: Minimum 3 years of experience (within the last 10 years) preparing value-for-money calculations for real property projects using Monte Carlo Simulation.

  • Senior: Minimum 5 years of experience (within the last 10 years) preparing value-for-money calculations for real property projects using Monte Carlo Simulation.

Real Property Projects include leases, fit-ups, construction, renovation, and remediation of buildings, land, or infrastructure.
Monte Carlo Simulation: a risk analysis model used to predict probability and uncertainty in cost forecasting.

Point-Rated Criteria:
Experience with the following for real property projects valued over $20M (CAD, taxes included):

  • Identifying and analyzing financial risks

  • Preparing discounted cash-flow analysis and sensitivity analysis

  • Forecasting direct project and overhead costs, leasing, and service costs

  • Assisting with cost control using life-cycle analysis, value engineering, risk analysis, or early estimation methods

  • Monitoring and comparing actual vs. budgeted costs

  • Preparing variance analysis reports

Additional Information:

  • This is a won contract – successful candidates will be proposed for upcoming task authorizations.

  • Candidates must meet all mandatory requirements to be considered.

34103.title: IT Business Analyst – SharePoint & RFP Consultant
34103.description:
IT Business Analyst – SharePoint & RFP Consultant (Contract)
Location:
Ottawa, ON – Hybrid (3 days on-site/week preferred, 1 day remote possible)

Overview:
Our client is seeking a highly skilled IT Business Analyst – SharePoint & RFP Consultant to support the development of a formal Request for Proposal (RFP) for a SharePoint Online implementation. This consultant will serve as the subject matter expert in SharePoint functionality, working closely with senior stakeholders, procurement specialists, and cross-functional teams to define project requirements and ensure an RFP that aligns with strategic goals and compliance standards.

Key Responsibilities:
RFP Development
  • Lead the creation of a clear, structured RFP outlining:
  • Project objectives
  • Scope
  • Functional and technical requirements
  • Timelines, challenges, and budget estimates
  • Ensure training requirements are included for administrators, IT staff, and end users
  • Collaborate with the procurement team to integrate our client’s terms, controls, schedules, and workflows Requirements Gathering & Stakeholder Engagement
    • Review existing documentation (e.g., risk assessments, third-party reports, executive briefings)
    • Facilitate and document stakeholder interviews with Directors, VPs, and SMEs across departments including:
    • Operations, Security, IT, Communications, Major Projects, Finance
  • Define and validate project scope, specifying inclusions/exclusions
  • Ensure consistent communication and consensus across all internal groups SharePoint Capabilities Alignment
    • Translate SharePoint Online capabilities into functional business requirements
    • Assess and prioritize features to be included in the RFP:
    • Intelligent Intranet & Digital Workplace
    • Document Management
    • Workflow Automation
    • Microsoft 365 Integration
    • Governance & Compliance
    • Secure External Collaboration
    • Analytics & Continuous Improvement
    • Low-Code/No-Code Development
    • Change Enablement
    Evaluation & Compliance
    • Partner with procurement to define evaluation criteria for vendor selection
    • Ensure all RFP elements are aligned with  procurement policies and regulatory guidelines
    Quality Assurance
    • Review and refine all RFP content for clarity, accuracy, and professionalism
    • Support finalization of the RFP alongside the Director and Procurement team
    Additional Duties
    • Act as a convenor, bringing stakeholders and ideas together to drive consensus
    • Perform related tasks necessary to support successful delivery of the RFP

    Required Qualifications:
    • 7+ years of experience in IT Business Analysis, preferably in the public or government sector
    • Proven functional SharePoint Online experience
    • Demonstrated expertise in RFP development, especially for IT or platform implementations
    • Experience working with internal procurement teams and stakeholder groups
    • Strong facilitation, interviewing, and consensus-building skills
    • Excellent communication and documentation capabilities
    • Ability to manage ambiguity and guide teams through early-stage requirement gathering

    Nice to Have:
    • Prior experience supporting RFPs involving digital workplace or intranet transformation
    • Familiarity with Microsoft 365 integration projects
    • Understanding of compliance, governance, and security in public sector IT environments

34096.publicDescription:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Scrum Master (AI Enablement team) - Hypid at Waukegan, IL (3 days Onsite / 2 Remote).

Duration: 1 Year Contract (Potential of Extension)

TOP 5 Skills/Experience:

  1. 7-10 years of experience as Project Manager / ScrumMaster
  2. Experience working with AI in Day-to-Day Work: Leverage AI (Artificial Intelligence) tools to drive innovation, efficiency and decision making.
  3. Expertise of Agile Facilitation and Scrum Methodologies
  4. Expertise in Jira
  5. SharePoint Expertise for Enhanced Collaboration
  6. Skilled in Storytelling and Developing Training and Communication Materials

Job Summary

  • As a Scrum Master within our AI Enablement organization, you will play a crucial role in facilitating agile teams focused on advancing AI initiatives across the enterprise, with a strong emphasis on enhancing AI learning and education.
  • Your responsibilities will include fostering collaboration and driving continuous improvement, while effectively addressing obstacles to ensure the timely and high-quality delivery of AI capabilities and learning solutions.
  • Collaboration is paramount, and you will work cross-functionally with diverse professionals including developers, business stakeholders, technical experts, and leadership to ensure the seamless integration of agile practices.
  • Your pivotal role will champion AI learning, supporting the cultivation of an AI-proficient workforce that can meet future challenges.

Required Experience:

  • 7-10 years of experience as Project Manager / ScrumMaster
  • Mastery of Agile Facilitation and Scrum Methodologies: Guide agile teams to enhance productivity and innovation in delivering impactful AI initiatives. This involves applying Scrum principles to manage workload efficiently.
  • Demonstrated Experience Working with AI in Day-to-Day Work: Leverage AI tools to drive innovation, efficiency and decision making.
  • Expertise in Jira: Use Jira for tracking project progress, managing backlogs and reporting on key project metrics.
  • Strong Organizational and Communication Skills: Maintain effective communication with the team and stakeholders.
  • Facilitate structured organization and time management to handle multiple projects and commitments efficiently.
  • Leading Change Management: lead change management efforts that drive the adoption of AI-driven capabilities organization-wide.
  • SharePoint Expertise for Enhanced Collaboration: Utilize your SharePoint skills to refine site content and design, fostering seamless collaboration and optimal resource management.
  • Skilled in Storytelling and Developing Training and Communication Materials: Harness storytelling to create engaging narratives. Develop compelling, high-quality training and communication materials to ensure effective program delivery.

PMP Certification is preferred.

34083.title: Internal Audit Consultant
34083.description:
Our client is seeking three experienced Internal Audit Consultants to support the execution of a high-impact internal audit within the banking sector. The ideal candidates will bring strong expertise in internal audit practices, with a background in banking. Familiarity with Derivatives, Capital Market products, or Counterparty Credit Risk is considered a strong asset.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and support internal audit planning and execution

  • Conduct walkthrough meetings with business stakeholders

  • Perform control testing and validate audit evidence

  • Draft internal audit reports with observations and actionable recommendations

  • Collaborate with audit teams to ensure accurate and timely delivery

Required Skills & Experience:

  • 5+ years of Internal Audit and banking experience (mandatory)

  • Strong knowledge of financial controls, audit methodology, and risk management

  • Familiarity with Derivatives, Capital Markets, or Credit Risk (nice to have)

  • Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills

Rank: Senior Consultant

Work Model: Hybrid – Toronto-based, 2–3 days onsite per week preferred

32269.title: Development Lead (Back-End)
32269.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW

The Engineering/Development Lead will oversee the development and delivery of our SaaS products, ensuring technical excellence and alignment with business objectives. This role requires hands-on involvement in both front-end and back-end development, guiding a team of engineers to build scalable and secure applications.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  • Technical Leadership:
    • Lead the design, development, and maintenance of full-stack applications using technologies such as React (Prime React), Node.js, Express, and PostgreSQL. ?
    • Provide architectural guidance to ensure system scalability, performance, and security.?
  • Team Development:
    • Mentor and support engineering team members, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.?
    • Conduct code reviews and facilitate knowledge sharing sessions to uphold coding standards and best practices.?
  • Project Management:
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions.?
    • Oversee project timelines, ensuring timely delivery of features and enhancements.?
  • Quality Assurance:
    • Implement testing strategies to ensure the reliability and robustness of applications.?
    • Monitor and optimize application performance, addressing any issues proactively.?
  • Innovation and Continuous Learning:
    • Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends to drive innovation within the team.?
    • Encourage the adoption of modern development tools and methodologies to enhance productivity.?


QUALIFICATIONS
 
  • Technical Expertise:
    • Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer with proficiency in front-end technologies (React (Prime React).js, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3) and back-end development (Node.js, Express.js). ?
    • Hands-on experience with databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB.?
    • Experience in designing and building RESTful and GraphQL APIs.?
  • Leadership Skills:
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor engineering teams.?
    • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make informed technical decisions.?
  • Soft Skills:
    • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.?
    • Adaptability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.?
  • Education:
    • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.?


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Experience with cloud platforms, particularly Microsoft Azure.?
  • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.?

This role is pivotal in driving the technical direction of our products and ensuring the successful execution of our development projects.

32567.title: Senior IT Project Manager
32567.description:
Senior Project Manager (IT Initiatives – Strategic Transformation Focus)
Location: Ottawa, ON (Hybrid – Must be flexible with occasional on-site requirements)
Job Type: Contract


Overview:
We are seeking an accomplished Senior Project Manager to lead a high-impact, multi-year initiative focused on the strategic adoption of emerging technologies. This opportunity involves guiding the early-stage planning and rollout of a transformative digital capability—currently in the exploratory phase, with a focus on building the roadmap, business case, and long-term execution strategy.
The successful candidate will bring a proven track record managing complex, high-visibility IT initiatives with executive-level governance, and will play a pivotal role in shaping future capabilities across the enterprise.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead and manage large-scale, cross-functional IT projects through their full lifecycle—from planning and initiation through execution and delivery.
  • Develop detailed project plans, schedules, budgets, and governance structures tailored to each initiative.
  • Oversee the development of strategic roadmaps and business case materials aligned with long-term organizational goals.
  • Provide leadership and coordination for Steering Committees and project governance boards, ensuring alignment with stakeholder expectations.
  • Act as a central point of communication for executive stakeholders, offering clear reporting on status, risks, and mitigation strategies.
  • Ensure proper application of change management practices and methodologies to support stakeholder adoption.
  • Coordinate cross-functional teams and external vendors, managing deliverables to scope, time, and budget.
  • Support integration of ITSM/Service Catalogue considerations into overall planning and execution (knowledge of ITIL is a nice-to-have).
  • Deliver high-quality project documentation and reports, including executive dashboards and risk registers.
Qualifications & Experience:
  • Minimum 8–10 years of project management experience, including leadership of full-lifecycle enterprise initiatives.
  • Proven success managing large budgets and complex governance structures.
  • PMP certification (or equivalent experience) is required.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead engagements with C-suite, steering committees, and oversight boards.
  • Strong understanding of project governance frameworks and strategic planning.
  • Ability to translate business objectives into structured project execution plans.
  • Exceptional communication, facilitation, and leadership skills.
  • Experience with vendor management, contract oversight, and Statement of Work (SOW) execution.
  • Knowledge of ITIL, ITSM platforms, and service catalogue design is an asset.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Computer Science, Information Systems).
Additional Notes:
  • While domain-specific experience in artificial intelligence is not mandatory, exposure to digital innovation or emerging tech initiatives will be considered a plus.
  • Preference given to candidates located in Ottawa or willing to travel to site on a recurring basis (e.g., monthly or as needed). Candidates must be realistic and transparent regarding their availability for onsite presence.

34075.title: Senior Data Warehouse Business Analyst
34075.description:
• Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.
  • Work with our testing team to develop and execute test plans to validate data accuracy and integrity.
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure stakeholder sign-off.
  • Act as a subject matter expert on data warehouse capabilities and best practices.
Required Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and supporting testing of various systems.
  • Good understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance.
  • Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System (MES)/MMIS, or EDW DDI or equivalent.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint, Teams, and MS PowerPoint.
  • Experience with facilitating meetings.
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience working with Data warehousing, Analytics, MMIS/MES, PERM, T-MSIS, CMS Federal Reporting or similar projects
  • Understanding of CMS reporting requirements for Medicaid.
  • Knowledge of health insurance, Health Management Organizations (HMO) and managed care principles including Medicaid and Medicare.
  • Experience with Teradata and SQL Assistant/Query Studio
  • Experience/knowledgeable in Extract Transform Load (ETL) processes
  • Experience/knowledgeable in Reporting processes
  • Experience/knowledgeable in Databases (such as Teradata, Snowflake, or other similar Database Management System)
  • Knowledge of quality measures (such as CMS Core Set, HEDIS)
  • Knowledge of data integration, software enhancements/development/planning
  • Knowledge/experience with agile methodologies and projects
  • Experience with using Azure DevOps, JIRA, and Visio
34075.publicDescription:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Springfield, IL in need of a Data Warehouse BA for a REMOTE, long-term contract.  Travel to Springfield may be required 2-4 times/year.  Qualified candidates please provide resume.   

Functional Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) project. This role will serve as a critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data warehouse solutions align with business goals. This role involves gathering and translating business requirements into functional specifications, supporting data modeling efforts, and facilitating testing and validation of data warehouse deliverables.
 
Primary Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users, data engineers, and BI developers to define and document business and data requirements.
  • Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.
  • Work with our testing team to develop and execute test plans to validate data accuracy and integrity.
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure stakeholder sign-off.
  • Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, process flows, and reporting specifications.
  • Act as a subject matter expert on data warehouse capabilities and best practices.
  • Support change management and training efforts related to new data solutions.
Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher degree in business intelligence, analytics, computer science, engineering, or related STEM field.
  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and supporting testing of various systems.
  • Good understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance.
  • Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System (MES)/MMIS, or EDW DDI or equivalent.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint, Teams, and MS PowerPoint.
  • Be a self-starter and able to thrive in an environment with little guidance.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills. 
  • Ability to effectively communicate findings clearly and concisely in writing and verbally to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with multiple teams and competing priorities
  • Experience with facilitating meetings.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.

32632.title: Sr Business Systems Analyst
32632.description:
Job Title: Business Systems Analyst with QA
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid-3 days onsite)
Duration: 5 months (with a possibility of extension)
Bill Rate: $90hr

Description
The BSA/QA will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions. This individual will work closely with the project team and stakeholders to understand their business requirements and do document them in User Stories to then be developed. The BSA/QA will create test cases for user stories and will execute these tests and clearly documenting results and creating defects where needed.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements and functional specifications.
  • Analyze existing business processes, identify areas for improvement, and evaluate potential solutions to increase efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of software solutions that meet the business needs and integrate with existing systems where necessary.
  • Develop test plans and coordinate testing efforts to ensure that solutions meet business requirements and provide a high level of quality.
  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation including process flows, business rules, and user guides.
  • Work closely with project managers and other team members to ensure timely delivery of project milestones and resolution of any issues that may arise.
  • Serve as a liaison between the IT department and business units by communicating project status, changes, and potential impacts to stakeholders.
  • Perform manual testing of software applications to ensure they meet user requirements.
  • Extensive experience on different types of testing that includes Functional testing, System Integration testing, Regression testing and UAT.
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum Environments on multiple Projects.
  • Experience in developing test plans, strategies, and test Scenarios.
  • Create, execute, and maintain test cases and test scripts. Collaborate with the development team to address and resolve identified issues in a timely manner.
  • Expertise in using JIRA for writing the Test Cases and tracking the Defects.
  • Excellent Communication skills-Verbal and written.
