32666.title: Salesforce Developer
32666.description:
The State of Michigan is looking for: Programmer Analyst 3-Salesforce Developer
Max Bill Rate: $77.55
ID#144870
Please NOTE:  

  • Position location: Accepting local candidates within an hour of Lansing ONLY. Position will be hybrid, in office 2 days a week upon start and there is NO REMOTE ONLY option. 
TOP Required Experience/Skills:
  • 5+ years of development/testing experience using Salesforce Apex in enterprise software architecture environment.
  • 1+ year of API Integration experience
  • Hands on development experience using Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes etc.
  • Knowledge of Product Development Lifecycle and DevOps Tools such as GIT, Jenkins, Azure DevOps, etc.



Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Salesforce Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of development and testing experience with Salesforce Apex in an enterprise software architecture environment, coupled with a minimum of 1 year of API integration experience.

You'll be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing robust Salesforce solutions across various clouds, including Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Salesforce Communities/Knowledge. This role requires strong hands-on expertise in Salesforce configuration and customization using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled, and Batch classes.

Required SKILLS/Experience:
• 5+ years of development/testing experience using Salesforce Apex in enterprise software architecture environment
• 1+ year of API Integration experience
• Strong preference for candidates who are Salesforce.com certified in the following areas - Certified Platform Developer I, Certified Platform Developer II
• Hands on development experience using Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes etc.
• Build Salesforce solutions on Salesforce Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Salesforce Communities or Knowledge
• Strong Salesforce customization and configuration experience (at least 1 or more of the following Salesforce modules:
o Sales Cloud
o Service Cloud
o Marketing Cloud
o Salesforce Communities and knowledge
• Experience building integrations between Salesforce and external applications using REST, SOAP APIs, OAuth and Single Sign-On
• Knowledge of Product Development Lifecycle and DevOps Tools such as GIT, Jenkins, Azure DevOps etc.
• A thorough understanding of Salesforce Deployment Process and tools such as ANT, Change Sets and Force.com IDE
• Experience with ETL tools
• Utilizing Agile processes, principles, and techniques, create, verify, document, and implement top-notch business and technical solutions on Salesforce
• Any development experience in UI technologies such as Bootstrap, Lightning Design System (LDS), Lightning Components Development, AngularJS, jQuery, JavaScript is a plus
• Experience in training/mentoring a junior developer is a plus
• Experience/understanding of healthcare industry is a plus

Will close submissions on: 8/01 @ 10am EST
Interview Process: In-person. Candidates must be available for an in-person interview.
Duration: 1 year with extension possible
Hybrid: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. 
Local candidates only (must be located within 1 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission)
32666.publicDescription:
Job Title: Programmer Analyst 3 – Salesforce Developer
Location: Lansing, MI 48933 (Hybrid – Onsite 2 Days/Week)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Work Schedule: Hybrid (Onsite two days per week from day one)
Candidate Requirement: Local candidates only (within a one-hour radius of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option available.

Top Required Experience/Skills

  • Minimum 5 years of development and testing experience using Salesforce Apex in an enterprise software architecture environment

  • At least 1 year of hands-on API integration experience

  • Proven experience with Salesforce configuration and customizations using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes

  • Familiarity with the Product Development Lifecycle and DevOps tools such as Git, Jenkins, and Azure DevOps

Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Salesforce Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience developing and testing solutions using Salesforce Apex within an enterprise environment. This role requires at least one year of hands-on API integration experience.

You will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing robust Salesforce solutions across a range of platforms including Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Salesforce Communities/Knowledge. Candidates should have strong hands-on experience with Salesforce customization and configuration using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, and Batch processes.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years of development/testing experience with Salesforce Apex in an enterprise software architecture environment

  • 1+ year of hands-on API integration experience

  • Salesforce certifications are strongly preferred, especially:

  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I

  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II

  • Practical experience developing and customizing Salesforce using Apex, Visualforce, Triggers, Scheduled and Batch classes

  • Demonstrated experience building Salesforce solutions across one or more of the following:

  • Sales Cloud

  • Service Cloud

  • Marketing Cloud

  • Salesforce Communities/Knowledge

  • Experience integrating Salesforce with external applications using REST, SOAP APIs, OAuth, and Single Sign-On (SSO)

  • Solid understanding of the Salesforce deployment process and tools such as ANT, Change Sets, and Force.com IDE

  • Experience with ETL tools

  • Familiarity with Agile methodologies to deliver high-quality business and technical solutions on the Salesforce platform

  • Experience with UI development technologies (preferred but not required), such as:

  • Bootstrap

  • Lightning Design System (LDS)

  • Lightning Components Development

  • AngularJS, jQuery, JavaScript

  • Experience mentoring or training junior developers is a plus

  • Prior experience or understanding of the healthcare industry is a plus

    Additional Information

    • This is a hybrid position and requires the candidate to be onsite in Lansing, MI two days per week

    • Only local candidates within a one-hour commuting radius of Lansing, MI will be considered

    • This role does not support remote-only work

34091.title: Business Analyst
34091.description:
The State of Michigan is looking for: Business Analyst 5
Max Bill Rate: $80.00
ID#144915

Please NOTE: 

  • Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week (Tuesdays/Wednesdays in office preferred). Candidate can be full time in office if desired.
  • Local candidates (strongly preferred) or non-local (must be willing to relocate at their own expense from acceptance with no delays & follow the hybrid schedule).

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- Experience in gathering and documenting business requirements - 5+ years
- Ability to lead meetings, conduct training & information sessions, communicate at a level appropriate to the audience, make oral and written reports and presentations - 5+ years
- Experience working as a liaison between the development team and project manager or business client in a software development project - 2+ years

Job Summary:
We are looking for someone who understands and has experience with the software development lifecycle as they will be managing work requests to support operational support needs for web applications and gather requirements for project initiatives. This role is the liaison between the technical team and the business client.  This will be about 90% of the time for this resource. This is a senior position so the selected candidate will possess leadership skills including but not limited to the ability to delegate tasks to the team, effective communication and being able to lead a team of business analysts and be comfortable leading requirement meetings with business and other technical resources.
Tasks:
  • Facilitates meetings with the technical team and business client.
  • Gathers requirements and project specifications by leading requirement sessions independently
  • Maintain backlog of work items in Azure DevOps
  • Must operate in a hybrid (Agile/Waterfall) environment and actively manage requirements, change requests and testing needs.
  • Manage project tasks, timelines, and communication between business product owner and development team associated with the Change Management lifecycle
  • Track sprints and ticket progress in Azure DevOps
  • Ensures the team is adhering to the department change management policies
  • Acts as a liaison with State of Michigan auditors
  • Maintains documentation on the project SharePoint Site.
  • Must be self-starter, detail oriented and a critical thinker
  • Provide management with information such as project status reports and resource demand projections.
  • Work with team, management, and business partners to continuously improve the process.
Required Skills/Experience:
  • Education: Bachelor's Degree
Core Competencies (Required):
  • 5+ years exposure to complex IT web applications (within past 5 years)
  • 5+ years gathering and documenting business requirements
  • 5+ years supporting software development projects as a business analyst
  • 5+ years leading meetings, conducting training, and creating tailored communications
  • 3+ years proficiency with MS Office suite
  • 2+ years serving as liaison between development teams and business stakeholders
  • 1+ year experience with Azure DevOps (including User Stories creation)


Preferred Qualifications:
  • 2+ years knowledge of Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
  • 1+ year experience with government grant management systems (Federal/State/local)
  • 1+ year creating wireframes/mockups (Figma or similar tools)
  • 6+ months project management methodology experience
  • 6+ months Microsoft SharePoint experience
  • 6+ months Power Platform experience (Power BI/Power Automate)

- Ability to lead meetings, conduct training & information sessions, communicate at a level appropriate to the audience, make oral and written reports and presentations - 5+ years
- Experience working as a liaison between the development team and project manager or business client in a software development project - 2+ years

Job Summary:
We are looking for someone who understands and has experience with the software development lifecycle as they will be managing work requests to support operational support needs for web applications and gather requirements for project initiatives. This role is the liaison between the technical team and the business client.  This will be about 90% of the time for this resource. This is a senior position so the selected candidate will possess leadership skills including but not limited to the ability to delegate tasks to the team, effective communication and being able to lead a team of business analysts and be comfortable leading requirement meetings with business and other technical resources.
Tasks:
  • Facilitates meetings with the technical team and business client.

  • Track sprints and ticket progress in Azure DevOps
  • Ensures the team is adhering to the department change management policies

  • Must be self-starter, detail oriented and a critical thinker
  • Provide management with information such as project status reports and resource demand projections.

34087.title: SAP Data Migration Lead
34087.description:
Myticas Consulting is actively seeking an experienced SAP Data Migration Lead for a high-impact, long-term contract with our client in the natural resources sector. This role is based in Vancouver, BC and follows a hybrid model with 20–30% travel.

The selected candidate will lead the data migration stream as part of an SAP S/4HANA and Ariba implementation. We’re looking for a hands-on leader who can architect, manage, and deliver high-quality data conversion solutions.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the SAP S/4HANA and Ariba data migration stream

  • Manage data conversion activities across the full lifecycle: design, build, test, validation, cutover

  • Set up data migration technical architecture using Syniti ADMM

  • Provide technical direction to the data conversion team

  • Collaborate with functional teams to map and transform source data

  • Conduct data profiling, cleansing, and reconciliation

  • Develop and monitor data quality dashboards and pre/post-validation reports

Required Qualifications:

  • 5–10 years of SAP MDM/Data Migration experience

  • Minimum of 5 full-cycle SAP implementations

  • Expertise with Syniti ADMM (Advanced Data Migration and Management)
    (Candidates with BODS only will be considered after Syniti profiles)

  • Experience loading S/4HANA data using IDOCs, LTMC/LTMOM, LSMW, and custom methods

  • Strong hands-on experience in SQL and data analysis tools

  • Proven knowledge of SAP data objects and functional modules:

  • FI, CO (Record to Report)

  • MM, IM, EWM (Procure to Pay)

  • PM, QM, IBP, PS, HR

Preferred Experience:

  • Data migration project experience in the Energy or Natural Resources sector

  • Deep hands-on knowledge of Syniti ADMM tools:

  • Snapshot Management (data extraction)

  • Quality Module (profiling, dashboards)

  • Syniti Match, Construct, Migrate apps

  • Data migration cockpit and LTMOM

  • Data orchestration and CDC (Change Data Capture)

  • Security features (encryption, masking, user management)

34090.title: Robotic Power Automate Developer
34090.description:
Myticas Consulting is currently seeking 2–3 Robotic Power Automate Developers to support a large-scale data migration project for a confidential financial services client. This is a hybrid role based in Montreal or Toronto, with a preference for Montreal-based candidates. Candidates must be open to periodic travel to Montreal (1–2 times/month, 3–4 days at a time) and working shifts during production events, including some evenings/weekends.

Project Scope:

The successful candidates will develop, optimize, and deploy automation workflows using Power Automate Desktop (RPA) and SQL. The role focuses on data transformation and integration into legacy mainframe systems, supporting business-critical migration activities with high compliance and quality standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and deploy automation workflows using Power Automate Desktop (RPA)

  • Collaborate with business and data teams to translate migration requirements into automated processes

  • Write and optimize complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and data validations

  • Automate ETL processes for integration with mainframe environments

  • Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve workflow issues

  • Ensure security, compliance, and maintain clear documentation and audit trails

  • Participate in key migration events and be available for shift-based support when needed

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 4+ years of experience in Power Automate Desktop (RPA) development

  • Experience with Power Platform (solution creation and deployments)

  • Strong SQL development skills, including stored procedures and performance tuning

  • Previous experience with mainframe data integration or loading

  • Understanding of RPA architecture, workflow orchestration, and automation lifecycle

  • Experience working in Agile or hybrid project settings

  • Strong communication and troubleshooting skills

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with Power Automate Cloud flows or Power Platform integrations

  • Knowledge of SSIS, ADF, Informatica, or middleware tools

  • Exposure to COBOL datasets or legacy batch processing

  • Experience with data mapping and transformation logic

34088.title: Environmental Engineer
34088.description:
773208_Environmental Engineer

Pay Rate must be between $32.00 and $55.00, depending on level of experience (1-2 yrs. exp. $32.00-$45.00 or 3-6 yrs. $45.00-$55.00).

Open for Remote_Sub ED_08/06/2025

Hiring Manager NOTE:  Work schedule is 37.5 hours per week for an indefinite period of time. Candidate must be available to work during state office hours 8:15am - 4:45pm EST. Please confirm the you understands the work schedule and engagement duration.

Job Summary:
The Environmental Engineer conducts plan reviews and related work to determine compliance with applicable laws, rules, and standards in conformance with the mission and vision of the Indiana Department of Health to protect public health in the construction and operation of health care facilities and other structures that require plan review and approval. Emphasis is on applying architectural and engineering standards, safety, sanitation, water supply, sewage disposal, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, and state licensing requirements as applicable for facilities located in Indiana requiring State approval. 

Resource will be responsible for prompt responses back to the general public, consultants, contractors and the regulated community.

Key Responsibilities:
Core Technical Knowledge (Required)
  • 1+ year experience reading blueprints/plans, analyzing data, and recommending action plans
  • Working knowledge of:
  1. Environmental engineering laws, rules, and technical guidelines
  2. On-site sewage disposal and sanitation policies
  3. Public health science and environmental health principles
  4. Soil science and applied mathematics
  5. FGI healthcare facility design guidelines (hospitals, outpatient, residential)
  6. NFPA codes and standards


Education & Certification:
  • Bachelor's degree in environmental engineering or related field (Required)
  • Indiana Professional Engineering License (Nice to have)
34088.publicDescription:
Environmental Engineer
Location: Indianapolis, IN
Position Type: 100% Contract
Work Schedule: 37.5 hours/week | Monday–Friday, 8:15 AM – 4:45 PM EST
Client: Myticas’ Direct Client (Indiana Department of Health)

NOTE FROM HIRING MANAGER:
This is a long-term, full-time contract position with a standard weekly schedule of 37.5 hours. The candidate must be available to work during regular state office hours (8:15 AM – 4:45 PM EST). Please confirm your understanding of and availability for this schedule.

Job Summary:

The Environmental Engineer is responsible for conducting plan reviews and related tasks to ensure compliance with all relevant laws, rules, and standards. This work supports the Indiana Department of Health's mission to protect public health in the construction and operation of healthcare facilities and other regulated structures. The role emphasizes the application of architectural and engineering standards across multiple disciplines, including safety, sanitation, water supply, sewage disposal, mechanical systems, electrical systems, plumbing, and applicable licensing requirements for facilities in Indiana.

This position also requires effective communication and timely responses to inquiries from the public, consultants, contractors, and the regulated community.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Review and evaluate architectural and engineering plans to ensure regulatory compliance.

  • Apply environmental and public health principles to design evaluations.

  • Provide timely, professional responses to inquiries from the public and regulated entities.

  • Interpret and apply relevant state and federal codes and standards.

  • Recommend actionable plans based on technical data and plan analysis.

  • Ensure compliance with environmental engineering policies and sanitation practices.

  • Support public health initiatives through the review of facility plans requiring state approval.

Required Technical Knowledge and Experience:

  • Minimum 1 year of experience reading blueprints/plans, analyzing data, and recommending corrective or actionable solutions.

  • Working knowledge of:

    • Environmental engineering laws, rules, and technical guidelines

    • On-site sewage disposal and sanitation policies

    • Public health science and environmental health principles

    • Soil science and applied mathematics

    • FGI (Facility Guidelines Institute) healthcare facility design guidelines (hospitals, outpatient, residential)

    • NFPA (National Fire Protection Association) codes and standards

Education and Certification:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Engineering or a related field (Required)

  • Indiana Professional Engineering (PE) License (Preferred but not required)

32657.title: Technical Manager Customer Support
32657.description:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team
of talented Technical Support Engineers responsible for providing world-class customer support.

This individual will be accountable for managing daily support operations, coaching and
mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and building a customer-first culture
that ensures exceptional satisfaction, retention, and long-term success. The ideal candidate will
bring a deep understanding of technical support operations, a background in networking or SaaS
platforms, and a passion for solving customer problems with empathy and urgency.
Core Responsibilities
• Lead and inspire a team of Technical Support Engineers to drive product knowledge, support
excellence, and professional development.
• Manage the day-to-day operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance
indicators such as customer satisfaction, response times, and ticket resolution rates are
consistently met or exceeded.
• Act as the primary point of contact for customer technical escalations, ensuring timely and
effective resolution of complex or high-priority issues.
• Analyze team metrics, SLAs, and customer support trends to implement scalable strategies that
improve response quality and operational efficiency.
• Proactively research and adopt new support tools and technologies that enhance team productivity
and service quality.
• Support career growth and retention through coaching, mentoring, and continuous learning
opportunities.
• Promote and enforce best practices, process improvements, and documentation standards
across the team.
• Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to escalate
systemic issues and prioritize long-term fixes.
• Lead customer-facing support reviews and QBRs, ensuring open communication around issue
trends, resolution plans, and areas of improvement.
• Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable product or
documentation enhancements.
Required Qualifications and Skills
• 7+ years of relevant experience in technical support or customer success roles, including
experience managing escalations.
• Demonstrated success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.
• Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities, with the capacity to engage both technical
and non-technical audiences.
• Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used in network troubleshooting.
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline (or equivalent
experience).
• Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines in a high-pressure environment.
• Proven track record of proactively identifying risks and implementing mitigation strategies.
32657.publicDescription:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team of skilled Technical Support Engineers in delivering world-class customer support. This individual will be responsible for managing daily support operations, coaching and mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and fostering a customer-first culture focused on satisfaction, retention, and long-term success.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in technical support operations, experience with networking or SaaS platforms, and a genuine passion for solving customer issues with empathy and urgency.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead, inspire, and develop a team of Technical Support Engineers to deepen product knowledge, elevate support standards, and encourage professional growth.

  • Oversee daily operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance indicators (KPIs)—including customer satisfaction, response time, and resolution rate—are consistently met or exceeded.

  • Serve as the primary escalation point for complex or high-priority technical issues, ensuring timely and effective resolution.

  • Analyze support metrics, service-level agreements (SLAs), and customer feedback to identify trends and implement scalable improvements that enhance team efficiency and service quality.

  • Evaluate and adopt new tools and technologies that improve productivity and the overall customer support experience.

  • Foster employee development and retention through regular coaching, mentoring, and opportunities for continuous learning.

  • Drive consistency in support processes by promoting best practices, standardizing workflows, and maintaining high-quality documentation.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and Customer Success, to address systemic issues and advocate for long-term product improvements.

  • Lead customer-facing support reviews and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to discuss issue trends, resolutions, and opportunities for service enhancements.

  • Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable improvements for product development and documentation.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • 7+ years of experience in technical support or customer success, including managing technical escalations.

  • Proven success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.

  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used for troubleshooting network-related issues.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field (or equivalent professional experience).

  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives in a high-pressure environment.

  • Demonstrated ability to proactively identify risks and implement effective mitigation strategies.

32633.title: Power BI Architect
32633.description:
Job Title: Power BI Architect
Work Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid, 3 days in the office, 3 days of choice Monday – Thursday. Onsite Hybrid schedule is mandatory, cannot be altered)
Duration: 6+ month contract (potential to extend)
 
TOP 3 SKILLS:
  1. Experience with design and architecture
  2. Experience with data modelling
  1. Experience with Performance Optimization.
 
JOB SUMMARY:
We are seeking a highly skilled Power BI Architect to join our dynamic team. As a Power BI Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing effective BI solutions that transform data into actionable insights. You will lead the strategic development of our Power BI platform, ensuring scalability, reliability, and optimal performance.
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Design and Architecture: Develop and design the architecture of the Power BI platform, Power Automate, and Power Apps, ensuring alignment with business requirements and best practices.
  • Data Modeling: Create efficient and scalable dimensional data models that facilitate data analysis and reporting.
  • Dashboard Development: Lead the development of dynamic and interactive dashboards that provide valuable insights to stakeholders.
  • Integration: Collaborate with IT and data engineering teams to integrate Power BI with various data sources and systems.
  • Performance Optimization: Identify and implement strategies to optimize the performance of Power BI reports and dashboards.
  • Security: Ensure data security and compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
  • Strategy and Planning: Advise on BI strategy and roadmaps, aligning business needs with technology advancements.
  • Training and Support: Provide training and support to end-users and junior team members, promoting effective use of Power BI tools.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of architectural designs, configurations, and project specifications.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Proven experience as a BI Architect or similar role, with 5-7 years’ experience in Power BI.
  • Strong expertise in full Microsoft BI Suite, data modeling, DAX, and Power Query.
  • Experience with SQL, Python, Jupyter Notebooks, and integrating Power BI with various data sources.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
  • Ability to lead projects and work collaboratively in a team environment.
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience with Azure data services and cloud technologies.
  • Familiarity with other BI tools and platforms.
  • Power BI certification is a plus.

32631.title: SAP FICO/RTR Lead
32631.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced SAP FICO/RTR Lead for a long-term HYBRID contract with a major utility and energy client. This is a senior-level techo-functional role requiring a mix of deep functional finance expertise and strong technical capabilities within the SAP ecosystem. The position requires frequent travel (50–70%) to Winnipeg, MB, and the consultant may be based anywhere in Canada.

Project Scope:
The successful candidate will help develop methodologies, tools, and thought leadership in SAP Finance as part of a critical ERP initiative. The role requires strong hands-on knowledge of SAP Finance (FICO/RTR) and integration with other modules, along with experience in end-to-end implementations and strategic financial processes.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead SAP FICO/RTR workstream across implementation and integration efforts

  • Provide hands-on configuration and design of SAP Finance modules (GL, AP, AR, AA, CO, Treasury, SAC-Planning, etc.)

  • Collaborate with business and technical teams to document requirements, define process flows, and ensure high-quality solution delivery

  • Integrate SAP FICO with PS, PM, MM, IS-U, and SCM modules

  • Contribute to finance strategy, reporting systems, and regulatory requirements specific to utilities

Key Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of SAP Finance experience across GL, AR, AP, AA, CO, etc.

  • Experience leading large-scale SAP S/4HANA implementations

  • Functional and technical experience with finance and cost accounting processes

  • Strong familiarity with SAP integrations across IS-U, MM, CS, EWM, PS

  • Understanding of Power & Utilities finance regulations is a plus

  • SAP Certifications highly preferred

  • Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Computer Science (MBA a strong asset)

  • Experience with Datasphere, SAC, and Analysis for Office is a bonus

Additional Details:

  • Travel to Winnipeg is mandatory (50–70%)

  • Must be flexible with on-site scheduling

  • This is a client-facing leadership role requiring excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills

32634.title: Sr Engineer
32634.description:
Thrivent is looking for a Sr. Engineer to join our Thrivent Technology Services Capabilities Team. This team supports the Technology Service Experience (TSE) and Technology Incident Management (TIME) Teams. This is done by empowering our business customers through reliable and efficient technology data enabled decisions via the Thrivent Product Operating Model.

As a Sr Engineer you will be considered a technical expert in one or more phases of application and/or systems engineering. This includes providing design recommendations based on long-term IT organization strategy and expertise regarding the integration of applications across the business. You will determine specifications, plan, design, and develop business critical software solutions, utilizing appropriate software engineering processes - either individually or in concert with product team.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Designing Solutions

  • Apply technical knowledge to drive outcomes for customers 
  • Ability to work and problem solve independently on initiatives that align to the broader software engineering strategy

Developing Software

  • Member of team that can work independently, as well as collaboratively with team, in developing core software for the product that delivers outcomes.
  • Consistent and dependable in delivering core software that delivers outcomes and meets/exceeds the teams expectations for stability, scalability, resilience, etc.

Learning and Applying New Techniques

  • Shares new ideas and techniques with team; Encourages junior engineers to invest in learning as a part of their job.

Collaborating within the Team

  • Participate in team’s collaboration sessions to provide technical expertise to solve a problem/remove technical roadblocks for the team
  • Participate in product planning and implementation. Helps team to understand and decompose work

Defining Engineering Standards and Patterns

  • Contribute to develop engineering practices, templates and frameworks in collaboration with the team.

DevOps

  • Continuously assessing technology to build more stable, scalable, and resilient software; Use data to measure progress
  • Promote and expand on the use of the CI/CD pipeline to improve the deployment and build process.
  • Participates in the team support rotation and provides expert knowledge on focus subsystems.

Selecting & Managing Technology Vendors

  • Contribute to define the selection criteria for selecting the right technology vendors .
  • Participate in proof of concept / technology along with the vendor

Coaching Engineers

  • Provide guidance to junior engineers to help them learn foundational software engineering skills
  • Provide technical expertise and help the team to solve technical/software issues
  • Provide trainings to the junior developers and groom them
  • Provide domain expertise on software products in their area to junior engineers to help them learn/grow their skills and contribute as part of the team

Recruiting/Building Talent

  • Engage in the tech community to build the Thrivent technology brand and position as the employer of choice in the market
  • Participate in the interview process or be part of the panel to recruit the right talent to the team
  • Contribute to the recruitment to define the structure of the interview process to hire the right talent to the team.
  • Models Thrivent’s leadership competencies – courage, collaboration, and commitment by demonstrating resiliency, working together to make the best decisions, and holding yourself and others accountable.  ?
  • Supports and/or develops an environment in which Thrivent employees and colleagues are focused on continuous improvement, exceptional employee engagement, and an unwavering commitment to our clients.  Shapes and/or supports a culture that represents the Thrivent purpose, promise and values, ensuring that Thrivent’s trust and reputation remain strong with its clients.  

?

QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:  

 Required:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or other technical field or equivalent work experience
  •  7+ years of experience in engineering environments, taking abstract concepts and ideas and formulating a detailed software engineering plan to deliver 
  • Sound knowledge of Service Now, Power BI, Power Automate, Service Now Analytics, PowerShell, QC Testing, Automation Anywhere, SQL Queries
  • Sound knowledge of version and revision control practices and procedures  
  • Sound knowledge of systems design concepts that provide security and stability   
  • Expertise in debugging code and/or complex log files for troubleshooting and analysis of product defects 
  • Expert knowledge/experience with querying databases for complex data lookup/update 
  • Perform code reviews with associate team members 

 Preferred: 

  • Financial Services industry experience 
  • Coach / mentor other team members as appropriate
32634.publicDescription:
The Myticas Team is hiring a Senior Software Engineer!

Myticas is excited to be partnering with a top-tier organization to add a Senior Software Engineer to their dynamic Technology Services team. This role is ideal for an experienced engineer who is passionate about building scalable, stable, and high-performing solutions—while also helping mentor and guide others in best practices.

In this position, you’ll bring both strategic insight and hands-on technical expertise to support and enhance business-critical systems. You’ll collaborate across teams, drive automation and DevOps practices, and work closely with leadership to shape the engineering standards of tomorrow.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Design technical solutions aligned with long-term business and IT strategies

  • Develop core software in collaboration with product teams, ensuring stability and scalability

  • Work independently on initiatives and contribute to complex problem-solving efforts

  • Participate in planning sessions, break down work, and remove roadblocks for the team

  • Apply DevOps principles and continuously enhance CI/CD pipeline practices

  • Share new engineering techniques and help define team standards and templates

  • Provide technical coaching to junior engineers, helping them build strong foundational skills

  • Contribute to the recruitment and onboarding of new talent

  • Support ongoing vendor evaluations and technology selections

  • Participate in an on-call support rotation as a subject matter expert

What You Bring:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or related field) or equivalent experience

  • 7+ years of experience in software engineering or system development

  • Proven experience working with:

    • ServiceNow, Power BI, Power Automate, ServiceNow Analytics, PowerShell, Automation Anywhere, SQL Queries

    • Code debugging, database querying, and automation tools

    • CI/CD pipelines and DevOps environments

  • A collaborative mindset, mentoring spirit, and an ability to communicate technical concepts clearly

  • Solid understanding of secure, scalable systems architecture

Nice to Have:

  • Experience in the Financial Services or Insurance industry

  • Prior experience coaching junior developers or shaping engineering team practices

If you’re looking for your next challenge where you can lead from the front, help shape engineering culture, and work on impactful projects—we want to hear from you! Apply today to learn more.

34086.title: Senior Technical Product Manager
34086.description:
BR: $80.00

Job ID# 14887681

Title: Senior Technical Product Manager 

Location:  Coppell, TX 75019 (Open for Hybrid Work, 2-3 days in office and remote)

Duration: 5 Months Contract with Potential of Extension


Job Description:
The Senior Product Manager works closely with customers to understand their needs, and test concepts and solutions.
They also engage with internal stakeholders including sales, marketing, implementation, training and support teams to gather their customer insights and their own functional needs. The Senior Product Manger serves as the bridge between both internal and external stakeholders and development teams, ensuring successful product execution, responsible for translating vision and strategy for their product portfolio into software solutions in partnership with product line managers, other technical product managers, user experience team and development team.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Develops a deep understanding of the product vision, target customer segments, and long-term priorities while ensuring alignment and communication with senior leadership and stakeholders.
• Collaborates with internal teams (engineering, marketing, sales, implementation, training, and support) to gather insights, align priorities, and ensure successful product development and launch execution.
• Acts as the voice of the customer, engaging with user experience and development teams to validate and refine solutions throughout the development lifecycle.
• Facilitates customer interactions, in partnership with user experience team, to understand their unmet needs and test concepts and solutions throughout the development process
• Translates business requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria, ensuring clear communication with the development team.
• Lead Agile development execution, including backlog prioritization, sprint planning, and review of completed work to ensure alignment with business goals.
• Leads quarterly Agile planning processes and continuously deepens subject matter expertise to drive product improvements.
• Develops and maintains detailed product roadmaps, prioritizing features across multiple quarters.
• Works with project managers and other technical product managers to manage dependencies, monitor progress, and adjust plans as needed.
• Manage dependencies and risks across teams, ensuring continuous improvement and cross-functional alignment.
• Monitor product performance, track KPIs, and adjust strategies to maximize business value and customer impact.
• Facilitate customer interactions to understand pain points, conduct concept testing, and ensure solutions address real user needs.
• Ensure successful product delivery by reviewing completed work, validating acceptance criteria, and iterating as needed
Other Duties Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Business Management, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.

Required Qualifications/Experience/Skills: 

• Minimum 5 years in a Sr. Product Manager role Recommend college degree in business, finance, or technology
• Minimum 3 years in product management for software products, preferably in B2B enterprise SaaS or Tax & Accounting solutions (including CPA firm experience).
• Hands-on experience in Agile Scrum methodologies as a Product Owner/Technical Product Manager
• Strong knowledge of the software development lifecycle, including backlog grooming, user story creation, and iterative planning.
• Experience collaborating with UX and technical teams to design an refine products based on customer research (interviews, concept testing, usability testing).

Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:
• Strategic Thinking & Influence – Ability to align stakeholders, balance priorities, and drive product vision.
• Data-Driven Decision Making – Leverages data and customer insights to guide product strategy.
• Technical Fluency & Problem Solving – Translates complex business needs into actionable development tasks.
• Agility & Adaptability
34086.publicDescription:
Job Title: Senior Technical Product Manager
Location: Coppell, TX (Hybrid)
Type: Contract (W2 Only)

About the Role:
Myticas is seeking a Senior Technical Product Manager to support our direct client in Coppell, TX. This is a hybrid contract position available exclusively on a W2 basis.

The Senior Technical Product Manager will serve as the critical link between customers, internal stakeholders, and development teams. This role involves deeply understanding customer needs, translating strategic product vision into actionable development tasks, and leading cross-functional collaboration to ensure the successful delivery of software solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop a comprehensive understanding of the product vision, target customer segments, and long-term priorities, while ensuring alignment with senior leadership and stakeholders.

  • Partner with internal teams—including engineering, marketing, sales, implementation, training, and support—to gather insights, align priorities, and ensure effective product development and launch execution.

  • Serve as the voice of the customer, working closely with UX and development teams to validate and refine solutions throughout the development lifecycle.

  • Conduct and facilitate customer engagements, in collaboration with UX teams, to explore unmet needs and test concepts and prototypes.

  • Translate business requirements into user stories and detailed acceptance criteria for development teams.

  • Lead Agile ceremonies including backlog grooming, sprint planning, and sprint reviews, ensuring outcomes align with business objectives.

  • Drive quarterly Agile planning and continuously build subject matter expertise to identify and implement product improvements.

  • Maintain and evolve detailed product roadmaps, prioritizing features across multiple quarters.

  • Coordinate with project managers and other product managers to manage dependencies, monitor progress, and adjust plans to stay on track.

  • Proactively manage cross-functional risks and dependencies to drive continuous improvement and team alignment.

  • Monitor product performance and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess impact and adjust strategies accordingly.

  • Review completed development work to validate acceptance criteria, ensuring products meet expectations and deliver value.

  • Perform other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Business Management, or a related field. Equivalent practical experience will be considered.

Required Qualifications and Experience:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Senior Product Manager.

  • Minimum of 3 years of product management experience for software products, preferably in B2B enterprise SaaS or Tax & Accounting domains (CPA firm experience a plus).

  • Proven hands-on experience with Agile Scrum methodologies in a Product Owner or Technical Product Manager capacity.

  • Strong understanding of the software development lifecycle, including backlog management, user story writing, and iterative development planning.

  • Demonstrated ability to work closely with UX and technical teams to design and refine products based on user research and testing.

Preferred Skills and Competencies:

  • Strategic Thinking & Influence: Ability to align stakeholders, manage competing priorities, and drive a cohesive product vision.

  • Data-Driven Decision-Making: Skilled in leveraging data and customer insights to inform product strategy and decisions.

  • Technical Fluency & Problem Solving: Capable of translating complex business requirements into clear, actionable development tasks.

  • Agility & Adaptability: Comfortable working in a fast-paced, changing environment with the flexibility to shift priorities as needed.

32645.title: Lab Technician
32645.description:
Description:
AbbVie has a highly automated compound management department utilizing robotic instruments to manage the tasks of adding or removing samples from storage banks, along with electronic barcodes to facilitate record-keeping and sample preparation tailored to research scientists’ experimental needs. Automation not only accelerates sample delivery but also promises enhanced consistency of samples regarding concentration accuracy and the uniformity of physical properties across experimental runs. These improvements are crucial in advancing early drug discovery.
• Responsibilities
Work cross-functionally to develop a deep understanding of the scientific processes and identify key bottlenecks that could be improved with automation to increase research velocity.
• Develop appropriate automation protocols to meet the needs research scientists.
• Maintain instrumentation through routine maintenance and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to minimize equipment downtime.
• Write and update protocols for new automation workflows using robotic-specific software for laboratory instruments, e.g., Tecan, Beckman Coulter, Agilent Technologies, and SPT.
• Draft, edit, and review laboratory Standard Operating Procedures for the automated platforms and the protocols necessary to support sample delivery.
• Promptly enter all data to support the needs of the research scientist.
• Interpret results, identify anomalies or unexpected outcomes, and provide appropriate remedies.
Qualifications:
List required and preferred qualifications (up to 10). Include education, skills, and experience.
• Bachelor’s degree in a scientific discipline (e.g., biology, chemistry, or similar).
• Experience with robotic liquid handlers from Hamilton, TECAN, Agilent Technologies, or Beckman Coulter.
• Experience in compound management preferred.
• Ability to work upright and stationary and/or standing for typical working hours.
• Ability to lift and move objects up to 25 pounds.
• Ability to work in non-traditional work environments.
• Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology proficiently.
• May have exposure to potentially hazardous elements typically found in laboratory environments (PPE required).

Automation not only accelerates sample delivery but also promises enhanced consistency of samples regarding concentration accuracy and the uniformity of physical properties across experimental runs. Responsibilities:

32563.title: Digital Marketing Consultant
32563.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Digital Marketing Consulting to support Search Engine Optimization activities.  This is an ON-SITE role starting as a 5 months contract, with likely extensions.  Candidates local to the Grand Rapids area, are preferred. Qualified candidates please provide resume.  Thank you!
 
Job Description (Visible to Supplier): Digital Marketing Contractor – Job Responsibilities

In response to evolving digital marketing priorities and the growing importance of AI in search, we are expanding the role of our current SEO lead and seeking a Digital Marketing Contractor to provide support for core SEO responsibilities. This role will help ensure continuity in execution and performance monitoring while allowing the team to focus on broader strategic initiatives. The contractor will support global SEO operations and partner with market teams to enhance visibility, discoverability, and performance across digital properties.

Duration: July – December 2025, with potential extension
Location: Grand Rapids, MI (Onsite)
Reports to: Global SEO Lead

Key Responsibilities

Operational SEO Execution
• Conduct keyword research to support market-level needs and content planning.
• Perform technical SEO audits using tools like Ahrefs and Google Search Console.
• Support content optimization efforts, including metadata, on-page structure, and internal linking.
• Compile and deliver monthly SEO performance reports using platforms such as Ahrefs, Heap, and GSC.
• Troubleshoot SEO issues reported by markets and provide actionable solutions.
• Leverage AI tools and approaches to generate recommendations for content optimization, keyword discovery, link-building, and landing page refinement.
• Integrate AI-enabled tools to automate repetitive SEO tasks and improve execution speed and scalability.

SEO Training and Enablement
• Assist in delivering SEO onboarding sessions and office hours for market teams.
• Help maintain and update SEO playbooks, best practices, and documentation on SharePoint.
• Create or revise modular self-serve resources to enable independent market optimization.
• Support the creation and management of a centralized SharePoint hub for training.

Performance Monitoring and Insights
• Support organic search sentiment analysis and reputation tracking.
• Monitor and extract insights from dashboards (Heap, Ahrefs) to identify trends and risks.
• Assist in evaluating SEO impact for major product launches and post-launch performance reviews.
• Apply AI-powered tools to surface deeper insights from large-scale performance data.

Collaboration and Coordination
• Work cross-functionally with content, analytics, and technical teams to integrate SEO best practices.
• Participate in global team meetings or planning sessions to ensure SEO considerations are included.
• Escalate technical SEO issues or strategic risks to the Global SEO Lead.

Tool and Vendor Support
• Assist with user access management, licensing coordination, and onboarding for SEO tools.
• Support evaluations of SEO tool usage and effectiveness.
• Coordinate with vendors to troubleshoot issues or implement platform improvements.

?

Qualifications
• 5+ years of experience in digital marketing and hands-on SEO in global or multi-market settings.
• Proficiency with SEO tools like Heap, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, and Lumar (or equivalent).
• Strong analytical skills; able to turn performance data into clear, actionable insights.
• Excellent writing and editing skills, with an understanding of search-optimized content.
• Demonstrated experience creating or reviewing metadata, headers, and on-page copy for SEO.
• Familiarity with CMS platforms and technical SEO concepts (indexing, crawling, Core Web Vitals).
• Strong understanding of how AI can be applied to SEO (e.g., prompt engineering, content summarization, automated content audits, keyword clustering).
• Experience working with cross-functional teams across content, marketing, and tech.
• Ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

34081.title: Java Developer
34081.description:
The State of Michigan is looking for: Programmer Analyst 6-Java Developer
Max Bill Rate: $95.00
 (Job ID#144902)

Please NOTE: Accepting local candidates to Michigan that are within 2 hours of Lansing ONLY. Position will be hybrid, in office 2 days a week (Tue/Wed) upon start and there is NO REMOTE ONLY option. 
Candidate Needs to Provide: 2 Professional references from recent projects:

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
Core Java Expertise:

  • 7+ years programming complex systems in Java using Eclipse/JBoss Developer Studio
  • 4+ years with Java 8 features and functionality
Framework Experience:
  • 5+ years developing with Spring Framework
  • 5+ years using JPA/Hibernate ORM
Development Practices:
  • 5+ years working in Agile development environments

Job Summary:
This is a java developer position. The position will be supporting the Michigan Department of Transportation's (MDOT) Project Development and Maintenance programs.

As a software developer, the responsibilities include, but are not limited to, working with the project manager, application owner, and resource manager, working on an agile development team to organize work, develop, test, and deploy code. This position performs a variety of complicated tasks and may report directly to a project lead or manager. This position must have excellent communication and teamwork skills, be self-directed, committed, and a quick learner.

In addition to full-stack development, this position will also work with UI/UX team members in building user interfaces and responsive applications.

Required Skills/Experience:
Core Java Development:
  • 7+ years developing complex Java systems using Eclipse/JBoss Developer Studio
  • 4+ years hands-on experience with Java 8
Enterprise Frameworks:
  • 5+ years working with Spring Framework
  • 5+ years experience with JPA/Hibernate
  • 4+ years experience with Oracle 12C/19C databases
Web Development:
  • 4+ years experience with jQuery and jQuery UI
Development Practices:
  • 5+ years working in Agile development environments


Preferred Skills:
Additional Technologies:
  • 4+ years experience with React.js (Desired)
  • 4+ years in JBOSS Enterprise environment (Desired)
  • 4+ years with SQL/PL/SQL (Desired)
Development Tools:
  • 4+ years experience with Log4j, JUnit, and Tiles (Desired)
Reporting:
  • 4+ years with Jasper Reports, Crystal Reports, or Business Objects (Desired)

32601.title: Attorney
32601.description:
Bill Rate: $48/hr; 

Location:  Hybrid role, at either of the locations - St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN (Minneapolis is the preferred location).


MUST Have: Juris Doctor degree from an ABA-accredited law school required.

Job Description:
The Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II (“QA Analyst II”) for client will be responsible for performing the quality assurance testing for the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE), which involves applying subject matter expert knowledge of key legal concepts relative to invoice auditing that spans multiple areas of law. The Legal Bill Analysis (“LBA”) process involves the prompt, accurate and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices submitted by law firms and vendors of our clients.

Works as a consulting team member or an individual technical/business-solutions consultant on a for-fee basis. Consulting work may include technical consulting including product implementation, integration or audit projects and/or may include business-solutions consulting including the analysis of client's current business objectives and business processes and designing and implementing solutions to meet client's needs.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
BASIC FUNCTION
  • As part of our quality assurance process, the QA Analyst II will conduct an expert peer review of LBACOE invoice analysts’ work while independently utilizing his or her specialized legal expertise, knowledge base and education. 
  • After making a comprehensive, expert assessment of the legal context and terminology in the invoice, the QA Analyst II will make additional adjustments to previously-adjusted invoice line-item entries, if needed, and document the comprehensive justification for such adjustments.  
  • The QA Analyst II will also make corrections to adjusted and non-adjusted invoice lines.  
  • Moreover, the QA Analyst II, as part of our Appeals Team, will engage in written communications with the vendors of our customers regarding the adjustments made to invoice line-item entries by the LBACOE.  
  • The ultimate goal of QA Analyst II communications with the vendors is to fully leverage the QA Analyst II’s robust legal knowledge base and partake in legal expert-to-expert discourse so as to arrive at a reasonable, mutually-agreeable resolution on disputed invoice adjustments, subject to our customers’ ultimate directives.  
  • At the direction of management, the QA Analyst II will also be responsible for handling escalated law firm appeals requiring special attention, known as appeals mediation, which includes production of a written summary for review by our client(s) and/or for use at a resolution conference to be attended by the law firm, QA Analyst III, LegalVIEW BillAnalyzer management and our client(s).
  • The QA Analyst II will also provide guidance to business unit partners regarding issues or opportunities within the LBA process.
Drive the results of the LBACOE quality assurance process, as follows:
  • Conduct review of LBACOE Legal Invoice Analysts’ line item adjustments and non-adjusted invoice lines, applying specialized legal subject matter expert knowledge to context of legal invoice line items for quality assurance. Using sound individual discretion and with minimal supervision, conduct gap filling analysis to decode the legal “story” of an invoice by utilizing required law school education, law firm experience, and/or related specialized legal expertise.
  • Verify the compliance of adjusted and non-adjusted line items to legal billing guidelines by law firms and vendors submitting invoices.
  • Verify the accuracy of the UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Independently make further adjustments to invoice line items as necessary based on an assessment of the legal context of the invoice while utilizing specialized legal subject matter expert knowledge to extract core critical legal terminology and concepts.  Document reasons for any additional adjustments made to invoice line items, identifying the billing guideline violated and the rationale for the amount adjusted.
  • Use legal knowledge and careful discretion to make corrections to adjusted and non-adjusted invoice lines as needed.
  • Forward the audited and peer-reviewed legal invoice through the review chain as required.
Promptly and professionally resolve law firm appeals, as follows:
  • Receive and organize law firm requests for reconsideration from Operations Support Specialists or management and/or work the intake queue for requests for reconsideration.
  • Address law firm requests for reconsideration of adjusted amounts while utilizing careful judgment, legal knowledge and utmost professionalism while upholding integrity of the legal billing process.
  • Work with law firms in a professional manner via legal expert-to-expert written communications to carefully resolve disputed invoice line items using sound independent discretion and legal knowledge base.
  • Efficiently and accurately review appealed legal invoice entries.
  • Demonstrated superior ability to review, analyze and evaluate legal fees and costs/expenses in appealed invoice entries and to exercise discretion and sound independent judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions in a law firm appeals context.
  • Gather key information regarding the adjustment history and LBACOE communication history on a disputed line item.
  • At the direction of management, handle escalated law firm appeals that have not been successfully resolved by QA Analyst I peers (“appeals mediation”).
  • At the direction of management, organize and participate in a resolution conference to be held with the law firm and client representative, when direct appeals mediation with the law firm does not successfully resolve the dispute.
Additional Responsibilities and Skills:
  • Conduct periodic audit and data analysis to support management in collecting and verifying performance metrics for internal use and use with clients and law firms.
  • Communicate and calibrate with audit team and appeals team members as part of critical legal expert QA Analyst “task force” that resolves ambiguities or “close judgment calls” in interpretation of client guidelines when applied to complex legal invoicing scenarios.
  • Using sound discretion and legal expertise, analyze and condense legal service agreements to produce effective operational tools, meeting and in some cases exceeding customer expectations.
  • Liaise with and provide periodic feedback to CIOX Artificial Intelligence Decision Science team on functionality and improvement of machine learning end-user experience and accuracy.
  • Strong understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, including multijurisdictional exposure.
  • Self-motivated with an ability to work independently and with very limited supervision after training.
  • Ability to monitor the work flow and performance of partnered legal invoice analysts and identify/escalate any concerns to management.
  • Excellent computer skills with the ability to learn the electronic legal bill submission and auditing software
  • Sound command of the English language-- grammar, syntax and style -- including an understanding of the conventions of punctuation and capitalization.
  • Excellent spelling and proofreading skills.
  • Effective communication skills - ability to obtain information from others and deliver information to others orally and in written form
  • Organizational skills, including the ability to organize work in an orderly fashion conducive to the prompt, efficient review of an appropriate number of legal invoices in a given day or time period
  • Familiarity with common business math and possess appropriate business telephone skills
  • Ability to carry out detailed written or verbal instructions; ability to respond to requests effectively and efficiently
32601.publicDescription:
Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II
Location: Hybrid in St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN (Must be located in MN; flexible for 2 days per week onsite)
Contract Type: Hybrid Contract Position
Employment Type: W2 only

NOTE: Bilingual (French, German, Italian and/or Spanish) would be a plus, medical malpractice experience would be nice as well.

Myticas' direct client, based in St. Cloud, MN or Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Review Quality Assurance Analyst II (QA Analyst II) for a hybrid contract position. This role focuses on quality assurance testing within the Legal Bill Analysis Center of Excellence (LBACOE). The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in legal concepts related to invoice auditing across multiple areas of law.

Required Qualifications:

  • Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an ABA-accredited law school is required.
  • Strong understanding of legal billing guidelines and UTBMS task codes.
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Excellent written communication skills, including grammar, syntax, style, spelling, and proofreading.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Bilingual (French, German, Italian and/or Spanish) would be a plus, medical malpractice experience would be nice as well

Job Responsibilities:

Quality Assurance & Invoice Review:

  • Conduct expert peer reviews of invoice analysts' work, applying specialized legal knowledge to ensure accuracy and compliance with billing guidelines.
  • Assess legal context and terminology within invoices and make necessary adjustments to previously modified line-item entries.
  • Document comprehensive justifications for adjustments, citing specific billing guideline violations.
  • Ensure accurate classification of UTBMS task, fee, activity, and expense codes.
  • Use discretion and legal expertise to correct both adjusted and non-adjusted invoice line items.

Appeals & Mediation:

  • Serve on the Appeals Team, engaging in written communication with law firms to resolve disputes over invoice adjustments.
  • Participate in legal expert-to-expert discussions to reach mutually agreeable resolutions on disputed invoice adjustments, in alignment with client directives.
  • Handle escalated appeals mediation, including drafting written summaries for clients and attending resolution conferences with law firms, management, and clients.
  • Work professionally with law firms via written communications to resolve disputes while maintaining integrity in the legal billing process.

Collaboration & Process Improvement:

  • Support business unit partners by identifying process improvements and opportunities within the Legal Bill Analysis (LBA) process.
  • Collaborate with audit and appeals teams to interpret client guidelines and resolve complex legal invoicing scenarios.
  • Provide feedback to the CIOX Artificial Intelligence Decision Science team to improve machine learning functionality for invoice auditing.

Additional Skills & Responsibilities:

  • Conduct periodic audits and data analysis to support performance metrics and reporting.
  • Organize workflow efficiently to review invoices promptly and accurately.
  • Communicate effectively in both oral and written form to obtain and deliver information.
  • Possess strong business math skills and appropriate telephone communication skills.
  • Ability to analyze legal service agreements and develop effective operational tools.
  • Proficient in electronic legal billing software and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Maintain professionalism while working independently with minimal supervision.

32541.title: EDW Informatica ETL Developer
32541.description:
Job Title: Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Informatica ETL Developer Location: Telecommute (with occasional travel to Springfield, IL) Job Summary: We are seeking a highly experienced Informatica Extract Transform Load (ETL) Developer to join our Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) team. This role is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL processes using Informatica PowerCenter and Teradata. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of data integration, performance tuning, and data warehousing best practices, with a focus on supporting healthcare-related data systems.

Key Responsibilities: • Design and implement ETL solutions using Informatica PowerCenter to extract, transform, and load data from various agency sources. • Automate data staging processes and optimize ETL job scheduling for performance and efficiency. • Administer and support ETL environments, including development and production systems. • Perform repository backups, recovery operations, and system maintenance. • Develop mappings, mapplets, sessions, and workflows using a wide range of Informatica transformations. • Monitor and troubleshoot ETL jobs across development, testing, and production environments. • Write and optimize complex SQL queries and Unix Shell scripts for data marts and interfaces in Teradata. • Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements, document technical solutions, and support project planning. • Participate in unit, integration, and system testing. • Provide technical support, mentoring, and guidance to team members. • Communicate project status and deliverables to leadership and clients. • Continuously learn and apply new technologies to enhance system performance and capabilities.

Required Qualifications: • 7+ years of experience with Informatica PowerCenter and ETL development. • 5+ years of experience writing complex SQL and performance tuning. • 5+ years of experience with Teradata (v17+), including Fastload, TPT, and Multiload utilities. • 5+ years of Informatica PowerCenter administration experience. • 2+ years of Unix Shell (Bash/Korn) scripting experience. • Strong communication, collaboration, and mentoring skills. • Bachelor’s or advanced degree in IT, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field. • Strong organizational and time management skills. 2025 Page 1 of 2 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) ETL/Informatica Developer

Preferred Qualifications: • 5+ years of data warehouse development experience. • 5+ years of data modeling experience using ERWIN or similar tools. • 2+ years of experience with Azure Data Factory and Snowflake. • Experience with scripting languages such as Python, R, or JavaScript (React). • Familiarity with Informatica Data Quality (IDQ), Address Doctor, and Metadata Manager. • Experience with Medicaid, Medicare, or healthcare data systems. • Experience working in Agile environments. • Knowledge of BI and data integration technologies across relational and multidimensional systems.

(AWS, Azure, GCP).

Piston Automotive wasn’t just founded to make things. It was founded to make things better. And that begins with building better teams solely dedicated to achieving excellence at every level of execution through a combination of experience, expertise, and a deep seeded passion for what we do. Our assemblies consistently set the standard because our people consistently raise the bar.

Competitive Wages, Paid Holidays & Vacation, Medical & Rx Plans, Dental & Vision Plans, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, Employee Assistance Program, Life & Disability Coverage, 401K with Company Match, Tuition Reimbursement , Vehicle and Product Discounts

  • Manage provisioning of end user workstations/laptops based on corporate standards.
  • Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Qualifications

  • A minimum of six years of experience in an IT Manager role.
  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or a related field
  • Six (6) years of experience creating strategic plans
  • A minimum of four (4) years of experience working with cross-functional teams
  • Four (4) years of experience managing a budget
  • A minimum of 4 years of project management experience
  • A minimum of three (3) years of experience training and developing direct reports
  • Six (6) years of organization and planning experience
  • A minimum of six years of experience with the following technical skills:
  • SQL Server database software
  • Microsoft operating systems and Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)
  • VMWare
  • PC
  • RF
  • Printing
  • Server
  • Network Storage systems
  • Knowledge of networking
  • Backup technologies to support troubleshooting efforts
  • Industry based IT tools
  • Must be able to regularly lift and/or move up to 30 pounds.


Preferred skills/Qualifications:

  • IT automotive systems
  • ERP such as Plex
  • MES
  • Plant floor applications and networks preferred.

32652.title: Senior AWS Cloud Project Manager
32652.description:
Job Title: Sr Technical Project Manager (AWS Cloud Platform)
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid)
Duration: 5+ months (with a possibility of extension)

BR: $135hr
Contract until 12/31/2025 (possible extension)
 
TOP Skills:
  1. 5-10 years of experience of technical project management.
  2. Ability to lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple stakeholders effectively.
  3. Experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS.
  4. Experience managing SDLC projects.
 
Primary Function:
Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s). Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.
 
Key Responsibilities:
  • Initiate and Plan Project:
    • Collaborate with business and IT management to establish project goals, objectives, financials, and deliverables.
    • Build and manage the project plan, resources, and Gantt charts to accomplish the project scope.
  • Project Control and Quality Management:
    • Evaluate scope changes, issues, and risks, working with stakeholders to resolve them.
    • Measure performance against the original plan and budget, ensuring compliance with corporate and functional policies and procedures.
    • Maintain and update the RAID log to track project risks, actions, and issues.
  • Execute and Close Project:
    • Develop and execute work plans, securing authorized resources to complete all activities.
    • Lead the team in delivering the project scope, gather lessons learned, and obtain final project approval.
    • Assist in managing the process to ensure all validation deliverables are completed.
  • Project Communication:
    • Produce and distribute project reports to provide accurate status and decision support to stakeholders.
    • Make recommendations to resolve issues and manage risks based on the current project status.
  • Resource and Team Management:
    • Coordinate and assign resources to ensure project needs are met, effectively assign tasks based on team members’ abilities.
    • Motivate the project team to achieve desired outcomes.
  • Decisions and Financial Control:
    • Make decisions impacting project-level activities; influence or have authority over the project budget.
    • Develop and manage a financial plan, maintaining spend within +/- 10% of the overall budget.
    • Track and update financials in Clarity, coordinating estimates and invoices with vendors.
  • Vendor Coordination:
    • Coordinate vendor activities and ensure timely milestone delivery.
    • Ensure vendor purchase orders (POs) are processed promptly.
  • Project Meetings:
    • Facilitate Project Management meetings to oversee execution activities with IT System Owner and Principal Business Systems Consultant.
 
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in Information Technology project management.
  • Proven experience with cloud platforms, especially AWS, experience with on-premise HPC clusters, and familiarity with data management tools and best practices a must
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Flexibility needed while collaborating with the global project team and vendors (eg 7 AM meetings and /or 4 pm meetings).
 
Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.
 
Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership.
