32600.title: Hybrid Work-French Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (W-2101)
32600.description:
Bill Rate: $40/hr; 

Location:  Hybrid role, Minneapolis, MN 55402

Job Description:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I will be responsible for the prompt, accurate and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices submitted by law firms and vendors of our clients. The candidate will be responsible for making adjustments to invoice line item entries, where those line-item entries violate provisions of the relevant billing guidelines and documenting the justification for such adjustments. The Legal Invoice Analyst I will provide guidance to business unit partners regarding issues or opportunities within the LBA process.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
• Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist and/or work the intake queue for self-assignments.
• Verify the compliance to legal billing guidelines by law firms and vendor submitting invoices.
• Verify the accuracy of the UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
• Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, identifying the billing guideline violated and the rationale for the amount adjusted.
• Forward the audited legal bill through the review chain as required.
• Communicate and calibrate with Legal Invoice Analyst and Quality Assurance Analyst team members.
• Excellent ability to review, analyze and evaluate legal fee and cost/expense invoice entries and to exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
• Strong understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
• Self-motivated with an ability to work independently and with very limited supervision after training.
• Excellent computer skills with the ability to learn the electronic legal bill submission and auditing software.
• Organizational skills, including the ability to organize work in an orderly fashion conducive to the prompt, efficient review of an appropriate number of legal invoices in a given day or time period.
• Familiarity with common business math and possess appropriate business telephone skills.

Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience:
Minimum: Paralegal Certification or Bachelor’s Degree in legal related discipline and/or equivalent work experience. 
Minimum Experience: 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
Tools: Microsoft Office Suite ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
• Experience with legal billing processes.
• Firm understanding of the federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.
• Team Work: Must work collaboratively with people within LBACOE and throughout the entire WK organization, while providing constructive feedback to LBACOE from the BUs.
• Problem Solving: Capable of independent thinking and rendering sound decisions. Astute at identifying and engaging the necessary resources to help in decision making. Takes quick actions to identify and resolve the cause of any problem. Proactive in nature.
• Leadership: Exhibits individual control over day to day responsibilities as well as the ability to work collaboratively with other BUs to produce results.
• Planning and Organizing: Must be able to implement plans with the purpose of achieving short and long term goals. Must be able to prioritize in order to accomplish these goals in a given time period.
• Technology: Has the ability to partner with experts in the technology field to identify technology gaps and requirements necessary to develop position and impactful solutions.
• Learning: Ability to acquire new or modify existing knowledge to support a changing market place and workforce. Can demonstrate a capability to learn by study, experience, or instruction.
 • Initiative and Enterprise: Is self-directed and has the ability to translate ideas into action and get things done.
32600.publicDescription:
Location: Hybrid Contract Position | Minneapolis, MN
NOTE: W2 Candidates Only!

Myticas's direct client, based in Minneapolis, MN, is seeking a Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer for a hybrid contract position.

Position Overview:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I is responsible for the prompt, accurate, and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices from law firms and vendors. The selected candidate will ensure compliance with billing guidelines by adjusting invoice line items that violate provisions and documenting justifications for those adjustments. The analyst will also provide guidance to business unit partners on issues or opportunities within the Legal Billing Audit process.

Essential Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
  • Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist or self-assign tasks from the intake queue.
  • Verify compliance with legal billing guidelines for submitted invoices.
  • Ensure the accuracy of UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity, and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
  • Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, specifying the violated billing guideline and rationale for the adjustment amount.
  • Forward audited legal invoices through the appropriate review chain as required.
  • Collaborate with Legal Invoice Analysts and Quality Assurance Analysts.
  • Exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
  • Demonstrate a strong understanding of legal terminology and claims-related legal situations, with multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
  • Work independently with minimal supervision after training.
  • Utilize electronic legal bill submission and auditing software efficiently.
  • Organize work to ensure the prompt and efficient review of legal invoices within designated timeframes.
  • Apply basic business math skills and maintain appropriate business telephone etiquette.

Required Skills, Qualifications, and Experience:

Education:

  • Paralegal Certification or a Bachelor's Degree in a legal-related discipline, or equivalent work experience.

Experience:

  • 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
  • Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
  • Familiarity with legal billing processes.
  • Strong understanding of federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.

Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Experience with legal billing systems and processes.

Core Competencies:

  • Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with the Legal Billing Audit Center of Excellence (LBACOE) and other business units while providing constructive feedback.
  • Problem Solving: Think independently and make sound decisions. Identify necessary resources to aid in decision-making and take proactive steps to resolve problems.
  • Leadership: Demonstrate personal accountability for day-to-day tasks and collaborate with other business units to achieve results.
  • Planning and Organizing: Prioritize tasks to achieve short- and long-term goals within designated timeframes.
  • Technology: Partner with technology experts to identify gaps and develop impactful solutions.
  • Learning: Adapt to changes in the marketplace and workforce by acquiring or modifying knowledge through study, experience, or instruction.
  • Initiative: Exhibit self-direction and translate ideas into action to achieve results.

32564.title: 100% remote- SAP-SRM/HANA migration Technical Lead (A-30533)
32564.description:
Leads & Managers Unique III

07/21/2025 to 12/31/2025

BR: $170

US-IL-Lake County

 

SAP-SRM/ARIBA Technical Lead/BSA.

 

This role will be responsible for supporting the Phase 0 analysis for applications in R&D FinOps that integrate with SAP/SRM.

The SAP-SRM/ Ariba Technical Lead/BSA would be responsible for reviewing the design, development, and implementation of the overall architecture of an SAP-SRM and Ariba solution within R&D. They would ensure, the current design aligns with business needs by considering factors like scalability, security, integration with other systems, and the entire "source-to-pay" procurement process across sourcing, contracting, and purchasing functions within the SAP-SRM and ARIBA platform.

 

Key Responsibilities:

• Solution Design:

o Understanding of procurement processes, including sourcing strategies, contract negotiation, and invoice management.

o Analyze business requirements, identify pain points, and create a comprehensive SAP-SRM and Ariba solution architecture that addresses those needs, including system integration with other enterprise applications.

• Technical Expertise:

o Possess in-depth knowledge of SAP-SRM and Ariba functionalities, including modules like Sourcing, Contract Management, Procurement, Supplier Management, Spend Analytics, and the underlying technical infrastructure.

o Familiarity with SAP technical architecture, data models, and integration technologies like APIs, web services, and middleware.

o Understanding of Data and with knowledge or exposure of PL/SQL.

o Possess good Knowledge of Salesforce.

• Configuration and Customization: Configure and customize SAP Ariba to match specific business processes and workflows, including user interface design and data mapping.

• Integration Management: Design and implement integration points between SAP Ariba and other systems like ERP (SAP ECC or S/4HANA), CRM, and other third-party applications.

 

• Required Skills:

 

o Extensive knowledge of the entire SAP-SRM and Ariba suite, including sourcing, contracting, procurement, supplier management, and spend analytics.

o Ariba Network Ariba Buying and Invoicing Ariba Catalogs Ariba Contracts Ariba Sourcing Ariba Supplier

o Lifecycle and Performance Ariba Integration (CIG, Webservices)

o Applications integration with non-ERP systems SAP ECC 6.0 and S/4HANA, and Ariba-specific parameters, programs, and other functions

o SAP CIG add-on configuration (global settings, AN integration, and master data integration)

o Project Leadership: Lead the technical implementation of SAP-SRM and Ariba projects, including managing development teams, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring project deliverables are met.

 

• Additional Required Responsibilities:

o Understand the landscape of the applications in the R&D FinOps domain that have integrations with SRM and determine impact of the SRM replacement.

o Expand Ariba knowledge to learn more applications such as Tonkean, Coupa and how they integrate with our R&D systems because of Project Genesis

o Meet with Business stakeholders to understand current workflows and integrations with SAP/SRM.

o Create workflows of the existing processes and document the gaps with the new processes.

o Work with the Robotic Process Automation team to collaborate on any BOTS that may be impacted as part of the SAP SRM replacement.

 

• Everyday BAU Support:

o The person in this position will perform and/or coordinate day-to-day activities to meet departmental/project objectives.

o Carry out root/cause analysis on more complex problems. Supplement the application suppler team in minor demand management, production incident management and design, develop, and implement innovative solutions.

 

Qualifications

3 to- 8 years of experience working with SAP ECC and/or S/4HANA MM procurement-related configuration 3 years of experience in setup of one or more SAP-SRM and Ariba modules 3 years of technical experience with SAP-SRM and Ariba Integration 3 years of experience working with current SAP Ariba configuration.

Comprehensive knowledge of most common source-to-pay processes and how Ariba and SAP SRM can support Functional and technical understanding of MM module, plus its relationship with other modules (especially FI). Experience with at least one global rollout of SAP-SRM and/or Ariba that included the Americas, EMEA, and Asia SAP Ariba Integration Certification preferred.

32507.description:
Cloud/DevOps Engineer (Bill Rate- $100)

Assignment Length – 1 year

Onsite position – local candidates 

NOTE: Looking for W2 candidates only.

Required top 3 hard skills:

  • CI/CD (GitLab)
  • Terraform
  • AWS

Required top 3 soft skills:
  • Collaboration & Teamwork
  • Autonomy and Critical Thinking
  • Ability to assess necessary activities and prioritize for completion of assignments using excellent time management, prioritization skills and work ethic.
Job Description:
One of our direct clients is looking for a Cloud/DevOps Engineer II who will be a member of the Solutions Engineering & Cloud Operations (SE&CO) team whose mission is to design, build, and deliver high quality, secure, cost-effective, and innovative enterprise solutions for the Bank. The engineer will lead the design, maintenance, transition to, and operations of cloud platforms. The Engineer collaborates with stakeholders to obtain and translate business requirements into technical implementations and provides guidance to technical teams regarding architectural and procedural best practices and functional experience. This role will participate in multiple workstreams with varying levels of skillset in the cloud.
The Senior Cloud Engineer leads the design, maintenance, transition to, and operations of cloud platforms. The Engineer collaborates with stakeholders to obtain and translate business requirements into technical implementations and provides guidance to technical teams regarding architectural and procedural best practices and functional experience.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Leads the technical design, maintenance, and operation of cloud-based platforms.
• Leads automation efforts to minimize manual work and ensure transparency in all aspects of the secure cloud ecosystem.
• Implements hybrid IT by integrating different cloud services with back-end, traditional data center services.
• Migrates legacy applications to public cloud services in a rehosting approach or in a revising approach for efficiency, agility, and disaster recovery.
• Partners with stakeholders to obtain and translate requirements into technical implementations.
• Integrates existing legacy systems with proposed systems by identifying gaps between the current and future state.
• Oversees and develops continuous delivery framework and tools.
• Develops testing use cases and detailed testing plans that map to the documented business and technical requirements.
• Leads technical and end-user resources to execute detailed tests and analyze testing results.
• Assists with implementation of customer side monitoring tools and may lead operation outage events.
• Provides timely/responsive technical support including rotational on call support.

32525.title: Local to MA - Hybrid, Senior IT Program Manager (Pharma experience) (A-30432)
32525.description:
Leads & Managers Commodity III (DI3)

BR: $148

07/07/2025 to 02/28/2026

US-MA-Worcester (381 Plantation Street)

 

Senior Project Manager

Primary Function:

Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s). Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion. Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project. Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.

Key Responsibilities:

• Initiate and Plan Project: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on project goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resource needs to accomplish the scope.

• Project Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the project working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the project is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.

• Executing and Closing Project: Develops and executes a work plan obtaining authorized resources to ensure all activities are performed. Leads team in delivering project scope. Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.

• Project Communication: Communicate project progress by producing project reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current project status to resolve issues and manage risks.

• Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon their abilities. Motivates project team in order to deliver project outcomes.

• Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.

• Decisions: Make decisions that impact project level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for project budget.

• Financial Control: Develops and manages a financial plan with multi-million dollar spend. Tracks actual spend, accruals, proactively creates spend estimates on a regular basis (at least monthly) and coordinates estimates and invoices with project vendors, in order to maintain spend at +/- 10% of the overall project budget.

Qualifications:

• Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.

• Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.

• 5-10 years of experience in project management

• Experience managing SDLC projects

 

Preferred Qualifications:

• PMP Certification

• PPM Tool experience

• Pharmaceutical experience

• Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems

 

Key Stakeholders:

• Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership

32526.title: Local to Chicago - Application Support Analyst (A-29079)
32526.description:
Job Title: Application Support Analyst
Location: North Chicago, IL – Hybrid role
Duration: 6+ Months Contract (Possible further extension)
BR: $73.70

Top 3-5 skills requirements should this person have:
  1. Must have Lead experience and managing projects.
  2. Experience with SLAs and putting together timelines for projects.
  3. Service NOW - Ticketing and putting together dashboards and read dashboards.
  4. Good communication skills.
  5. Strong Analytical and Problem-solving Skills.

Nice to have (but not required):
  • Pharma or Regulatory application experience.
  • ITIL methodology- Service Management (ITIL is nice to have).

Job Description:
The Service Analyst is accountable for confirming that the appropriate production processes and quality metrics are executed for Client’s Applications that are scored with low risk and complexity.
The role will also provide support and prioritization for the execution of Application Maintenance and Support tasks and some critical production services.

Responsibilities:
List up to 10 main responsibilities for the job. Include information about the accountability and scope.
  • Offer oversight for some critical production services including: Incident, Problem, Service Transition and Disaster Recovery and seek assistance for other critical services such as: Audit, Validation and Compliance.
  • Participate P1- P2 MIM bridge and on call rotation and confirms business impact.
  • Provides support for audit requests for the ACOE.
  • Reviews the Disaster Recovery plan and schedule to ensure that the service providers exercise test drills and execute the plan as designed.
  • Participates with supplier personnel regarding short-term architecture strategy development and provides recommendation as it relates to Application performance or continuous improvement.
  • Performs post installation analysis including lessons learned and provides recommendations for continuous improvement implementations as needed.
  • Provides inputs to the technical reports and documentation that confirm the Root Cause Analysis for Incidents and Problems.
  • Contributes to the development of new or the refinement of existing critical Service Operations and/or Service Transition processes.
  • Assists providers in coordinating with 3rd party hosting or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) providers on recovery capabilities.
  • Accountable for ensuring that the Service Transition process is fully executed by the provider and provides feedback into the existing Change, Release and Deployment management processes.
  • Reviews the Service Providers application and technical documentation such as Request for Change, operating procedures and technical and non-technical specifications and provides feedback and approval as appropriate.
  • Evaluates the Service Providers reported trends and the process improvement recommendations to help identify areas where preventative maintenance might be performed to improve Applications efficiency, in terms of both the performance of the Applications and any related maintenance and support efforts.
  • Responsible for reviewing the service provider Service Level Agreements on a regular basis and providing oversight for any action plans that are required to address performance issues.
  • Performs daily reviews of ticket activity: queue levels, processing efficiency, backlogs, aging levels along with prior day Incidents to ensure that ticket processing and the problem Management engines are performing within expected operating parameters.
  • Serves as primary client’s contact point and first level of escalation for Incidents and Problems.
  • Assists with the prioritization and escalation of system recovery issues with Cross-functional, Build and Infrastructure teams.
  • Assists MSPs in ensuring that all the user access to IT systems are properly controlled and authenticated and segregation of duties are maintained.
  • Will coordinate an annual access certification process ensuring that current users still require access to applications under their responsibility.
  • Seeks assistance from senior personnel in performing the initial business risk assessment for Maintenance and Support and Minor Enhancement activities.
  • Partakes in vendor performance meetings and operational reviews.
  • Supports vendor initiated continuous improvement performance plans.

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Computer Engineering.
  • Minimum of 2-4 years of combined experience in Information Technology.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of (could be a platform or a vertical such as Oracle, or Life Sciences Pharmaceutical Research and Development or Financial application technologies, etc.).
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Strong problem resolution skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work within cross-functional teams towards task completion.

7/14/2025 to 12/31/2025

US-IL-Lake County

Bill Rate: $160

 

As the Senior Consultant Program Manager, you will be responsible for managing pharmaceutical industry programs and projects of varying scopes from inception to completion, while interacting with IT and Business users. This particular opportunity will be responsible for managing an Program level IT Integration workstream for Mergers and Acquisitions efforts.

 

Successful candidates will manage and/or participate in the following types of engagements for our clients:

• Program management across multiple work streams in business and technology initiatives

• Project and/or program health assessments with recommendations for recovery and course correction

• Project and program governance, processes, procedures, and best practice planning and execution

 

Key Responsibilities

• Directly interface with key stakeholders within the domain and across AbbVie R&D to build alignment around project objectives and ensure a harmonized end-to-end portfolio/project management approach.

• Project and Program management – Encompassing initiation, planning, execution and benefits realization

• Develops and balances program management deliverables for successful execution

• Works with executive team to ensure alignment with transformation goals and objectives – including benefit realization, organization alignment (Target Operating Model), processes and skills

• Actively participates and coordinates program-level interactions with sponsors to ensure proper implementation of programs and projects

• Identifies and implements program management best practices

• Acts as liaison to internal and external constituencies, vendors, sponsors, etc.

Proactively identifies and manages issues and risks

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

Job Description Summary

We are seeking a Senior Program Manager to lead and manage IT Programs/projects who would be involved in close collaboration with both IT and business stakeholders, overseeing programs and projects from initiation through successful completion.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead cross-functional program management across multiple business and technology workstreams.

  • Conduct program health assessments and implement recovery strategies when necessary.

  • Develop and implement governance frameworks, procedures, and best practices to support program execution.

  • Engage with key stakeholders across R&D and other domains to align project objectives and ensure a consistent portfolio/project management approach.

  • Manage all phases of the project lifecycle: initiation, planning, execution, and benefits realization.

  • Align programs with broader transformation goals, including operating model changes, skill development, and benefit tracking.

  • Collaborate with executive leadership and sponsors to ensure effective program implementation.

  • Serve as a liaison with vendors, sponsors, and other internal/external stakeholders.

  • Provide strategic guidance on program design, methods, and execution techniques.

  • Support portfolio-level integration initiatives and help standardize strategies, processes, and governance models.

  • Mentor project managers and build project management capabilities across the organization.

  • Partner with Finance and Controlling teams to manage program budgets, forecasts, and performance tracking.

  • Oversee procurement and vendor relationships, including contracts, SOWs, MSAs, POs, and invoice processing.

  • Identify and manage risks and issues proactively.

  • Apply Agile and Waterfall methodologies appropriately depending on project requirements.

  • Maintain oversight of program structure, resource allocation, and workload management.

  • Support the advancement of PMO tools and practices, including Microsoft Project, Planview Innotas, Clarity; experience with Jira is a plus.

  • Provide business analysis support where needed.

  • Stay current with industry trends, professional development, and training.

Required Qualifications

  • 8–11 years of proven experience in program and project management, portfolio governance, business analysis, and application development.

  • Demonstrated success managing large programs ($4–$10 million budgets; durations ranging from 2–5 years).

  • Solid understanding of various project and portfolio management frameworks (PMI, Agile, Scrum, OPM3, etc.).

  • Experience with program and portfolio intake, alignment, and funding models.

  • Strong communication, leadership, and conflict resolution skills.

  • Proficient in project management and PMO tools (Microsoft Project, Planview Innotas, Clarity; Jira preferred).

  • Ability to mentor others and drive team performance.

  • Strong business analysis skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • PMP certification

  • Pharmaceutical industry experience.

This is a hybrid position requiring both remote and onsite work in Waukegan, IL.

32566.title: Local to Chicago-Infrastructure Analyst (A-30504)
32566.description:
Analyst Mainstream II (EII2)                                                                                                                                       

07/14/2025 to 01/09/2026

US-IL-Lake County

Bill Rate: $102.30

 

Staff Augmentation Role: Infrastructure Compliance Support

 

AbbVie is looking for a results-driven, customer-centric individual with excellent communication skills to help support our Infrastructure Compliance function. Our goal is to minimize the technology related risks associated with the company’s network, data centers, and desktop/mobile environment. We would like someone with experience working in an IT infrastructure environment, and we will train on the compliance and risk management functions.

 

 

Responsibilities:

Risk Treatment

• Log infrastructure related risks into the enterprise risk management platform (OneTrust).

• Work with business and IT system owners to assess the logged risks based on the established risk management framework.

• Assess the proposed treatment plans for risks that require remediation.

• Work with infrastructure teams to track implementation of risk remediations against the established timeline, escalating cases where tasks are falling behind.

Internal Audit Support

• Monitor group email account for incoming requests.

• Create information requests to identified Infrastructure SME’s in order to fulfill auditor requests.

• Review provided information for completeness, submit and log responses in team tracker.

Other

• Update documentation for infrastructure assets in the enterprise asset manager (CMDB), such as regulatory characteristics and data classification.

• Assist with creating/formatting data operational metrics for compliance activities leadership.

 

Qualifications - External

• Bachelor's Degree plus 5 years’ relevant technology experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience

• Experience working with technical infrastructure components such as servers, firewalls, data centers, backup and restore processes, and cloud hosted environments.

• Ability to learn AbbVie’s information security and risk management processes, including how to document and treat risks within the enterprise risk management platform (OneTrust).

• Ability to leverage the existing set of IT Policies and Procedures found in the enterprise document management system (OneVault).

• Ability to work independently, with judgement for when to escalate and communicate issues across the team and to team leadership.

• Strong analytical and communication skills, with the ability to work with technical and non-technical team members.
32566.publicDescription:
Infrastructure Risk Management Analyst
Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

Job Summary:
We are seeking a results-driven, customer-focused individual with exceptional communication skills to support our Infrastructure Compliance function. The primary goal is to minimize technology-related risks associated with the company’s network, data centers, and desktop/mobile environment.
This role requires prior experience in an IT infrastructure environment, and we provide training for compliance and risk management functions.

Responsibilities:

Risk Treatment:

  • Record infrastructure-related risks in the enterprise risk management platform (OneTrust).
  • Collaborate with business and IT system owners to assess risks based on the established risk management framework.
  • Evaluate proposed treatment plans for risks requiring remediation.
  • Coordinate with infrastructure teams to monitor the implementation of risk remediation plans, escalating tasks that fall behind the timeline.

Internal Audit Support:

  • Monitor the group email account for incoming audit requests.
  • Generate information requests for identified Infrastructure SMEs to fulfill auditor requirements.
  • Review submitted information for accuracy and completeness, log responses, and maintain the team tracker.

Additional Responsibilities:

  • Update documentation for infrastructure assets in the enterprise asset management system (CMDB), including regulatory characteristics and data classification.
  • Assist in creating and formatting operational metrics for compliance activities to support leadership.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of relevant technology experience or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.
  • Proven experience with technical infrastructure components, including servers, firewalls, data centers, backup/restoration processes, and cloud-hosted environments.
  • Ability to learn and apply the client’s information security and risk management processes, including risk documentation and treatment within OneTrust.
  • Familiarity with IT Policies and Procedures available in the enterprise document management system (OneVault).
  • Capability to work independently while recognizing when to escalate and communicate issues within the team or to leadership.
  • Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to effectively engage both technical and non-technical team members.

32585.title: Local to IN-Sr Project Manager (SOI-767233)
32585.description:
767233_IN-IDOA Senior Project Manager-Local Only

Pay Rate: $51.51_Sub_07/08/2025 
 

Job Summary:
The ideal candidate will be a master of navigating multiple critical paths, coordinating across diverse stakeholder groups, and keeping high – visibility projects aligned with strategic goals. While IT project management experience is not required candidates must have a background in IT.
Key Responsibilities:
  • Lead complex, high-impact projects involving multiple workstreams and stakeholder organizations.
  • Develop, manage, and execute comprehensive project schedules with multiple critical paths.
  • Build and sustain trusted relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ensure timely delivery of project milestones and manage project risks effectively.
  • Facilitate regular communication and collaboration among team members, stakeholders, and external partners.
  • Facilitate meetings and status updates for executive and program leadership.
  • Prepare and present project progress reports to senior management.
  • Anticipate risks, develop mitigation strategies, and drive solutions to maintain momentum.
  • Ensure alignment with project goals, scope, and state government requirements.
  • Track, report, and communicate progress in a clear, consistent manner.
  • Implement project management best practices and methodologies to optimize project outcomes.
Required Skills and Experience:

Project Management Expertise
  • 6+ Years managing large, highly visible enterprise projects with multiple internal stakeholders/contractors
  • 6+ Years overseeing multiple concurrent projects to successful completion
  • 6+ Years developing, monitoring, and maintaining comprehensive project plans
  • 6+ Years coordinating stakeholder activities to ensure timeline and budget adherence
  • 6+ Years compiling and presenting detailed data analysis and interpretations
Leadership & Communication
  • 6+ Years demonstrated team leadership and motivation experience
  • 6+ Years exceptional written/verbal communication and stakeholder management
  • 6+ Years effectively communicating project status to management/stakeholders
  • Strong organizational skills with ability to manage multiple priorities
Technical Requirements
  • Background in Information Technology (mandatory)
  • Familiarity with IT development methodologies (DevOps)
  • Flexibility for on-site work as required


Preferred Qualifications:
Certifications & Methodologies
  • PMP or equivalent project management certification (Highly Desired)
  • Experience with change management, Lean, or Agile in complex environments (Highly Desired)
Tools & Domain Experience
  • Familiarity with project management software/tools (Highly Desired)
  • Experience managing projects across diverse industries (Highly Desired)
  • State government project experience (Highly Desired)

32477.title: ASIC Development Engineer
32477.description:
Our clients team is expanding and looking for highly motivated and experienced professional engineers to join us to develop next generation systems, in a very fast growing and competitive environment. All positions require a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.

Main responsibilities:

-Ability to develop state of the art electronic devices and IP for Optical communication
-Proven experience in the deep sub-micron silicon technologies
-Ability to work in multi-site international development team
-Design of ASIC devices for processing of optical signals

Skills:

-Masters degree or PhD in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or related discipline
-8+ years of demonstrated experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design
-Skills in VHDL\Verilog development and ASIC verification
-Experience in DSP and FEC design is preferred
-Experience in high speed analog design
-Analytical thinking and problem-solving
-Team work and ability to work with international teams in multiple time zones
-Communication
-Ability to communicate in English
32477.publicDescription:
Position: Senior ASIC Design Engineer – Optical Communication Systems

Our client’s team is expanding and seeking highly motivated, experienced professional engineers to help develop next-generation systems in a rapidly growing and competitive industry. This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge technologies in optical communication. Candidates must hold a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or possess equivalent professional experience.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop state-of-the-art electronic devices and intellectual property (IP) for optical communication systems.
  • Apply proven expertise in deep sub-micron silicon technologies.
  • Collaborate effectively within a multi-site, international development team.
  • Design ASIC devices for the processing of optical signals.

Required Qualifications and Skills:

  • Master’s degree or PhD in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or a related discipline.
  • A minimum of 8 years of demonstrated experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design.
  • Proficiency in VHDL and/or Verilog for development and ASIC verification.
  • Preferred experience in digital signal processing (DSP) and forward error correction (FEC) design.
  • Experience with high-speed analog design is a plus.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Excellent teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate across international teams and time zones.
  • Effective communication skills, including fluency in English.

32548.title: Project Management Specialist
32548.description:
Our Finance institution client is looking for an experienced Project Management Specialist for a long term HYBRID contract in Ottawa. This is a high-visibility role supporting enterprise initiatives through the full project lifecycle, from planning to post-deployment transition. This contract requires a Goverment of Canada Secuirty clearance - at the reliability level. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead planning, execution, and delivery of strategic IT projects using Agile or hybrid methodologies

  • Oversee solution selection, configuration, implementation, and transition to operations

  • Manage project plans, risks, issues, interdependencies, and stakeholder communications

  • Track and report on project metrics, timelines, and deliverables using tools like JIRA/Confluence

  • Coordinate with stakeholders, subject matter experts, and resource managers to ensure alignment

  • Support development of supporting documentation, workshop materials, and executive briefings

  • Organize and manage project documentation and change tracking

Required Qualifications:

  • University degree or diploma in IT, Business, or a related field

  • Minimum 5 years’ technical experience in IT (software development, infrastructure, or database)

  • At least 5 years of project management experience on medium-to-large projects

  • 5+ years experience using Agile or hybrid (Agile/Waterfall) delivery methods

  • Proven ability to manage multiple initiatives and communicate across organizational levels

  • Excellent collaboration, organization, and communication skills

Additional Assets:

  • PMI-PBA, PMP, or Scrum Master certification

  • Experience supporting IT teams in fast-paced, parallel initiative environment

32595.title: Training Specialist (MS Dynamics)
32595.description:
Must haves:
 
  • Experience working in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and/or Finance & Operations (F&O) environments (or related CRM systems) particularly in a testing, data configuration, or sandbox context (e.g., managing user roles, creating records, validating workflows).
  • Experience with SharePoint teams sites for organizing, structuring and publishing digital content—such as building subpages, creating web parts and managing access and layout of knowledge repositories or internal learning portals.
  • Strong practical knowledge of creating and manipulating system data to support scenarios such as training simulations or testing use cases
  • Familiarity with documenting and organizing technical information, user guides, or system content that supports end-user learning—whether through task documentation, assignment instructions, or repository entries.
  • Detail-oriented with a structured approach to system task breakdowns and assignment creation, including the ability to align sandbox data to intended learning or testing outcomes.


*ROLE CONSISTS OF CHANGEMANAGEMNT & TRAINING




Scope
 
  • Support sandbox data preparation and environment setup for training and testing purposes within Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and F&O.
  • Create role-based test case data, assignments and simulation scripts that align with business processes and test scenarios. 
  • Structure and maintain a SharePoint-based knowledge repository, including subpages, metadata, web parts, and layout. 
  • Develop technical documentation, assignment steps, and knowledge articles from system test cases, workflows, or process maps. 
  • Apply inclusive, plain language, user-centered design standards to all structured documentation and SharePoint content. 
  • Coordinate with training designers, developers, and project team members to ensure readiness of sandbox environments and digital assets. 
 

Assignment Deliverables
 
  • Assignment/test case scripts aligned to training objectives and sandbox role scenarios 
  • SharePoint knowledge base site with structured content, metadata, and web part layout 
  • Sandbox configuration guides and data entry protocols by user role 
  • Documentation and crosswalks mapping DevOps test cases to training use scenarios 
  • Content packages and structured folders with SharePoint-published knowledge objects 
  • Recorded walkthroughs or annotated guides for handover to internal teams 


Experience and Skillset Requirements
 
Mandatory Requirements
 
  • Experience working in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and/or Finance & Operations (F&O) environments (or related CRM systems) particularly in a testing, data configuration, or sandbox context (e.g., managing user roles, creating records, validating workflows).
  • Experience with SharePoint teams sites for organizing, structuring and publishing digital content—such as building subpages, creating web parts and managing access and layout of knowledge repositories or internal learning portals.
  • Strong practical knowledge of creating and manipulating system data to support scenarios such as training simulations or testing use cases
  • Familiarity with documenting and organizing technical information, user guides, or system content that supports end-user learning—whether through task documentation, assignment instructions, or repository entries.
  • Detail-oriented with a structured approach to system task breakdowns and assignment creation, including the ability to align sandbox data to intended learning or testing outcomes.


Desired Skills and Experience
 
  • Hands-on experience using Microsoft Dynamics CE and/or F&O environments, with a focus on test data entry, role simulation, and system validation
  • Demonstrated ability to interpret and transform technical documentation, business processes, and system workflows into structured training-aligned content
  • Proficiency in SharePoint Online site creation, page structuring, and web part configuration for training content delivery
  • Strong analytical skills for designing, reviewing, and preparing assignment data and testing logic
  • Knowledge of content tagging, organization, and user navigation best practices in internal learning repositories
  • Familiarity with plain language and AODA accessibility standards for digital and written content
 

Resumes Evaluation/Criteria:
 
Criteria 1: System Application & Sandbox Data Support - 40 Points
 
  • Demonstrated experience working in Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE and/or F&O sandbox or live environments to set up, configure, and manipulate system data.
  • Ability to generate and manage realistic training/test case data aligned to user roles and business processes.
  • Proficiency in logging in with multiple roles or profiles to simulate different user experiences and validate assignments.
  • Experience creating or supporting test cases, acceptance testing, or scripted simulation steps for training and testing purposes.

Criteria 2: SharePoint and Knowledge Content Structuring - 30 Points
 
  • Demonstrated experience designing, maintaining, and updating SharePoint Online sites, with a focus on web part configuration and subpage layout.
  • Ability to translate training and system documentation into SharePoint knowledge repositories for user access.
  • Skilled in content tagging, foldering and metadata application for ease of search and retrieval.
  • Strong organizational thinking to structure content that supports learner self-navigation and training reference.

Criteria 3: Technical and Documentation Skills - 20 Points
 
  • Skilled in reading and applying business processes, DevOps test cases and workflows to create structured content (e.g., assignment steps, simulation scripts).
  • Ability to draft clear, step-based documentation or “how-to” guides that align with technical system functionality.
  • Familiar with versioning, content updates and maintaining traceability across documents and systems.
  • Awareness of AODA and plain language writing principles in technical or system documentation.
 
Criteria 4: Collaboration and Communication - 10 Points
 
  • Comfortable working with cross-functional teams (training, IT, business) to ensure data accuracy and assignment readiness.
  • Strong communicator who can clarify technical questions or escalate data gaps or assignment logic issues.
  • Responsive to feedback and capable of iterating system inputs or content based on evolving training needs.
 

Knowledge Transfer
 
What needs to be KT
  • Finalized storyboards used for system training simulations, assignments, and knowledge artifacts
  • Sandbox data logic and configuration documentation, including any mapping between roles and test cases used to support training scenarios
  • SharePoint knowledge structure and content documentation, including site/page organization, web part configuration and tagging strategies
  • Assignment/test case crosswalks that show how training simulations align with DevOps test cases or system functions
 
To whom
  • Managers / Project Managers / Team members
 
When
  • 1:1 meetings / team meetings / documentation on SharePoint site, throughout the duration of the project life cycle etc.

32509.title: Enterprise Systems Administrator II
32509.description:
Job Title: Enterprise Systems Administrator II
Location: Dearborn, MI
Schedule: Daytime, full-time. Onsite 3x/week at 1 American Rd, Dearborn, MI 48126.
Pay Rate: Depending on experience and aptitude, $40-$50 per hour
Type: W2 Contract, 6 months with likely extension. We are unable to sponsor and cannot consider C2C candidates.  

Summary:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Jira Cloud Administrator to help manage and
maintain our Jira Cloud instance, ensuring optimal performance, security, and usability. The Enterprise Systems Administrator II will be responsible for all aspects of Jira Cloud administration, including project manipulation, workflow configuration, user access, and integration with other Atlassian tools. A solid understanding of Confluence administration is also desirable, and experience with Azure Identity and Access Management (IAM) is a plus. This role requires a proactive problem-solver with excellent communication skills and a passion for enabling teams to work efficiently.
 
What You'll Do:
  • Advise, Coach Technical Solutions, primary leveraging Jira and Confluence.
  • Actively participating with Vehicle Development Engineering / Operations Teams’ workflows and processes to gain firsthand insights into their usage patterns, challenges, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Support and Troubleshooting: Provide technical support to Jira Cloud users and troubleshoot issues in a timely and effective manner.
  • Jira Cloud Administration: Manage and maintain our Jira Cloud instance, including user management, permission schemes, custom fields, workflows, and screens.
  • Documentation and Education: Create and maintain documentation for Jira Cloud processes, configurations, and best practices. Develop and deliver training sessions for new and existing users along using documentation and training resources
  • Automation and Optimization: Implement and maintain Jira Cloud automation
  • rules to streamline workflows and improve efficiency.• Security Management: Implement and enforce Jira Cloud security best practices to protect data from unauthorized access and cyber threats.
  • Confluence Administration: Provide basic administration support for Confluence, including managing spaces, pages, and permissions.
  • Process Improvement: Actively identify areas for process improvement within Jira and Confluence environments. Analyze existing workflows and configurations to identify bottlenecks and inefficiencies. Develop and implement solutions to optimize processes, improve user experience, and enhance team productivity.
  • Identity Access Management (Desired): Support Jira user access controls – knowledge of single sign-on (SSO) and user provisioning is beneficial.
 
Minimal Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of experience administering Jira Cloud Suite (Jira Software, Jira Service Management [JSM]) in a professional environment with a Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Technology, Computer Science) or equivalent experience.
  • In-depth knowledge of Jira Cloud features, functionality, and best practices.
  • Experience with Jira Cloud automation tools.
  • Strong understanding of Jira Cloud security principles and practices.
  • Successful track record of advising enterprise teams on the best practices to leverage Jira to accomplish their business objectives.
  • Possess a learning mindset and curiosity and have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

32543.title: EDW Medicaid Data Specialist
32543.description:
Primary Responsibilities:
• Provide data and information direction, guidance and recommendations supporting decision making for large Medicaid data warehouse implementation and operations. • With the specialized knowledge of the Medicaid and Children’s Health Insurance Programs, lead and guide internal and external stakeholders to make determinations relating to complex processes involving claims processing/adjudication, recipient/provider eligibility, and third-party liability. • Proactively identify and understand state Medicaid agency data needs and determine the recommended solution to meet them with credible reason, justification and validated proof of concepts. • Direct and train technical and business teams on healthcare topics understanding and utilizing healthcare data appropriately. • Proactively suggest and recommend enhancements and improvements throughout the project processes, driven by Medicaid best practices, standards and policies.

Functional Description: This position is a Medicaid Data Specialist for the Illinois Enterprise Data Warehouse supporting the State of Illinois Medicaid program. This role requires significant expertise of Medicaid Enterprise System modules and data warehousing or decision support systems. This role provides the guidance and direction to support a large data warehouse implementation and maintenance & operations. The selected candidate will provide the required decisions for the business and technical team members to modify, change, enhance or correct within the system, related to claims, provider, and recipient data. Roles in this function will partner with stakeholders to understand data requirements and support development and models such as interfaces, dashboards, data visualizations, decision aids and business case analysis to support the organization. Additional roles include producing and managing the delivery of activity, value analytics and critical deliverables to external stakeholders and clients. This is a telecommute position with some (<15%) required travel to Springfield, IL for onsite customer meetings.

Required Qualifications: • More than ten (10) years of experience in information technology with five (5) years of the experience working directly with/for State Medicaid agencies or equivalent supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and testing/validation of various systems. • Understanding of claims, recipient/eligibility, and provider/enrollment data processes. • Able to create and perform data analysis using SQL, Excel against data warehouses utilizing large datasets. • Knowledge of the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services reporting requirements and the programs covered. • Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills, manager/executive/director-level client facing, team collaboration, and mentoring skills. • Strong culture fit, demonstrating our culture values in action (Integrity, Compassion, Inclusion, Relationships, Innovation, and Performance). May 2025 Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Medicaid Data Specialist • Ability to travel to Springfield, IL two (3) to three (4) times per year.

Preferred Qualifications: • Master's Degree preferred • More than 2 years of experience working with PERM, T-MSIS, CMS Federal Reporting or similar projects • More than 2 years of experience in Adult/Child Core measures, HEDIS, CHIPRA or similar quality metrics • Experience with data analysis using Teradata Database Management System or other equivalent database management system. • Experience using JIRA, Rally, DevOps or equivalent. • Previous experience in large implementation projects. • Located within driving distance (3 - 5 Hours) of Springfield, IL.

32577.title: Senior Network Architect
32577.description:
Senior Network Architect – Segment Routing

Must be eligible or have Government of Canada Enhanced Clearance Required. 

We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with deep expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and forward-thinking team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing large-scale network infrastructure, with a strategic focus on segment routing technologies. Your leadership and technical expertise will help drive performance, scalability, and reliability across the network, ensuring alignment with evolving business needs.

Key Responsibilities

Segment Routing Design & Implementation

  • Design and implement advanced segment routing solutions to support traffic engineering and network efficiency.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate business and service requirements into scalable, high-performance network designs.

  • Develop and guide implementation strategies for segment routing architectures across service platforms.

Network Architecture & Optimization

  • Lead the planning and evolution of network architecture, with segment routing as a core component.

  • Identify opportunities to enhance performance and resiliency through traffic steering, BSIDs, and fast reroute mechanisms.

  • Conduct network assessments and provide strategic recommendations to ensure optimal performance and availability.

  • Deliver end-to-end network requirements and collaborate with system and application teams for successful solution integration.

Protocols, Standards & Best Practices

  • Maintain deep expertise in industry-standard protocols such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.

  • Stay current with emerging technologies and trends in segment routing and next-generation network design.

Troubleshooting & Incident Management

  • Act as a subject matter expert for complex network issues, providing guidance during critical incidents.

  • Work closely with operational teams to ensure rapid incident resolution and minimal service impact.

Vendor Engagement & Solution Evaluation

  • Evaluate and recommend networking hardware, software, and platforms aligned with segment routing strategies and growth plans.

  • Collaborate with vendors to influence product features and roadmaps based on operational needs.

Documentation & Knowledge Transfer

  • Create and maintain high-quality technical documentation, including design diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures.

  • Support internal training and mentoring initiatives, fostering knowledge transfer and continuous learning.

  • Participate in lab-based evaluations, proof of concept testing, and service validation activities.

Qualifications & Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier-grade network design, deployment, and operations.

  • Broad exposure to all phases of network-related product development and support.

  • Strong understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and Carrier Ethernet Services.

  • In-depth knowledge of core routing and switching protocols (BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, MPLS).

  • Hands-on experience with network automation and scripting (e.g., Python, Ansible).

  • Strong diagnostic skills with the ability to resolve complex networking issues.

  • Demonstrated leadership skills and experience mentoring technical teams.

  • Knowledge of network security architecture and best practices.

  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent are highly desirable.

  • Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams effectively.
32577.publicDescription:
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Network Architect with expertise in Segment Routing to join our dynamic and innovative team. As a Senior Network Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our network infrastructure, with a specific focus on segment routing technologies. Your deep understanding of network architecture, protocols, and best practices will contribute to the scalability, reliability, and performance of our network while ensuring alignment with business objectives.
The Sr. Network Architect is a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on all aspects of the LEO Network design and works with other LEO teams within Telesat and external contractors to ensure designs, implementation decisions, validation plans and documentation reflect the business requirements and objectives of the LEO program.

Main Responsibilities











 
  • Segment Routing Design and Implementation:
  • Participate in the design and implementation of segment routing solutions, ensuring optimal utilization of network resources and improved traffic engineering.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective network solution designs.
  • Develop strategies for partner business units to implement and manage network services implementations of segment routing architectures.
  • Network Architecture and Optimization:
  • Contribute to the architectural planning and evolution of the network, incorporating segment routing as a key technology.
  • Identify opportunities for optimization and enhanced performance using segment routing techniques, such as traffic steering, BSIDs and fast reroute mechanisms.
  • Perform network assessments and recommend improvements to maintain network health and operational efficiency.
  • Represent the LEO Network Engineering team by documenting and delivering network requirements to hardware and software development teams specifically in the areas of customer facing MEF 3.0 interface and networking design support requirements on data processing equipment
  • In coordination with Network team attend, contribute and produce materials for internal and external design and system engineering reviews for LEO Network Engineering related activities
  • Protocols and Standards:
  • Maintain a deep understanding of industry standards and protocols related to segment routing, such as IS-IS, BGP, and MPLS.
  • Stay updated with emerging trends and advancements in segment routing technologies, applying them to enhance network capabilities.
  • Troubleshooting and Problem Resolution:
  • Act as a subject matter expert, assist with complex network troubleshooting and incident resolution.
  • Collaborate with the LEO team to diagnose and address network behaviors and incidents in a timely manner, minimizing service disruptions.
  • Vendor and Solution Evaluation:
  • Evaluate new networking hardware, software, and solutions that align with segment routing strategies and network growth plans.
  • Collaborate with vendors to understand product roadmaps and provide feedback for feature enhancements.
  • Documentation and Knowledge Sharing:
  • Create and maintain detailed technical documentation, including network diagrams, configuration guidelines, and troubleshooting procedures related to segment routing.
  • Prepare and deliver materials including presentations, reference documentation and test strategies for LEO network equipment and applications deployment and operation
  • Share knowledge and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development.
  • With LEO Network Engineers develop and oversee plans including product idea investigations, proof of concept, Service validation and product demonstrations in Telesat LEO labs

Education and Experience

  • 10+ years of experience in carrier network design, operation and deployment
  • Broad experience or exposure across all areas of network related product design, development, verification, deployment and support
  • Understanding of Metro Ethernet Forum (MEF) standards and objectives as they relate to Carrier Ethernet Services.
  • Knowledge of routing and switching protocols, including BGP, OSPF, IS-IS, and MPLS.
  • Experience with network automation and scripting using tools such as Python, Ansible, or similar.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to diagnose and resolve complex network issues.
  • Demonstrated leadership skills and the ability to guide and mentor junior engineers.
  • In-depth understanding of security principles and practices as they relate to network architecture.
  • Proven experience in network design, architecture, and optimization.
  • Professional certifications such as Cisco CCIE, Juniper JNCIE, or equivalent, are highly desirable.
  • Comfortable leading meetings and able to communicate issues and trends to senior management and other groups at the appropriate level of detail.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and interpersonal skills.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities, with a proven track record of working effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Communicates well with own team and across organizational boundaries to ensure the successful completion of shared goals.

32535.title: ITSM Specialist, Lead (Toronto or NorthBay)
32535.description:
• Lead the design and review of IT best practice policy and procedure documentation to align with IT Service Management best practices.

• Collaborate with internal and external partners in the improvement/maintenance/development of processes and/or guides.

• Deliver coaching on transformation and cultural change in relation to the IT Service Management program; including facilitation of strategic planning to enable the team to plan and manage the required IT Service Management initiatives.

 


Skills
Experience and Skill Set Requirements

• Develop and lead cross-process compliance and design coordination within the operations team and cross-functionally throughout the organization. 

• Provide technical guidance to stakeholders to ensure that process standards are understood, process procedures and policies are adhered to, process activities are monitored and that best practice process activities are integrated accordingly. 

• Ensures documentation for I&IT best process procedures and protocols are drafted, ensuring their compatibility with the service management practices. 

• Provide advice and expertise to external vendors and senior management, to contribute to IT strategies and projects.

• Monitor compliance with agreements and ensure the timely identification and resolution of problems and issues.

• Provide expertise on all ITSM best practices and processes.

• Design, implement and work with the project team in completing all relevant and required documentation in alignment with OPS standards.

• Support the testing team during system and UAT testing.

• Participate in Knowledge transfer.

• IT Service Management process subject matter expertise, with experience in ITSM Best Practices (ITIL).

• Knowledge and experience in process design development and coordination across all organizational teams. 

• Experience in assisting with developing effective service delivery within Public Sector IT organizations.

• Experience effectively communicating strategic plans and providing guidance to senior management and extended supply chain (external vendors).

 

Criteria Ratings MUST TOTAL 100

Process Design Skills

40 points

• Knowledge of systems analysis, design, development, configuration, testing, release and installation principles and practices, methods, techniques, and tools for ITSM.

• Experience in designing processes for a public sector client, including the assessment of current state, and creation of supporting documentation and leadership for Continual Service Improvement reviews. 

• Experience in effectively conveying complex information to various stakeholders.

 

ITSM Process Skills

35 points

• Excellent in ITSM Processes including, but not limited to: Incident, Problem, Change, Configuration, Service Level, Service Catalogue, Service Portfolio, Business Relationship, Release and Deployment, Request, Fulfilment, IT Strategy and IT Asset Management. 

• Experience with knowledge management platforms (e.g., ServiceNow, Remedy) and how to create and organize documentation.

 

Documentation Skills

20 points

• Experience in template creation and review for all supporting Process artefacts.

• Experience translating technical information into clear, concise, and understandable language for a variety of audiences.

 

Public Sector Experience

5 points

• 5 Years of Experience.

 

Knowledge Transfer

• Codes

• Scripts

• Project Manager / Team members.

1:1 meetings / team meetings / documentation on SharePoint site, throughout the duration of the project life cycle etc.

 

MUST HAVES:

1. Experience working in service management for the OPS and/or other Public Sector Organizations

2. Demonstrate subject matter expertise in IT Service Management (ITSM) best practice

3. Have experience in design and review of IT best practice policy and procedure documentation to align with IT Service Management best practices

4. Have experience collaborating with internal and external stakeholders.

32547.title: 100% Remote-.Net Developer W2 Only (W-2258)
32547.description:
JOB ID#: 14862258 (Backfill Req:14723353)

Please mention salary expectations on top of the resume 
Bill Rate: $95/hr; 
Remote position; 
temp-to-hire; 
salary post conversion - 10% STIP and up to 125K salary; 

Job Description:

The Full Stack/C#.Net Developer works directly with UX , application specialists, and other software developers to improve our cloud-based SaaS solution. In addition, you will work with the engineering team to ensure a smooth migration to this new technology.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Write code and test automation as necessary to deliver features within a Scrum based environment.
  • Analyze story/task requirements and produce simple, maintainable code using OOP.
  • Collaborate with team members (UX, QA, DevOps) and other engineering teams to ensure features are delivered efficiently and with maximum impact. 

Experience & Skills Required:

Education: Bachelor of Science or equivalent job experience.
  • 5+ years of development experience or equivalent shipping web based applications (preferably in a SaaS environment)
  • 1+ years of experience in an Agile or other related environment preferred.
  • Experience developing SPA (single page applications) in React.js with a strong command of related web technologies (JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, etc.)
  • Experience developing .NET APIs with a strong command of the .NET Core ecosystem and object-oriented design and thinking.
  • Proficiency building continuous integration pipelines (TeamCity or Azure DevOps preferred).
  • Passion for and experience in creating test automation.

Nice to have:
• Experience with ORMs is a plus.
• Understanding of microservices and distributed systems.

32549.title: FPGA Developer, Senior
32549.description:
Overview:
A leading provider of real-time video processing technology is seeking a Senior FPGA Developer to join its core signal processing team. This group is responsible for developing high-performance media transport and processing systems used by global clients in live production, broadcast, and media environments.

This is an opportunity to work on cutting-edge, high-bandwidth systems built on advanced FPGA platforms—delivering critical real-time features that enable professional-grade media production. You’ll be surrounded by a highly experienced team that values innovation, collaboration, and practical problem solving.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement RTL for advanced real-time media systems with interfaces including memory, PCIe, and hardware-accelerated video processing.

  • Develop transport protocol implementations (e.g., SDI, SMPTE 2110) within FPGAs.

  • Collaborate on system architecture—reviewing schematics, optimizing clocking, thermal considerations, and FPGA resource allocation.

  • Perform full IO ring designs for leading FPGA families (e.g., Arria10, Stratix-10, Ultrascale+, Agilex).

  • Define and document high-level system requirements; support component selection and scheduling.

  • Create simulation testbenches (Verilog/SystemVerilog); perform functional verification and debugging.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with software, hardware, and manufacturing teams through the full product lifecycle.

  • Mentor peers and support technical knowledge sharing within the team.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of hands-on FPGA design experience, preferably with exposure to video or audio systems.

  • Strong Verilog/SystemVerilog and scripting skills (TCL).

  • Experience with Intel and/or Xilinx FPGAs and their respective toolchains (Quartus, Vivado).

  • Familiarity with high-speed serial interfaces, DDR3/4, HBM, PLLs, and signal integrity principles.

  • Excellent debugging and validation skills; proficiency with lab tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, WFMs, etc.).

  • Background in embedded systems (Linux, bash, C/C++) considered a plus.

  • Understanding of media production workflows and digital video standards (SMPTE, HDR, SDI) is advantageous.

  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced engineering environment.
