32545.title: Local to Michigan -Database Administrator-Hybrid (SOM-143628)
32545.description:
The State of Michigan is looking for: Database Administrator 3
Max Bill Rate: $92.14
ID#143628

Top Skills & Years of Experience:
- 8+ years of experience in the field is required
- Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, and PowerBook tools experience
- SQL Database ETL experience
- SAS and SQL Data Modeling
- Bachelor's Degree Required

Job Summary:
This position supports the Center for Educational Performance and Information (CEPI) database environment.
This position is the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the modernization to Power BI reporting and requires considerable independent judgment directing and coordinating the appropriate data administration and management methods, practices, procedures and tools, to complete the required assignments.  Expertise is required in Microsoft SQL Server database support, and professional knowledge in the PowerBI platform as well as SAS will be required
We are seeking a technically skilled and detail-oriented data professional to join our team on a temporary basis. This role is responsible for working directly with business users to understand how Power BI is currently utilized, including identifying the data sources, databases, and tables supporting existing dashboards and reports. A key focus of this position is to analyze and convert complex SAS programs into optimized SQL code that integrates seamlessly with Power BI, while ensuring accuracy, performance, and adherence to best practices in data management.
The ideal candidate will possess strong experience with SAS, SQL, and Power BI tools, including Power Query and DAX. They will be adept at documenting current-state processes, identifying opportunities for automation or efficiency, and developing sustainable data pipelines and models. Clear communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders are essential, along with a proactive, customer-focused approach. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys problem solving, translating legacy code, and contributing to high-impact data reporting solutions.
The database environment includes:
•Multiple SQL Server instances
•Multiple Collection Environments (Development, Quality Assurance/Testing, Pre-Release, and Production)
•Numerous SQL Reporting Services Servers
•35+ collection databases
•100+ analysis databases

Job Responsibilities:
•Collaborate with customers to understand current use of Power BI, including identifying key dashboards, reports, and underlying data sources and tables.
•Review and analyze existing SAS programs to convert them to optimized SQL code suitable for Power BI reporting.
•Apply advanced SAS and SQL knowledge to ensure logic accuracy, performance optimization, and consistency across data platforms.
•Assess and document current data processes, recommending improvements and automation opportunities that align with best practices.
•Work with stakeholders to identify data sources, ETL processes, and transformation logic critical for reporting needs.
•Build and maintain robust, sustainable data pipelines with a focus on clarity, performance, and long-term maintainability.
•Leverage Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, and PowerBook tools to support data modeling, development, and visualization.
•Apply strong problem-solving skills to debug, validate, and optimize ETL and data transformation processes.
•Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences, documenting processes and collaborating across teams.
•Work independently in a contract/temporary role while delivering high-quality work with accuracy, attention to detail, and a customer-focused mindset.

Will close submissions on: 6/17 @ 10am EST
Interview Process: In-person. Candidates must be available for an in-person interview.
Duration: 1 year with extension possible
Hybrid: Resource will be working a hybrid schedule. NO REMOTE ONLY OPTION. Will need to be onsite from day 1, two days a week. 
Local candidates only (must be located within 2 hours of Lansing, MI at time of submission)
32545.publicDescription:
Database Administrator
Location: Lansing, MI (Hybrid – On-site Tuesday and Wednesday)
Client: Myticas' Direct Client
Work Schedule: Hybrid (On-site two days per week – Tuesday and Wednesday)
Candidate Requirements: Local candidates only (within a two-hour radius of Lansing, MI). No remote-only option.

Top Skills & Years of Experience

  • Minimum of 8 years of professional experience in the field

  • Proficiency with Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, and PowerBook tools

  • Experience with SQL Database ETL processes

  • Proficiency in SAS and SQL Data Modeling

  • Bachelor’s degree required

Job Summary

This position supports the Center for Educational Performance and Information (CEPI) database environment and serves as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the modernization of Power BI reporting. The role requires substantial independent judgment in directing and coordinating data administration and management methods, practices, procedures, and tools to complete assignments effectively.

Expertise in Microsoft SQL Server database support is required, along with professional knowledge of the Power BI platform and SAS.

We are seeking a technically skilled and detail-oriented data professional to join our team on a temporary basis. The primary responsibility of this role is to collaborate with business users to understand the current utilization of Power BI, including identifying the data sources, databases, and tables supporting existing dashboards and reports.

A key focus of this position is to analyze and convert complex SAS programs into optimized SQL code that integrates seamlessly with Power BI, ensuring accuracy, performance, and adherence to best practices in data management.

The ideal candidate will demonstrate strong experience with SAS, SQL, and Power BI tools (including Power Query and DAX), be adept at documenting current-state processes, and identify opportunities for automation and efficiency. The candidate should also be capable of developing sustainable data pipelines and models. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders are essential, along with a proactive and customer-focused approach.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who enjoys problem-solving, translating legacy code, and contributing to high-impact data reporting solutions.

Database Environment

  • Multiple SQL Server instances

  • Multiple collection environments (Development, Quality Assurance/Testing, Pre-Release, and Production)

  • Numerous SQL Reporting Services servers

  • More than 35 collection databases

  • Over 100 analysis databases

Job Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with business users to understand current Power BI usage, including identifying key dashboards, reports, data sources, and tables

  • Review and analyze existing SAS programs and convert them into optimized SQL code suitable for Power BI reporting

  • Apply advanced SAS and SQL knowledge to ensure logic accuracy, performance optimization, and data consistency across platforms

  • Assess and document current data processes, and recommend improvements and automation opportunities aligned with best practices

  • Work with stakeholders to identify data sources, ETL processes, and transformation logic critical to reporting needs

  • Build and maintain robust, sustainable data pipelines with a focus on clarity, performance, and long-term maintainability

  • Utilize Power BI Desktop, Power Query, DAX, and PowerBook tools to support data modeling, development, and visualization

  • Apply strong problem-solving skills to debug, validate, and optimize ETL and data transformation processes

  • Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences, document processes, and collaborate across teams

  • Work independently in a temporary/contract role while delivering high-quality work with accuracy, attention to detail, and a customer-focused mindset

Additional Information

  • This is a hybrid role requiring on-site work in Lansing, MI, two days per week (Tuesday and Wednesday)

  • Only local candidates within a two-hour radius of Lansing, MI, will be considered

  • No remote-only option is available for this role

31913.title: Business/Functional Analyst - SAP PP/DS & APO REQUIRED
31913.description:
Business Function Process Analyst - 
Specifically looking for people with SAP PPDS & APO experience, and bonus points for experience in SAP S/4.

 
General Description  (Summary description of the primary duties and objectives of the position.) 
Member of a global or regional Competency Center covering assigned business functions, such as Order Management, Manufacturing Distribution, Engineering, or other supported functions. Provides support throughout North America, Europe, and/or Asia to create, implement, and monitor standard processes and controls, and ensure Best Practices are used to support business requirements pertaining to the assigned business functions. Provides subject matter expertise to the end users, consulting on business problems with business leaders, and ensures system and process quality testing. Ensures the related systems, applications, and modules are designed, configured, tested and documented to specifications. Analyzes researches and develops solutions to ensure the configuration and testing meet business requirements. Identifies opportunities to improve current business processes. Participates in and/or analyzes the development of system strategy by identifying and establishing the scope of the business requirements for various process areas. Provides technical support for Order Management / Manufacturing / Distribution / Engineering / or other supported functions. Provides leadership and support for improving business process in Order Management / Manufacturing / Distribution / Engineering / or other supported functions.  Our teams’ purpose is to provide our users with a user experience that meets their needs, facilitates process discipline, and meets the needs of the business, within the abilities of the applications we support.
 
Additionally, employees are expected to abide by all internal control & compliance practices to:
    - Safeguard assets from theft and misuse.                                                               - Ensure segregation of duties to minimize fraud.
    - Comply with business ethics, applicable laws and regulations.                                  - Maintain confidentiality of proprietary information.
    - Periodically reconcile physical assets to accounting records.
Requirements Profile  (Competencies, skills, abilities, experience, education necessary.)
Skills/Abilities
·         Ability to work with cross-functional teams within and outside assigned business areas.
·         Strong communication skills for interaction with all levels internally and externally.
·         Ability to stay current with relevant system methods and emerging technology as well as best business practices.
·         Ability to understand customer sense of urgency and make independent decisions in stressful situations.
·         Intuitive thinking for complex system problem resolution.
·         Ability to analyze business or operational problems and design solution alternatives.
·         Strong project management skills with the ability to develop project scope and action plans.
·         Provide direction and assist process team members for implementation of changes.
Education/Experience
·         Bachelor’s degree and/or professional certifications required or equivalent related experience, relevant to the assigned business process. Thorough understanding of assigned business process, such as engineering, manufacturing and order fulfill processes. Thorough understanding of how assigned business processes relate to the business value streams in a global and/or regional environment.
31913.publicDescription:
Business Analyst – SAP PP/DS & APO
Location: Remote
Contract Type: Contract or Contract-to-Hire
Client: Direct client in Grand Rapids, MI
Company: Clover Consulting (a Myticas Consulting Company)

Client needs a candidate with at least 1 full implementation of PP/DS at a manufacturing company, we’re looking specifically for someone who was a part of the design/implementation team through hypercare.

Position Overview

Clover Consulting is seeking a Business Analyst with expertise in SAP PP/DS & APO for a functional support role. This position requires strong interaction with users, coaching, and the ability to navigate SAP IMG configurations. Candidates must have experience translating business requirements into technical solutions.

SAP APO & PP/DS experience is essential, and familiarity with SAP S/4HANA is a plus.

Key Responsibilities

  • Serve as a member of a global or regional Competency Center, supporting functions such as Order Management, Manufacturing, Distribution, and Engineering.
  • Provide support across North America, Europe, and/or Asia, ensuring standard processes and best practices align with business needs.
  • Act as a subject matter expert (SME), consulting with business leaders and end users on system capabilities and best practices.
  • Ensure systems, applications, and modules are configured, tested, and documented to meet specifications.
  • Analyze and develop solutions to align configuration and testing with business requirements.
  • Identify opportunities to improve business processes and system efficiency.
  • Participate in and support system strategy development, defining business requirements for various functional areas.
  • Provide technical support for assigned functions, ensuring optimal system performance.
  • Lead and support initiatives to enhance business processes within Order Management, Manufacturing, Distribution, and Engineering.
  • Ensure a user-friendly experience that supports process discipline and business needs within the system’s capabilities.

Required Skills & Qualifications

Skills & Abilities:

  • Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams across business areas.
  • Strong communication skills for collaboration at all organizational levels.
  • Ability to stay up to date with emerging technologies and best practices.
  • Capable of making independent decisions under time-sensitive and high-pressure situations.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills for complex system issues.
  • Experience in business process analysis and solution design.
  • Strong project management skills, including scope definition and action plan development.
  • Leadership ability to guide process team members in implementing changes.

Education & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree and/or professional certifications required (or equivalent relevant experience).
  • In-depth understanding of engineering, manufacturing, and order fulfillment processes.
  • Strong knowledge of how assigned business processes integrate into global and regional value streams.

Preferred Experience:

  • Hands-on experience with SAP S/4HANA is a plus.

If you meet the above qualifications and are looking for an exciting opportunity in a functional SAP Business Analyst role, apply today!

32472.title: Senior Leader – IP/MPLS & Emerging Solutions
32472.description:
Senior Leader – IP/MPLS & Emerging Solutions

We are currently seeking a visionary and results-driven leader with deep expertise in IP/MPLS and a passion for innovation across AI, Cloud, and custom solutions. This role demands a strategic thinker with strong execution skills, capable of driving the entire solution lifecycle — from early client engagement and opportunity exploration to solution design, delivery, and roadmap definition.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Provide thought leadership in IP/MPLS technologies, helping clients navigate complex challenges and design next-generation network solutions.

  • Engage directly with clients to understand evolving business needs and propose innovative, scalable solutions across domains such as AI, Cloud, and bespoke/customized platforms.

  • Lead and contribute to all phases of the client engagement cycle, including pre-sales, post-sales, and solution delivery.

  • Develop and maintain solution roadmaps aligned with customer requirements and emerging technology trends.

  • Manage and evolve the product/solution portfolio, identifying opportunities to enhance or commercialize ideas into viable offerings.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with technical teams, sales, marketing, and delivery units to ensure seamless execution and client satisfaction.

  • Translate complex technology capabilities into clear business value propositions that resonate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Qualifications:

  • Proven leadership in IP/MPLS-based architectures and deployments.

  • Demonstrated success in portfolio management and delivering complex, multi-domain solutions.

  • Strong experience across pre-sales, post-sales, and hands-on solution delivery functions.

  • Creative and entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to identify and commercialize innovative ideas.

  • Solid understanding of emerging technologies including AI, Cloud, and next-gen networking solutions.

  • Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement, and executive presentation skills.

Position Summary:
Our direct client in Lansing, MI, is seeking a Senior Windows System Administrator to join their team on a hybrid basis. This role requires a highly skilled and experienced professional to perform a wide range of system administration tasks, including installation, configuration, maintenance, and security of systems and application components across both Windows and Linux environments.

The ideal candidate will collaborate with vendors, customers, and internal technical teams to ensure secure and reliable operation of applications and infrastructure. The position will also support various COTS and SaaS applications, configure changes as needed, and maintain compliance with Federal, State, and industry security standards.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Install and configure systems and application components in Windows and Linux environments.

  • Gather and document requirements; research, analyze, and present solution options for both ongoing application changes and new initiatives.

  • Ensure security and compliance of applications and infrastructure in accordance with Federal, State, and industry standards.

  • Collaborate with vendors, customers, and technical teams to implement projects and changes in a timely manner.

  • Maintain and support COTS applications and assist in configuring changes for SaaS products.

  • Remediate vulnerabilities and provide proactive monitoring and maintenance for systems and networks.

  • Create architectural diagrams and documentation to support application and infrastructure initiatives.

Required Skills and Experience:

Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in:

  • Installing and configuring systems and application components on Windows and Linux environments.

  • Gathering and documenting requirements; analyzing and recommending solutions for application and infrastructure improvements.

  • Using the following tools and technologies:

  • Windows Server Administration (2016 and later)

  • Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7.0 and above

  • Cloud Infrastructure: Azure, AWS, or GCP

  • Tomcat, IIS

  • Microsoft SQL Management Studio

  • Dynatrace or similar debugging tools

  • XML, PowerShell, Azure DevOps, Visio

  • Single Sign-On (SSO) protocols: SAML, OAuth, OpenID

  • Network knowledge: LAN/WAN, architecture, firewalls, IoT

  • Performing analytical tasks with extensive experience in monitoring and supporting Windows and Linux operating systems, networks, firewalls, and architecture.

    Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in:

    • Implementing and configuring applications in Azure Cloud infrastructure.

    • Proficiency in Azure services, containerization, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).

    Additional Information:

    • This is a hybrid role requiring on-site work in Lansing, MI, two days per week (Tuesday and Wednesday).

    • Only local candidates within a two-hour radius of Lansing will be considered.

    • There is no remote-only option for this role.

32501.title: ONLY Local to Lansing or Jackson, MI - Business Analyst - Hybrid (SOM-143208)
32501.description:
Job Title: Business Analyst
Location: Lansing, MI (Hybrid, 2 days onsite/week)
Duration: 12+ Months Contract (Possible further extension)
Job ID: 143208
BR: $77.69/hr

NOTE:
  1. Interviews: Interviews will be held in-person. Candidates MUST be available for an onsite interview with no exceptions.
  2. Local candidates ONLY - Candidates MUST be currently located within a 60-minute commute of Lansing, MI.
  3. Candidates MUST be Lansing/Jackson based - This is non-negotiable - no exceptions.

Top MUST Have skills/experience:
  • Candidates must have a minimum of 6-8 years of general BA experience
  • Minimum of 5 years developing and/or managing user stories on Agile development project(s)
  • Minimum of 6-7 years conducting business process review and requirements elicitation and documentation.
  • Minimum of 2 years working directly with senior management in facilitating discussions to determine strategy, develop road maps and/or gain consensus to resolve opposing positions.
  • Minimum of 2 years supporting the development of or compliance to statement of work and/or other work agreements/contracts.
  • Minimum of 2 years working on projects developing/implementing IT solutions for public use.
  • Minimum of 1 year working on IT infrastructure projects.
  • Minimum of 1 year working with programs governed by state and/or federal regulations.
  • Bachelor's Degree Required.

Job Summary
Looking for a Business Analyst 4 to provide excellent customer service supporting both project and work request needs.  This person will have the opportunity to join inflight projects focused on implementing new IT solutions to provide increased efficiencies and public support.  These IT solutions leverage current technologies and include working with subject matter experts, vendors, and the public.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Key responsibilities include being the liaison between Client and the project stakeholders, as well as providing expert facilitation and elicitation to help develop strategy and requirements for future enhancements and related work projects.
  • In addition, as part of the overall support for Agency Partners, this person will be a critical member of the Client’s Agency Services Business Analyst team, participating in various related work requests and contributing to the operational activities of the BA team.
  • The ideal candidate will possess client’s process experience; strong facilitator experience for requirements elicitation; experience with gap fit analysis and requirements refinement for an inflight project.
  • Customer service and being a champion to ease Agency compliance with client’s policies and practices are key performance expectations for this person.
  • They must be able to quickly gain a working understanding of applicable constraints and enablers and help navigate those for the success for their projects and work requests.
  • A common day would include attendance in various standing meetings for each of the projects, as well as those that include the BA team – being able to confidently speak to current activities in each, listening to understand needs, and helping to provide input that assists in meeting the objectives of the respective meetings.
  • In addition, related work will include preparing for and facilitating discussions with stakeholders to complete analysis and drive to consensus for requirements and priorities.  Session outcomes will be captured in notes, specification documents and/or user stories.

  • Familiarity and experience installing Acronis, Crowd strike( antivirus software), patchlab.
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong excel macros and excel skills.
  • Medium proficiency in Power platforms
  • Decommisioning computer systems.
  • GMP experience


Job Description Summary: 
Responsible for the provision of technical support for all IT/BTS (Business Technology Solutions) systems, activities, development, and administration of plant Quality Control (QC) and IT systems as well as similar scope on manufacturing operations
Supports all hands-on projects that affect the lab and manufacturing IT infrastructure, systems, security, workstations, support, and IT standards.

Job Responsibilities:
  • Work on client's IT QC systems and application projects.
  • Work on client's IT manufacturing systems and application projects.
  • Is responsible for the implementation and rollout of new IT systems.
  • Lead client' IT QC systems and application projects.
  • Lead client' IT manufacturing systems and application projects.
  • Ensure system documentation and computerized systems compliance with Data Integrity policies and regulatory requirements.
  • Collaborate with BTS IAI (Infrastructure Architecture Innovation) to maintain oversight over client's network infrastructure pertaining to the site.
  • Is responsible for ensuring the maximum availability of IT equipment and systems to support the business.
  • Participate in continuous improvement by identification and implementation of cost saving opportunities within the IT area.
  • Is the site subject matter expert (SME) for plant IT systems.
  • Continually building knowledge of the business while keeping current with new technologies.
  • Collaborate closely with other site functions on cross-functional projects and, responsible for delivering IT capabilities and support to site projects.
  • Liaise with IT Contractors/Consultants and ensure compliance with contractor management site policies.
  • Support of QC desktop/workstation and server applications.
  • Support of manufacturing desktop/workstation and server applications.
  • Training of employees on relevant applications.
  • Validation / Qualification of hardware and software as required by client's policies and SOPs.
  • Is responsible for data backup and administration / maintenance of the plant QC & manufacturing systems.
  • Protect client's from cyber risk on QC equipment and site assets, adhering to cyber security procedures and practices of client's.
  • Is responsible for patching of the plant QC systems.
  • Is responsible for patching of the plant manufacturing IT systems.
  • Participation in cross functional teams and initiatives across the site.
  • Adheres to and supports all EHS standards, procedures, and policies.
  • Provide technical leadership on IT to functional areas and collaborates with key stakeholders.


Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree: Degree level qualification in computer science or equivalent relevant discipline or respective proven expertise and experience
Cognitive/Business Skills:
  • Requires a high level of attention to detail and mental concentration to always ensure accuracy and total compliance with procedures.
  • Requires proven problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to new requirements.
  • Must be results driven striving to meet all targets and metric standards as set by site/department and division leaders.
  • Requires innovative thinking, where new and untested solutions are proposed, demonstrated, and implemented on a regular basis.
  • Requires total commitment to quality and always maintaining a high standard of work.
  • Always demonstrates the highest levels of integrity and a strong work ethic.
  • Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are required for the execution of this role.
  • Strong interpersonal skills are required.
  • Supports the principles of Perfect Performance.
  • Apply advanced technical knowledge and experience to the solution of a broad array of technical problems.
Job/Technical Skills:
  • 2 years plus in IT QC System / Application Support (essential)
  • 3 years plus of relevant IT experience (Essential)
  • ITIL (Desirable)
  • GAMP (Desirable)
  • Project Management must
  • Waters Empower (Desirable)
  • Familiarity with Acronis, CrowdStrike installs and maintenance as well as Lab instruments-Empower CE, SOloVPE, SHimatsu,Nexxus, BCS and others
  • Microsoft O365 PowerApps / PowerBi
  • Very strong knowledge on excel macros and powerapps
  • Familiarity with Sciex,Biotek,Waters,Plate freezers

32337.title: Manager, Automation Tools Software Development
32337.description:
Manager, Automation Tools Software Development

Overview

We are seeking a Manager, Automation Tools Software Development to lead a team in delivering cutting-edge automation projects that support IP professional services for our customers. The ideal candidate will combine strong leadership skills with deep technical expertise in automation, IP/MPLS, and software development.

Responsibilities

  • Lead and mentor a team of software developers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and technical excellence.

  • Define technical roadmaps, set development priorities, and oversee project execution to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.

  • Work closely with architects and senior engineers to design and implement scalable automation solutions.

  • Drive technical decision-making and resolve complex design challenges.

  • Own, design, and implement new software features while ensuring code quality and maintainability.

  • Identify and address system performance bottlenecks and scalability challenges.

  • Oversee root cause analysis of system issues and implement long-term solutions.

  • Ensure the creation of high-quality software documentation and actively participate in requirements, design, and code reviews.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 7+ years of experience in software development, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.

  • Strong background in telecom and IP/MPLS domain, particularly in service provider environments.

  • Proven ability to lead software development teams and drive project success.

  • Proficiency in Python (preferred), Java, C#, or Jinja, with a track record of writing clean, reliable, and maintainable code.

  • Excellent debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.

  • Advanced knowledge of IP networking solutions including IPv4, IPv6, routing, switching, MPLS, L2VPN, L3VPN, QoS, multicast, BNG, CGNAT, redundancy.

  • Experience with web development (PHP, JavaScript, HTML5), Linux, and virtualization.

  • Strong familiarity with automation frameworks such as StackStorm, Ansible, Jenkins.

  • Knowledge of containerization (Docker), infrastructure automation (Chef, Ansible), and cloud platforms (OpenStack, SDN).

  • Experience with SCM tools like Git and non-relational databases (MongoDB is a plus).

  • Ability to balance hands-on technical work with strategic planning and team leadership.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working with orchestration platforms, workflow automation (Mistral), and large-scale system integrations.

  • Previous experience in managing distributed teams and working in agile environments.

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to interface with stakeholders across technical and business teams.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive innovation and automation in a dynamic telecom environment while leading a talented team. If you’re passionate about automation, networking, and leadership, we encourage you to apply!

32485.title: Local to Chicago, W2 ONLY - Senior Java AWS Developer, Hybrid (F-5159)
32485.description:
Senior Java AWS Developer/Engineer II (Bill Rate- $89.46 - $99.91)

Assignment Length – 1 year

Onsite position – local candidates and requires ANACI

 

Top competencies required for this position:

  • Must be a US cItizen or Green card folder
  • Java with Spring framework
  • SQL skills
  • AWS services and Terraform IaC
 
Job Description:
The Senior Software Engineer contributes to each phase of the software development lifecycle by developing software, assisting in designing and implementing systems according to standards, and creating automated tests. This position is considered advanced level and performs work of moderate to high complexity. The incumbent works under general supervision and may lead some efforts autonomously.
 
  1. Work on migration of complex, monolithic Java Spring applications from on-premise environments to AWS, ensuring minimal downtime and data integrity.
  2. Design and implement scalable, cloud-native solutions using AWS services such as ECS, RDS, S3 etc.
  3. Translate existing SQL-heavy data operations in AWS-managed databases (e.g., RDS, Aurora) while optimizing performance.
  4. Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform for consistent, automated cloud provisioning.
  5. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to refactor legacy components, integrate with Ops best practices, and ensure security, scalability, and operational excellence.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develops moderately complex to complex systems, applications, and solutions that may have a technology or platform impact.
  • Develops high-quality code that minimizes disruptions to the production environment and meets project deadlines for smaller/mid sized projects.
  • Codes applications using a disciplined development process and follows security best practices, performs code documentation, sources code versioning, and maintenance.
  • Designs and implements Continuous Integration (CI)/continuous Delivery/Deployment (CD) pipelines to improve software development efficiency and quality.
  • Performs reliable automated test cases to ensure application quality and stability in partnership with Quality Engineers, reducing the risk of errors and downtime.
  • Leads the installation, configuration, upgrades, migration of software, systems, and resources in various environments and implements enhancements to improve reliability, security, and performance for smaller/mid-sized projects.
  • Participates in peer review sessions, provides, and receives constructive feedback for technical deliverables.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor's degree in a related field, or commensurate specialized training, certification, or work experience
  • Minimum three years of work experience

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Advanced knowledge of software development methodologies, lifecycles (such as Agile), design concepts, application servers, middleware applications, and tools
  • Advanced understanding of Continuous Integration (CI)/continuous Delivery/Deployment (CD) technologies and tools used to improve software development processes
  • Advanced object-oriented programming skills
  • Advanced knowledge of cloud platforms, technologies, frameworks, and solutions
  • Advanced proficiency in one or more coding languages
  • Advanced proficiency in a relational database system
  • Advanced ability to design and code the right solutions starting with broadly defined problems
  • Advanced analytical thinking and decision-making abilities
  • Excellent written and verbal communication abilities, including presentation skills.
32485.publicDescription:
Myticas direct client is seeking Senior Java AWS Developer/Engineer, Onsite/Hybrid at Chicago, IL.
MUST be a US Citizen or Green Card Holder who is able/willing to work on W2 Contract ONLY.
NOT considering candidates requiring visa sponsorship.
NOTE: **This position requires a 2-step background check process (ANACI) which may take 6-8 weeks for completion.**

Contract Duration – 1 year
Top competencies required for this position:

  • Java with Spring framework
  • SQL skills
  • AWS services 
  • Terraform Infrastructure as a Code

Responsibilities:
  • Work on migration of complex, monolithic Java Spring applications from on-premises environments to AWS, ensuring minimal downtime and data integrity.
  • Design and implement scalable, cloud-native solutions using AWS services such as ECS, RDS, S3 etc.
  • Translate existing SQL-heavy data operations in AWS-managed databases (e.g., RDS, Aurora) while optimizing performance.
  • Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform for consistent, automated cloud provisioning.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to refactor legacy components, integrate with Ops best practices, and ensure security, scalability, and operational excellence.

32423.title: Teradata DBA
32423.description:
Teradata DBA

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Creating, maintaining, and supporting Teradata architectural environment
  • Working with creation of databases, tables, views, users, and granting them access
  • Working with the development teams with design, implementation, and performance tuning of new and existing applications
  • Performing database backup and recovery operations
  • Developing of pro-active processes for monitoring capacity and performance tuning
  • Supporting the application development teams for database needs and guidance
  • Providing day to day support for the EDW users problems like job hands, slowdowns, inconsistent rows, re-validating headers for tables with RI constraints, PPIs and configuration
  • Supporting Teradata patch and upgrades collaborating with Teradata team and interfacing with the application sub vendors
  • Supporting backup and restore/retrieval process – using the BAR DSA and NetBackup. Create, implement, and maintain BAR strategy for the Teradata (TD) application and system databases
  • Maintaining rules set in TASM and supporting workload management. Maintaining the Teradata Workload Manager with the proper partitions and workloads based on Service Levels
  • Supporting the database system and application server support for the Disaster Recovery (DR) build/test, annual drill, and quarterly maintenance as needed
  • Actively monitoring the health of the Teradata system and Teradata Managed Servers (TMS) using Viewpoint and other tools and application servers and make preventive or corrective actions as needed
  • Maintaining access rights, role rights, priority scheduling, and reporting using dynamic workload manager, Database Query Log (DBQL), usage collections and reporting of ResUsage, AmpUsage, security administration etc.
  • Coordinating with the team and customers in supporting database needs and make necessary changes to meet the business, contractual, security, performance, and reporting needs
  • Supporting internal or external audit process and address vulnerabilities or risk proactively. Prepare and support IRS audit
  • Coordinating with Teradata to perform Teradata system hardening and delivery SCSEM Reports as needed addressing issues in the hardening and vulnerability scan report
  • Generating and maintaining capacity management, Space, and CPU reports on analyzing the Spool, CPU, I/O, Usage, and Storage resources and proactive monitoring to meet performance and growth requirements
  • Reviewing and resolving Teradata alerts and communicate any risk / issues or impact to the management, team, and business users through appropriate communication strategy
  • Creating Teradata incident on issues, tracking using TAYS, setting appropriate priorities, monitoring and controlling, and work with Teradata to resolve the issues promptly
  • Performing additional duties that are normally associated with this position, as assigned

Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
  • 5+ years of experience as a Teradata DBA on Version 14+
  • 5+ years of SQL experience
  • 3+ years ETL using Teradata Utilities in a Unix/Linux environment
  • 3+ years performance tuning in a large database (>5TB) or data warehouse environment, using advanced SQL, DBQL and Explain plans
  • 3+ years analyzing project requirements and developing detailed database specifications
  • 3+ years identifying and initiating resolutions to customer problems and concerns associated with a
  • Data Warehouse or equivalent system

Preferred Qualifications:
  • 3+ years identifying and initiating resolutions to customer problems and concerns associated with a Data Warehouse or equivalent system
  • 5+ years logical and physical data modeling experience
  • 5+ years with Erwin or other data modeling software
  • 3+ years working with end users/customers to understand requirements for technical solutions to meet business needs
  • 3+ years working with technical developers to strategize solutions to align with business requirements
  • 3+ years defining standards and best practices and conducting code reviews
  • Experience in Application Server Hardware/Software Administration (Windows/Linux)
  • Experience with State Medicaid / Medicare / Healthcare applications
  • Experience in SharePoint
  • Knowledge in ETL process, Unix, and Windows Scripting
  • Knowledge/Experience in Agile
  • Excellent verbal/written communication, end client facing, team collaboration, and mentoring skills
  • Ability to proactively learn and support overall system administration, support hardware/software maintenance, and leading data management activities
  • Training developers in how best to design queries for a specific database
  • Working with lead / management, business users, SMEs/BA, developers, application administrators, architect/modelers, and coordinating with hardware / software sub vendors
  • Installing, configuring and administering Microsoft SQL Server on Windows Server
  • Performing application servers backups and recovery using Veritas Backup Exec 2012/above
  • Analyzing IBM Tivoli logs and responds to alerts and errors
  • Monitoring of SAN storage with the knowledge and ability to react to alerts and errors
  • Configuring and managing HP MSA Storage arrays
  • Installing, configuring and administering Windows Server 2008 R2 or higher platforms on HP DLT
  • Servers

32397.title: Local to IL, Hybrid --Business Systems Analyst(A-29647)
32397.description:
Analyst Mainstream II (EII2)

05/19/2025 to 12/31/2025

US-IL-Lake County (J41)

BR: $100

 

Job Description:

The Business Systems Analyst will provide direct support to the Crown Jewels program within Information Security Risk Management. This individual will apply relevant principles to support projects and ongoing activities.

 

Responsibilities: 

 

Office of Crown Jewels

• Applies analytical thinking skills to diagnose and make recommendations on systems. Incorporates knowledge of business and technology to make recommendations. Translates data gathered from user discussions into business requirements.

• Identifies business/system needs and recommends solutions. Assists with the testing strategies and develops preliminary findings. Work is performed and technical decisions are made with a high degree of independence and performance is judged by results obtained.

• Manages Crown Jewel asset lifecycle including onboarding and offboarding processes

• Maps and updates Crown Jewels data flows

• Uses appropriate tools to collect, correlate and analyze data; records and maintains technical data for use in developing operating and instruction manuals. Conducts tests; develops preliminary findings for review by experienced analysts.

• Assists in the development of standards and procedures. Prepares written reports of work. Applies and executives’ standard information systems theories, concepts, and techniques.

• Determines approach and solution to problem when issue is within scope of own ability. Develops solutions to problems where casual relationships can be identified, and precedents exist.

• Train others when needed.

• Works effectively with team/group to accomplish organizational goals. Actively participates in client or team meetings by offering suggestions. Provides leadership to project planning.

• Monitors and organizes the efforts of technical and business support staff. Manages projects according to milestones and completes tasks assigned by more experienced analysts and managers. Guides the efforts of less experienced staff.

• Exercises latitude in approach to problem and solution. Work is reviewed for soundness of business judgment and to determine if overall results and objectives have been achieved.

• Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.

•

Qualifications:

 

• Bachelor’s degree plus 5 years technical experience, or Masters degree plus 4 years experience preferably in Business Systems Analysis or Cybersecurity

• Systems Testing and IT Implementation experience.

• Exceptional interpersonal and communication and strong analytical skills. Proven ability to build trust, listen and ask effective questions.

• Proven track record of effective project leadership and positive results. Ability to self-manage time and priorities.

Responsibilities:

  • Apply analytical thinking to diagnose issues and recommend system improvements, incorporating business and technology insights.

32435.title: Local to Chicago - IT Project Manager (A-30018)
32435.description:
Job Title: IT Project Manager
Location: North Chicago, IL (Hybrid)
Duration: 6+ months contract (possible further extension)
  
Description:
  • Develop, execute, and manage multiple IT projects within their defined scope(s).
  • Manage a multitude of interrelated project activities and lead all aspects of the project lifecycle, working with project sponsors/key stakeholders, team members, and management to oversee all phases of project completion.
  • Build and manage project’s work breakdown structure, milestones, risks, issues, and deliverables within the constraints of human and financial resources and changing priorities to ensure the successful completion of the project.
  • Ensure transparent reporting of project status, issues, risks, and financials.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Initiate and Plan Project: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on project goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resource needs to accomplish the scope.
  • Project Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the project working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the project is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.
  • Executing and Closing Project: Develops and executes a work plan obtaining authorized resources to ensure all activities are performed. Leads team in delivering project scope. Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
  • Project Communication: Communicate project progress by producing project reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current project status to resolve issues and manage risks.
  • Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon their abilities. Motivates project team in order to deliver project outcomes.
  • Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Decisions: Make decisions that impact project level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for project budget.
  • Financial Control: Develops and manages a financial plan with multi-million dollar spend. Tracks actual spend, accruals, proactively creates spend estimates on a regular basis (at least monthly) and coordinates estimates and invoices with project vendors, in order to maintain spend at +/- 10% of the overall project budget.

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in project management.
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership

32422.title: Local to AR-Logistics Claims Specialist (T-5650)
32422.description:
Job ID: 5650
Job Location: Springdale - 2469 W. Sunset

Pay Rate: $18.00
Job Start Date: 05/19/2025
Job End Date: 08/16/2025


Job Description :
This position is currently scheduled for 6 months- Simplify does not allow us to create jobs for longer than 90 days at a time. After 90 days the contract will be extended. 

This is 100% on site. 


Job Title: Logistics Claims Senior Specialist
The Logistics Claims Senior Specialist is vital in managing and resolving product-related claims, such as overages, shortages, damages, and refusals reported by carriers at the time of delivery. With the Logistics Teams processing an impressive, annualized total of $100 million in our Poultry Prepared Division, the need for accurate and timely evaluations and disposition decisions cannot be overstated. Delays in these processes can lead to substantial carrier accessorial fees, significantly impacting operational costs and logistics efficiency. In this role, the Specialist is working on a call center speaking with drivers.  The Specialist engages extensively with cross-functional teams, adhering to our Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) while collaborating with Transportation Operations, FSQA, Plant Operations, Shipping, Customer Service, Warehousing, Product Movement, Deductions, and Sustainability teams. This collaboration is crucial for ensuring effective product dispositions and maintaining compliance with business protocols. The Specialist is responsible for managing an active worklist and updating transportation and financial systems, enabling seamless operations. Furthermore, the Specialist validates and processes donation receipts promptly, forwarding them to the Deductions and Sustainability teams. They also oversee accessorial payments related to their weekly cases, ensuring that carrier payment expectations for asset movements are met per our contractual agreements. A key aspect of this role is obtaining Proof of Delivery (POD) for each case, ensuring that all information is accurately validated against claims. The Specialist diligently maintains and updates worklists in High Radius, conducting daily audits for accuracy, which is then reported the following business day in Power BI reports. These reports are scrutinized by Shipping locations and Transportation, making the data generated by the Specialist a foundational element in our key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Distribution division scorecards. This emphasizes the critical importance of accuracy and timeliness for the organization's overall success.

REQUIREMENTS Education:

  • High school diploma or equivalent required.
  • Candidate with and/or currently pursuing a BA degree is a plus.
Experience:
  • Minimum of 1 year of office clerical experience required, 3 years preferred.
  • Prior experience in a Logistics is highly valuable, particularly in handling OS&D claims or customer service.
  • Experience in data collection and analysis is advantageous.
Communication Skills:
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential.
  • Professional phone skills for interacting with both internal company contacts and external vendors and customers.
  • Excellent negotiation skills to effectively manage and resolve third-party OS&D carrier claims.
  • Ability to convey complex information clearly and concisely to various stakeholders.
  • Skilled in managing conflict and addressing concerns diplomatically.
  • Proficient in crafting detailed and accurate reports and documentation.
  • Effective follow-up skills to ensure timely and accurate resolution of issues with various parties involved.
Computer Skills:
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
  • Experience with High Radius system.
  • Proficiency in navigating and interpreting Power BI reports.
  • Experience with SAP Transportation Management (SAP TM); TES (Transportation Execution System); and DB2 Sessions.
  • Experience working with call center technology and answering systems, including software such as Five9.
Special Skills:
  • Motivated self-starter with a strong desire to learn and grow.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to manage time effectively.
  • Strong multitasking abilities and interpersonal skills.
  • Confident in making fact-based decisions through critical thinking and standing by those decisions.
  • Proven ability to analyze information, evaluate options, and implement solutions effectively.
  • Self-reliant with the capability to self-audit for any errors or discrepancies in work to ensure accuracy and quality.
  • Highly organized with the ability to thrive in a high-volume, fast-paced role.
  • Consistently focused on timely execution and quick decision-making
  • Maintain a high level of confidentiality.

Bill Rate: $103.00/hr

32421.publicDescription:
Job Opportunity: Dynamics 365 Systems Architect
Location: Lansing, MI
Type: Hybrid Contract

Myticas’ direct client in Indianapolis, Indiana, is seeking a highly skilled Dynamics 365 Systems Architect to join their team on a contract basis.

Position Overview

The Dynamics 365 Systems Architect will provide application development and integration services to the Department of Technology, Management and Budget, supporting the following agencies:

  • Michigan Department of Civil Rights (MDCR)
  • Michigan Civil Service Commission (MCSC)
  • Michigan Department of Lifelong Education, Advancement, and Potential (MiLEAP)

The selected candidate will be responsible for the design, development, maintenance, and enhancement of agency applications. Project work will be conducted within the framework of the State of Michigan’s System Engineering Methodology (SEM). Responsibilities include the development, testing, and deployment of application releases, updates, and modifications in both client/server and web server environments.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide advanced technical support for the Dynamics 365 platform.
  • Lead and perform project tasks including requirements gathering, planning, analysis, design, testing, implementation, documentation, and maintenance.
  • Oversee Dynamics 365 and Power Platform implementations.
  • Design and document technical architecture solutions that span multiple platforms, including systems integration and authentication.
  • Manage CI/CD and release processes for Dynamics 365-related technologies.
  • Identify and mitigate technical risks and issues.
  • Prepare detailed documentation and reports.
  • Communicate technical concepts effectively to various audiences.
  • Resolve complex problems under pressure and in high-stress environments.

Required Skills and Experience

  • 5+ years of architecture experience
  • 3+ years of experience with Power Platform solutions, particularly Power Automate and Power Pages
  • 5+ years of experience with Azure DevOps
  • 3+ years of database architecture experience
  • 5+ years of experience in infrastructure/network and application support

31458.title: Master Production Scheduler
31458.description:
Job Summary:
Myticas is seeking a detail-oriented Master Production Scheduler. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing and optimizing our production schedule to ensure efficient utilization of resources, timely delivery of products, and alignment with customer demand. This role requires exceptional organizational skills, strong analytical abilities, and the ability to collaborate effectively with the warehouse and other various teams’ departments across the organization.
Responsibilities:
  • Develop and maintain an effective production schedule that maximizes efficiency and minimizes costs while meeting customer demand and inventory targets.
  • Utilize the current SAP process in place to effectively plan and schedule for order and deliveries, and for forecasting accuracy.
  • Analyze production capacity, material availability, and resource constraints to identify potential bottlenecks and develop strategies to mitigate them.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams including production, procurement, logistics, and sales to gather relevant data and ensure alignment of schedules with business objectives.
  • Monitor production progress and proactively identify deviations from the schedule, recommending corrective actions as needed to minimize disruptions and meet deadlines.
  • Generate regular reports and metrics to track key performance indicators (KPIs) such as on-time delivery, production efficiency, and inventory levels.
  • Continuously evaluate and refine scheduling processes to drive continuous improvement and adapt to changing business needs.
  • Act as a liaison between production management and other stakeholders to communicate schedule changes, resolve conflicts, and address any issues that may arise.
  • Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and technological advancements related to production scheduling, and make recommendations for incorporating relevant innovations into our processes.
  • Train and mentor junior members of the scheduling team, providing guidance and support to help them develop their skills and contribute to the overall success of the department.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, operations research, industrial engineering, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
  • Proven experience in production scheduling or materials planning, preferably in a manufacturing or production environment.
  • Must have knowledge and working experience in SAP systems.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.
  • Proficiency in using advanced planning and scheduling software such as SAP, Oracle, or Microsoft Dynamics AX.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and build strong working relationships.
  • Detail-oriented with a focus on accuracy and precision, particularly when managing complex schedules and large volumes of data.
  • Ability to work under pressure and adapt quickly to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically to resolve scheduling conflicts and optimize resource allocation.
  • Knowledge of lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement methodologies is a plus.
  • Certification in production and inventory management (e.g., APICS CPIM) is desirable.

Experience:
SAP: 3 years
production scheduling: 5 years
Work Location: Onsite

  • Minimum 5 - 8 years of SAP functional experience on SAP MM/WM/LE modules with at least 1-2 End-to-End implementation experience / 1-2 rollout project experience.
  • Must be able to work on-site 3 days per week. 
  • Skilled in implementation, customization and maintenance of SAP MM/WM/LE modules.
  • Field Service Management

  • Versatile in ability to analyze issues, providing alternative solutions and requirements like preparation of procedures, work instructions, etc.,

  • Experience in Support, Realization, Documentation, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) with power users in SAP Manufacturing Integration

31871.title: Network Engineer
31871.description:
Essential Functions:
• Perform data integrity verification of NOKIA 7750, 7705 and 7250 IXR nodes in preparation for integration and software upgrades.
• Report all discrepancies, through chain management, to customers. 
• Perform work following approved Method of Procedures documents. 
• Use substantial experience and discretion to provide validation of Method of Procedures (MOPs) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for supporting NOKIA 7750, 7705 and IXR equipment for hardware integration. 
• Update/revise MOPs, SOPs, and data templates as needed to support NOKIA 7750, 7705 and IXR integration and deployment.
• Prepare MOP’s to safely upgrade software on customer equipment; resolve scripting problems as well as support internal teams with maintenance activities.
• Resolve issues with software to upgrade network equipment and correct faults using Command Line Interface (CLI) and GUI
• Actively apply NOKIA QOS standards, to network performance analysis
• Understand and able to build Nokia router configuration files
• Able to work 12:00 AM to 6:00 AM maintenance windows on a recurring basis dependent on the needs of the business and the availability of the integrator
 
Other Functions: 
• Support, understand and resolve the customer network elements, primarily 7750, 7705, 7210 and IXR router elements.
• Perform software upgrades, implementation, and integration maintenance support for customers
• Provide IPv6 telecommunications traffic migration services for customers
• Execute procedures and use proprietary software tools to support deliverables
• Escalate quality issues to improve products and services delivered to the customer
• Develop written technical documentation such as Method or Procedure (MOP) for Field Technicians to use
• Exercise strong analytical skills to troubleshoot network connectivity issues.
 
Experience:
Experience with Nokia Routers
NRS I or NRS II Nokia Certifications (NRS II preferred)
IP, MPLS, Segment Routing, ISIS, OSPF experience preferred
31871.publicDescription:
Job Purpose:

As a Network Engineer, you will be responsible for verifying data integrity, supporting hardware and software upgrades, and ensuring the seamless integration of network equipment, primarily the 7750, 7705, 7250, and IXR series. You will apply your extensive technical expertise to troubleshoot, validate procedures, and ensure operational efficiency during customer deployments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Perform data integrity checks for 7750, 7705, and 7250 IXR nodes in preparation for integration and software upgrades.
  • Report any discrepancies to customers through chain management.
  • Execute tasks following approved Method of Procedures (MOPs) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
  • Validate and update MOPs, SOPs, and data templates as necessary for equipment integration and deployment.
  • Prepare MOPs for safe software upgrades on customer equipment; resolve scripting issues and support internal teams during maintenance activities.
  • Troubleshoot software issues, resolve faults, and upgrade network equipment using Command Line Interface (CLI) and graphical user interfaces (GUI).
  • Apply QoS standards to analyze and optimize network performance.
  • Develop and build router configuration files to support customer requirements.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Provide ongoing support for 7750, 7705, 7210, and IXR router elements.
  • Manage software upgrades, implementation, and integration maintenance for customer networks.
  • Deliver IPv6 telecommunications traffic migration services.
  • Use proprietary software tools and execute set procedures to meet customer deliverables.
  • Escalate any quality issues to improve the overall customer experience.
  • Create detailed technical documentation, including MOPs for Field Technicians.
  • Apply strong analytical skills to troubleshoot and resolve network connectivity issues.

Qualifications:

  • Hands-on experience with routers.
  • certifications such as NRS I or NRS II (NRS II preferred).
  • Proficiency in IP, MPLS, Segment Routing, ISIS, and OSPF protocols.

Performance Expectations:

  • Consistently meet project deadlines and ensure high-quality service delivery.
  • Ensure all software and hardware upgrades are completed efficiently with minimal disruption.
  • Maintain effective communication with the customer, escalating any issues promptly.

Description:
We are seeking a Project Manager for Learning and Development with strong expertise in tracking and reporting project progress. 32399.title: Remote  --Senior Instructional Designer  (A-29739)
32399.description:
Senior Instructional Designer - ABBVJP00029739

05/19/2025 to 12/31/2025

BR: $99.12

Location: Remote

 

We are seeking a Senior Instructional Designer with extensive experience in developing multimedia-rich courses, proficient in tools such as Articulate Rise, Adobe Photoshop, Premiere, After Effects, Canva, Tech Smith Camtasia, and SharePoint. With over five years of experience in designing educational eLearning products (Video Base Learning, Microlearning Videos and eLearning/SCROM Course), the candidate should have a strong grasp of how to integrate various media elements based on different learning styles.

In this senior learning design role, the candidate will apply their expertise in graphic design tailored for education and training to enrich course content. They will collaborate closely with BTS L&D Management during content consultations, ensuring effective and organized management of our project production library so that all learning products are systematically saved in our team's repository. This position also involves working within project management tools including but not limited to Jira, providing weekly project development reports, ensuring alignment with Learning & Development (L&D) brand and experience guidelines.

Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for creating content thumbnails and conducting content tests with subject matter experts and test subjects to ensure the learning material is sound. Once courses are completed, they will upload the SCORM files to our Learning Management System (LMS) and educational videos to our video repository. The role also includes uploading links and thumbnails to content on our internal SharePoint pages, making necessary edits to improve engagement, and ensuring the learning flow is seamless. Organizing materials effectively is crucial to enhance the user experience for our learning audience. The candidate will be responsible for updating the SharePoint page dedicated to communicating our educational material and assisting in writing content for internal communications (Teams Channels and LMS Communication Areas) about new projects that are launched.

Additionally, the candidate will be tasked with updating internal SharePoint pages with relevant links and content, ensuring materials are organized to enhance user experience for our learning audience. Their role will also involve writing content for internal communications about newly launched projects, aiding in the dissemination of information across the organization.

Strong organizational skills are essential, as the candidate will track project progress and regularly update the Associate Director of Learning and Development. This position reports to the Manager of Learning and Development, AI and Digital Upskilling.

32410.title: Local IN only- AWS/Cloud Architect (SOI-1674)
32410.description:
BR: $81.21
Job ID#761674

Title: Cloud Architect 

Duration: 4 Months+ Contract with Possibility of Extension

Hiring Manager NOTE:  Only local candidates currently located in IN.

Job Summary:
The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of designing and delivering innovative cloud solutions, optimizing DevOps practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and managing vendor collaborations. This role involves working closely with agency solution architects, developers, stakeholders, and Indiana Office of Technology architects on key projects, including HEARTS, EPP, and Gateway Cloud Migration. The candidate will also be responsible for securely setting up environments to meet FedRAMP or GovRAMP compliance standards.

Roles and Responsibilities:
• Design, implement, and manage cloud solutions in Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services (AWS) with a focus on large-scale projects.
• Architect and deploy scalable, secure cloud infrastructure.
• Set up environments securely in compliance with FedRAMP or GovRAMP standards, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements.
• Collaborate with software development teams to integrate CI/CD pipelines using DevOps practices.
• Lead the design and implementation of cloud solutions for complex projects, ensuring robust performance and reliability.
• Oversee cloud migration projects, including the internal HEARTS, EPP, and Gateway Cloud Migration, in collaboration with vendors.
• Optimize cloud infrastructure for performance and cost efficiency.
• Develop and enforce cloud governance frameworks to ensure compliance with organizational policies and standards.
• Monitor cloud environments, troubleshoot issues, and ensure high availability and disaster recovery.
• Implement security best practices and compliance measures in cloud systems.
• Design disaster recovery strategies and backup systems to ensure business continuity.
• Provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members on cloud and DevOps-related topics.
• Manage vendor relationships to ensure seamless delivery and performance of cloud solutions.
• Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to enhance cloud solutions.
• Oversee cloud cost optimization and budgeting to deliver efficient, cost-effective solutions.
• Utilize monitoring and logging tools to track performance and detect potential issues early.
• Collaborate with agency solution architects, developers, stakeholders, and Indiana Office of Technology architects to ensure alignment with business objectives.

Required Skills and Experience:
  • 10+ Years of hands-on experience in cloud architecture and DevOps practices
  • 10+ Years of exceptional expertise in Azure and AWS cloud environments and services, with demonstrated success in implementing large-scale projects
  • 10+ Years of strong experience in designing and implementing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or Azure DevOps
  • 10+ Years of demonstrated success in delivering cloud solutions for complex and large-scale projects
  • 5+ Years of experience in securely setting up cloud environments to meet FedRAMP or GovRAMP compliance standards
  • 5+ Years of proficiency in infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation
  • 7+ Years of strong understanding of networking, security, and database management in cloud environments
  • 7+ Years of solid scripting skills (e.g., Python, Bash, or PowerShell)
Education & Soft Skills:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences
  • Effective interpersonal skills for working in cross-functional teams and interacting with stakeholders
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to address challenges and innovate within cloud environments
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities effectively
  • Exceptional ability to present solutions and align technology goals with business objectives
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Certifications such as AWS Certified Solutions Architect or Microsoft Azure Architect Expert
  • Experience with containerization tools (Docker) and orchestration platforms (Kubernetes)
  • Familiarity with Agile development practices

32378.description:
Job Title: Power BI Tools Developer
Work Location: North Chicago, IL (Hybrid)
Duration: 6+ Months Contract (Possible further extension)
BR: 80.00/hr
ABBVJP00029511
  
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Power Tools Developer and Lead with expertise in Microsoft Power BI, Power Automate, and Power Apps. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the capability to lead a team effectively. This role involves gathering requirements from stakeholders, developing solutions using Microsoft Power Platform tools, and guiding a team of developers to ensure successful project delivery.

Key Responsibilities:
Requirements Gathering
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and objectives.
  • Conduct workshops and interviews to gather detailed requirements for data visualization, automation processes, and application development.
  • Document functional specifications and user stories for development purposes.

Development
  • Design, develop, test, and deploy solutions using Power BI for data analytics and reporting.
  • Create automated workflows using Power Automate to improve operational efficiency.
  • Build custom applications using Power Apps tailored to meet specific business requirements.
  • Ensure all developed solutions adhere to best practices in coding standards, security protocols, and performance optimization.

Team Leadership
  • Lead a team of developers by providing guidance on technical challenges and project tasks.
  • Foster a collaborative environment that encourages knowledge sharing and professional growth among team members.
  • Conduct regular team meetings to track progress, address issues, and celebrate successes.

Quality Assurance
  • Perform code reviews to ensure high-quality deliverables that meet project specifications.
  • Implement testing strategies for all developed solutions to ensure functionality and reliability before deployment.

Continuous Improvement
  • Stay updated with the latest features and updates in Microsoft Power Platform tools.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements within the development lifecycle.
  • Provide training sessions or workshops for team members on new technologies or methodologies.

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (Master’s preferred).
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in software development with a focus on Microsoft Power Platform (Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps).
  • Proven experience leading teams in an Agile/Scrum environment is highly desirable.
  • Excellent PowerBI Reporting skill with the ability to develop reports/dashboards in a time sensitive environment.
  • Proficient in DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) for Power BI reporting.
  • Strong understanding of REST APIs for integrating various services with Power Automate.
  • Familiarity with SharePoint Online as it relates to app development using Power Apps.
  • Knowledge of Dimensional Modelling techniques for effective data organization and analysis.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Certifications (Preferred):
  • Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate (for Power BI).
  • Microsoft Certified: Azure Fundamentals or relevant certifications related to the Microsoft ecosystem.

32349.description:

NOTE:  W2 only!
100% remote 9am-6pm EST

Required Skills/Experience:

• Knowledge of Finance or Accounting Principals 
• Knowledge of SQL syntax 
• Working knowledge of database technologies such as Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, HANA, or Postgres

Preferred Job Qualifications:??

• Foundational understanding of coding

• Knowledge of and experience with any of the following products/technologies: CCH Tagetik, OneStream, Anaplan, Host Analytics, Board, Longview, Hyperion, HFM, SAP BPC, IBM Cognos, SQL, Oracle Databases and other analytics tools (Qlik, Tableau, Smartview, SAP SAC) .?

Job Description:

As a Customer Service Technical Specialist (Functional Application Support) you are responsible for the support and maintenance for CCH Tagetik CPM customers. You will take on a more prominent role in supporting customers with various functional issues for the CCH Tagetik CPM Software. Building on your foundational skills, you will assist with more complex troubleshooting and contribute to project-based improvements. Your contributions will help in refining our support processes and enhancing customer satisfaction.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:??
• You are responsible for the support and maintenance for CCH Tagetik CPM customers
• Contribute to provide level 1 support on enterprise-wide CCH Tagetik software solutions for small and large companies in compliance with best practices and processes
• Directly responsible for the management of a support queue, the qualification and tracking of client requests and provision of solutions within the expected response time applicable to the client
• Acts as the primary response to incoming tickets in a timely manner and obtain as much relevant information to fill gaps in each case
• Interacts with customer and understands the client business process
• Resolve moderately complex technical and product related issues reported by users via e-mail, telephone, and remote access, under guidance of established policies and procedures
• Test and identify defects by documenting in the tracking system for the attention of the development team, may provide informal guidance to new team members
• Finally, do what it takes to have a happy customer
Support & Maintenance
• Provide Level 1/Level 2 support to clients
• Follow up on maintenance of client software
• Qualify and provide solutions to defects raised by clients
• Comply with Service Level Agreements defined with the clients
• Provide rigorous and timely updates to client requests
• Strive to reduce response time for support issues
• Analyze and troubleshoot functional cases to understand steps to resolve the issue
• Deliver quality work
• Maintain documentation
• Provide additional support services for premium clients
• Develop, maintain and optimize the interactions between all the internal parties at CCH Tagetik
• Share best practice recommendations with customers, ensuring an optimal use of the software
