31881.title: Partner/Managing Director
31881.description:
Overview: 
We are seeking a seasoned professional with expertise in investment operations, technology transformation, and process optimization to serve as a Partner or Managing Director. This role is ideal for individuals with a strong consulting background who work extensively with wealth and asset managers to optimize business operations within alternative and diversified investments.

Responsibilities:
1. Investment Operations & Process Optimization
   - Lead initiatives to streamline and enhance business processes for wealth and asset management clients, focusing on private equity, real estate, and credit funds.
   - Oversee both front and back-office operational tools, including fund accounting systems such as Geneva, Investran, LemonEdge, Allvue, and Yardi.

2. Technology Transformation & Target Operating Models (TOM)
   - Drive technology transformation projects to achieve optimal Target State Operating Models (TOM), improving business performance and supporting long-term operational goals.
   - Guide the selection and implementation of CRM systems, with a preference for experience with Salesforce or similar platforms.

3. Advisory & Financial Services Expertise
   - Utilize extensive consulting experience to advise clients on the alignment of financial and operational strategies.
   - Provide strategic insights on alternative and diversified investments, leveraging a deep understanding of equities and other asset classes.

4. Stakeholder Engagement & Solution Delivery
   - Partner with wealth and asset managers across major investment companies to develop tailored solutions for operational and technology enhancements.
   - Deliver comprehensive recommendations that support clients in meeting industry standards, regulatory requirements, and organizational goals.

Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Management Information Systems (MIS), Business, or a related field.
- Extensive knowledge and experience in alternative and diversified investments, equities, and financial advisory services.
- Proficiency in fund accounting systems, including Geneva, Investran, LemonEdge, Allvue, and Yardi.
- Proven expertise in technology transformation, process improvements, and TOM (Target Operating Models).
- Hands-on experience with Salesforce or similar CRM tools.
- A consulting background with a successful track record in optimizing business processes for wealth and asset management clients.

Job Description:

As an Administrative Assistant, you will perform a wide range of administrative duties that support the smooth operation of the CT Business Licensing organization. You will engage with multiple teams, handle complex tasks, and manage important documentation. Your attention to detail and organizational capabilities will help maintain an efficient and effective workplace. You will report to the Associate Director, Operations and work under the leadership of the Director, General Management. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities?: 
  • Welcomes occasional guests by greeting them in person or by telephone Answering and directing all incoming telephone calls and routing to the appropriate individual/department Scans, logs and routes all incoming mail.

  • Collaborates with all departments and remote employees Maintains office supplies inventory by checking stock to determine inventory level, anticipating needed supplies, placing expediting and verifying receipt of supplies. 
  • Assist Accounting department with syncing invoices, receiving payments, and collection activity tasks. 
  • Assist with in-office event coordination as needed. Answering and routing calls Outlook Excel Attention to detail

32355.title: Hybrid-DevOps Engineer-W2 Only (W-2741)
32355.description:
Job ID#: 14792741

DevOps Developer
Bill Rate: $100/hr; 
Hybrid role for the Madison, WI location; will need to be onsite at least 1x per week; 
temp-to-hire role; 
salary upon conversion is $130K + 10% STIP. 
Please mention location and salary expectation on top of the resume
 

Job Description:
We are seeking a passionate technologist to join our DevOps team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in managing and optimizing our processes, ensuring seamless integration and deployment of software solutions.

Responsibilities
  • Build and maintain automation scripts and infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar
  • Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure high availability and reliability of production environments
  • Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to streamline the software development lifecycle using a wide variety of commercial and open-source technologies
  • Implement security best practices, certificate-based security and secret management
  • Collaborate with development, QA and IT teams to ensure smooth and reliable delivery of software applications

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
  • Proven experience in a DevOps or related role
  • Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC) tools like Terraform
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
  • Strong knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools such as TeamCity or Jenkins
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure
  • Experience with SaaS solutions (custom applications using .NET and Java)
  • Proficiency in scripting languages such as Bash, PowerShell, or Python
  • Understanding of configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef
  • Solid understanding of IT- including servers, storage, Windows and Linux, networking, DNS, Firewalls, routing
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, communication and collaboration abilities
Bonus Qualifications
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack
  • Experience with Virtualization and Cloud Computing (VMWare, Azure)
  • Experience with data analytics platforms/business intelligence (preferably Sisense)
  • Experience with deployment automation tooling such as Octopus Deploy
  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
  • Understanding of Single-Sign-On setup and configuration (Ping Federate, OIDC, ADFS, Okta).
  • Understanding of application and system telemetry.

32322.title: Hybrid Work-Accounting Manager-CPA (W-7802)
32322.description:
Bill Rate: $100/hr; 
Job ID#14797802

• salary upon conversion $140K + 15% STIP 
• Please mention salary expectation AND location at the top of the resume 
• Hybrid position 
• open to candidates local to Philadelphia, PA; Waltham, MA; Baltimore, MD & Riverwoods, IL 
• temp-to-hire position 

Additional Information:  W2 only!
Hybrid role - open to candidates local to Philadelphia, PA; Waltham, MA; Baltimore, MD & Riverwoods, IL
• Ideal candidate will have solid people management skills along with sound accounting experience and knowledge 
• Proven ability to problem-solve 
• Should be comfortable working with shorter month-end closes (3-5 days) 
• More focused GL experience. The ideal candidate will speak more to and would have managed teams that handle month-end close, journal entry preparation/review, balance account reconciliations, bank reconciliations, intercompany, and audit. Some AP/AR experience is completely acceptable, but would like to see current and/or more recent experience to be GL 
• International experience a big plus 

Job Description:

The Accounting Manager assists in the accounting and reporting efforts of the accounting team. This position requires an individual who possesses critical thinking skills, exhibits significant attention to details and is able to proactively address complex situations and anticipate potential accounting impacts. Additional requirements include, but are not limited to:
 
  • An ability to provide accounting expertise and enforce adherence to internal control requirements;
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills to establish strong relationships with cross-functional teams;
  • An ability to quickly adapt to changes in business requirements and exhibit leadership when guiding/supporting staff through such changes.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Actively participate in the month end close and reporting process in accordance with the reporting calendar
  • Supervise work of accountants
  • Review, analyze, and approve general ledger transactions in a timely, complete and accurate manner
  • Identify and resolve issues quickly and independently or escalate appropriately, if required, with proposed solutions
  • Oversee preparation of balance sheet account reconciliations on a monthly/quarterly/semi-annual basis
  • Support audits (external and internal) by timely providing requested materials, interacting with auditors in a professional manner and addressing questions and inquiries
  • Provide feedback to staff to improve processes including the quality of account reconciliations
  • Assist in the research and clearance of reconciling items within established deadlines  
  • Update desk-top procedures in a timely manner for any changes in processes, tools and procedures
  • Maintain month end close, reporting and other checklists and ensure completion of tasks on such checklists before sign-off
  • Prepare and review additional supporting schedules and analyses as requested
  • Timely and effectively communicate with the accounting team and 3rd party services provider
  • Conduct independent analysis to identify opportunities for process improvements and make recommendations, as deemed necessary

Required Qualifications/Experience/Skills: 
Education:  BBA or BS in Accounting, MS in Accounting desirable
  • CPA certification/working towards the CPA certification preferred
  • 7 to 9 years previous accounting/audit experience in public or private accounting out of which 2 to 3 years in managerial capacity is preferred
  • Experience with major ERPs (SAP, Great Plains, NetSuite) strongly preferred
  • Experience with Blackline strongly preferred
  • Strong reporting and data querying capabilities
  • Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Team management skills
  • Detail oriented approach to work; ability to maintain confidentiality; strong problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work well independently with minimal supervision while also functioning as an integral part of a team.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
  • Willingness to take initiative and to follow through on projects
  • Must be proactive and recommend solutions when discussing problems
  • Ability to work flexible hours (from the office and from home) to well coordinate with the rest of the team during Month-End Close/Reporting


Other Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:  
  • Project management skills strongly preferred


TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:
  • Minimal travel might be required.
32322.publicDescription:
Position: Accounting Manager

Location & Work Arrangement

  • Multiple locations: Philadelphia, PA; Waltham, MA; Baltimore, MD & Riverwoods, IL
  • Hybrid work model (2-3 days onsite required)
  • Contract to Hire opportunity
  • W2 employment only

Position Overview The Accounting Manager will lead accounting and reporting efforts, demonstrating critical thinking, meticulous attention to detail, and proactive management of complex accounting scenarios. The role requires expertise in general ledger management, team leadership, and month-end close processes within a 3-5 day timeline.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive month-end close and reporting processes according to established timelines
  • Lead and supervise accounting team members
  • Review and approve general ledger transactions with accuracy and timeliness
  • Manage preparation of balance sheet reconciliations (monthly/quarterly/semi-annual)
  • Support external and internal audits with documentation and professional interaction
  • Maintain and update process documentation and desktop procedures
  • Oversee completion of month-end close checklists and reporting requirements
  • Conduct analysis for process improvement opportunities
  • Coordinate effectively with accounting team and third-party service providers
  • Provide mentorship and feedback to improve team performance

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Business Administration (Master's in Accounting preferred)
  • CPA certification or actively pursuing certification preferred
  • 7-9 years of accounting/audit experience (public or private)
  • 2-3 years of managerial experience
  • Proficiency in major ERP systems (SAP, Great Plains, NetSuite)
  • Experience with Blackline
  • Advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills
  • Strong data analysis and reporting capabilities

Technical Competencies

  • Month-end close process management
  • General ledger expertise
  • Journal entry preparation and review
  • Balance sheet account reconciliations
  • Bank reconciliations
  • Intercompany accounting
  • Audit support and compliance
  • International accounting experience (preferred)

Professional Skills

  • Demonstrated leadership and team management abilities
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical capabilities
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong project management skills
  • Detail-oriented with focus on accuracy
  • Adaptable to changing business requirements
  • Proactive approach to problem identification and resolution

Work Requirements

  • Flexible schedule during month-end close periods
  • Ability to coordinate with team members across multiple time zones
  • Minimal travel may be required
  • Capability to work both remotely and in-office

Additional Preferences

  • Project management certification or experience
  • International accounting experience
  • Experience with process improvement initiatives

This position offers an opportunity to join a dynamic organization with potential for growth and development in a professional accounting environment.

32343.title: Remote-BI Project Manager  (W-2414)
32343.description:
WK - BI Project Manager - BR $80hr, Remote, 7+ months contract

 

Job Title: BI Project Manager

Work Location: 100% Remote (should be willing to work in Eastern and Central time zone, need to be available occasionally before 8 AM CST for meetings with offshore teams)

Duration: 7+ month contract (possible further extension)

 

Job Summary:

  • Drives BI team programs and projects required to ensure programs achieve their strategic objectives within scope, schedule, and budget and deliver business value.
  • Ensures that all assigned programs are utilizing an appropriate change control process.
  • Articulates the program status and outcomes appropriately to all stakeholders, including making presentations that could be presented for executive sponsors.
  • Develops and implements effective communication plans, designed to drive program discussions with stakeholders; handles escalations or further escalates so that issues do not impact scope, schedule, or budget.
  • Develops resource estimates and identifies subject-matter-expertise required to effectively staff program. Negotiates with resource managers on the availability of all needed resources.
  • Ensures that all required program artifacts (charter, change requests, etc.) are executed and stored correctly; ensures that all project teams and project managers comply with methodologies established; conducts periodic program audits to ensure compliance.
  • Ensures that program and project managers utilize industry-standard project, program, and change management best practices.
  • Ensures that the project and program managers are helping their teams to Identify all project risks and create plans to manage (accept, avoid, mitigate, transfer.) Coaches on risk management strategies as needed.
  • Responsible for forecasting and controlling the program budget (revenue and costs) to ensure the entire portfolio realizes the expected financial & business benefits (e.g., revenue, cost savings, etc.).
  • Ensures that requirements gathering sessions with key stakeholders and project teams occur as needed. Ensure that requirements between inter-related and/or non-related projects within the program are clearly articulated and approved to ensure the successful execution of the portfolio.

  • Leads efforts in determining the optimal resourcing mix required to best achieve program operational and financial goals

32154.title: Hybrid Work-French Legal Invoice Analyst/Initial Reviewer (W-2101)
32154.description:
Bill Rate: $40/hr; 

Location:  Hybrid role, Minneapolis, MN 55402

Job Description:

The Legal Invoice Analyst I will be responsible for the prompt, accurate and efficient auditing of electronically submitted legal fee and expense invoices submitted by law firms and vendors of our clients. The candidate will be responsible for making adjustments to invoice line item entries, where those line-item entries violate provisions of the relevant billing guidelines and documenting the justification for such adjustments. The Legal Invoice Analyst I will provide guidance to business unit partners regarding issues or opportunities within the LBA process.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Efficiently and accurately review legal invoice entries.
• Receive legal invoice assignments from the Operations Support Specialist and/or work the intake queue for self-assignments.
• Verify the compliance to legal billing guidelines by law firms and vendor submitting invoices.
• Verify the accuracy of the UTBMS task codes (Fee, Activity and Expense codes) applied to invoice line items.
• Document reasons for any adjustments made to invoice line items, identifying the billing guideline violated and the rationale for the amount adjusted.
• Forward the audited legal bill through the review chain as required.
• Communicate and calibrate with Legal Invoice Analyst and Quality Assurance Analyst team members.
• Excellent ability to review, analyze and evaluate legal fee and cost/expense invoice entries and to exercise discretion and sound judgment when making audit and adjustment decisions.
• Strong understanding of legal terminology and claims legal situations, multijurisdictional exposure preferred.
• Self-motivated with an ability to work independently and with very limited supervision after training.
• Excellent computer skills with the ability to learn the electronic legal bill submission and auditing software.
• Organizational skills, including the ability to organize work in an orderly fashion conducive to the prompt, efficient review of an appropriate number of legal invoices in a given day or time period.
• Familiarity with common business math and possess appropriate business telephone skills.

Required Skills/Qualifications/Experience:
Minimum: Paralegal Certification or Bachelor’s Degree in legal related discipline and/or equivalent work experience. 
Minimum Experience: 1-3 years of experience in a legal services or legal auditing environment.
Must speak, read and write French--for this opening.
Tools: Microsoft Office Suite ( Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
• Experience with legal billing processes.
• Firm understanding of the federal and/or state rules of civil procedure.
• Team Work: Must work collaboratively with people within LBACOE and throughout the entire WK organization, while providing constructive feedback to LBACOE from the BUs.
• Problem Solving: Capable of independent thinking and rendering sound decisions. Astute at identifying and engaging the necessary resources to help in decision making. Takes quick actions to identify and resolve the cause of any problem. Proactive in nature.
• Leadership: Exhibits individual control over day to day responsibilities as well as the ability to work collaboratively with other BUs to produce results.
• Planning and Organizing: Must be able to implement plans with the purpose of achieving short and long term goals. Must be able to prioritize in order to accomplish these goals in a given time period.
• Technology: Has the ability to partner with experts in the technology field to identify technology gaps and requirements necessary to develop position and impactful solutions.
• Learning: Ability to acquire new or modify existing knowledge to support a changing market place and workforce. Can demonstrate a capability to learn by study, experience, or instruction.
 • Initiative and Enterprise: Is self-directed and has the ability to translate ideas into action and get things done.

32274.title: W2 ONLY Remote - AWS Data Engineer
32274.description:
Title: AWS Data Engineer (strong PYTHON)
Client Location: Phoenix, AZ (100% REMOTE)
Duration: 3+ Months Contract to hire

Job Description:We are looking for a versatile and experienced professional to fill the role of Data Engineer with a strong expertise in utilizing AWS tools and services. The ideal candidate will be adept at both data analysis and engineering, with a deep understanding of AWS technologies to drive data-driven insights and solutions.

Responsibilities:

  1. Data Exploration and Analysis: Leverage AWS tools such as Amazon Redshift, Amazon Athena, and Amazon Quicksight to extract, transform, and analyze data, providing actionable insights to support business decisions.
  2. Machine Learning and Predictive Analytics: Develop and deploy machine learning models using AWS SageMaker, utilizing algorithms to generate predictive and prescriptive insights from large datasets.
  3. Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines using AWS services like AWS Glue, ensuring efficient data movement and transformation from various sources to target destinations.
  4. Real-time Data Processing: Implement real-time data processing using AWS Kinesis, Lambda, and other relevant tools, enabling near-instantaneous data insights and actions.
  5. Big Data Technologies: Work with AWS EMR and related tools to process and analyze large-scale datasets using technologies like Apache Spark and Hadoop.
  6. Data Warehousing: Design and optimize data warehousing solutions using AWS Redshift, ensuring high-performance querying, and reporting capabilities.
  7. Data Quality and Governance: Implement data validation, cleansing, and quality checks using AWS services to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
  8. Dashboard Creation: Develop interactive and visually appealing dashboards using Amazon QuickSight or other relevant tools, enabling stakeholders to easily consume and interpret data.
  9. Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, provide data-driven insights, and develop solutions that align with organizational goals.
  10. Cloud Cost Optimization: Monitor and optimize AWS resource utilization to manage costs effectively while maintaining high-performance data processing and analysis capabilities.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's or advanced degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
  • Strong proficiency in AWS services, including but not limited to Redshift, Athena, Glue, SageMaker, Kinesis, Lambda, EMR, and Quicksight.
  • Demonstrated experience in both data analysis and engineering, with a portfolio showcasing impactful data-driven projects.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java for data manipulation, analysis, and model development and component deployment through Terraform.
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, Scikit-learn) and their integration with AWS tools.
  • Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and SQL proficiency.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
  • Excellent communication skills to translate technical insights into actionable business recommendations.

32078.title: Process Specialist
32078.description:
The Process Specialist plays a crucial role within the Lightspeed Program Delivery team, reporting directly to the Program Delivery Office Manager. This position involves analyzing various activities across the Lightspeed Program, from contract handling to project execution and delivery. The specialist will support the development of new processes, review existing processes, identify inefficiencies, explore automation opportunities, develop process maps, and monitor outcomes post-release to gather feedback for continuous improvement and training. Collaboration is essential, as you will work with teams across all levels, from technical staff to executive management, to implement and enhance new processes.
 
The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in process mapping, data analysis, and project management. They should excel in problem-solving and communication, with a keen attention to detail and experience in organizational change management. Familiarity with process management tools and knowledge of the telecom industry are important. Additionally, the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams is vital for driving improvements.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Analyze and deconstruct existing processes. Study current operating processes and implement change where possible to improve performance; run test scenarios
  • Develop and implement new, efficient systems across program execution and operations.
  • Apply process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, Kaizen across various departments.
  • Work directly with development teams to observe and analyze project-specific tasks. Meet with stakeholders to review recommendations to increase efficiency
  • Guide on-site personnel in the implementation and adoption of new processes.
  • Continuously identify areas for improvement, focusing on even the smallest details. Lead continuous improvement projects and activities through the use of data and reports
  • Collaborate with team members to ensure smooth transition and adoption of improved processes.
  • Generate training materials and collaborate with the Training Coordinator to facilitate workshops, training sessions, and coaching aimed at building continuous improvement capabilities across the organization
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
  • Diploma or Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Science or related field, or equivalent work experience
  • 5+ years of experience coordinating projects, preferably on a telecoms/engineering field
  • Demonstrated experience in Process Improvement identification and implementation
  • Strong communication skills for effective team and stakeholder engagement along with the ability to inspire and influence change
  • Capacity to work effectively with diverse teams and personalities
  • Aptitude and desire to learn new tools and techniques quickly
  • Positive attitude (solution-oriented and ability to deal with ambiguity)
  • Professionalism and takes direction well; organized, displays sound judgment, has solid problem-solving, and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to work in a fast pace, changing environment
DECISION MAKING & SUPERVISION
  • This role supports Lightspeed Program Delivery team via the Program Delivery Office. As the Process Specialist you will be expected to make informed recommendations to the Lightspeed Program Delivery leadership
  • This role has no direct reports, but may work and interact with multi-disciplinary engineering, contracts, legal, and commercial teams
32078.publicDescription:
The Process Specialist is an integral member of the Lightspeed Program Delivery team, reporting directly to the Program Delivery Office Manager. This role involves analyzing and improving various activities within the Lightspeed Program, including contract handling, project execution, and delivery. The Process Specialist will develop and refine processes, identify inefficiencies, explore automation opportunities, create process maps, and monitor outcomes post-implementation. Feedback collected from these activities will be used for continuous improvement and training initiatives. This role requires collaboration with individuals at all organizational levels, from technical staff to executive management, to implement and enhance processes effectively.

Key Qualifications

The ideal candidate should demonstrate expertise in process mapping, data analysis, and project management. Strong problem-solving abilities, effective communication skills, attention to detail, and experience with organizational change management are essential. Familiarity with process management tools and knowledge of the telecom industry are also important. The candidate must be adept at working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive meaningful improvements.

Main Responsibilities

  • Analyze and evaluate existing processes, identifying opportunities for improvement.
  • Develop and implement efficient systems to enhance program execution and operations.
  • Apply process improvement methodologies such as Lean, Six Sigma, and Kaizen across departments.
  • Collaborate with development teams to observe and analyze project-specific tasks and meet with stakeholders to recommend efficiency enhancements.
  • Guide on-site personnel during the implementation and adoption of new processes.
  • Continuously identify and prioritize areas for improvement, leading projects that utilize data and reporting to drive changes.
  • Work with team members to ensure a smooth transition and adoption of enhanced processes.
  • Create training materials and collaborate with the Training Coordinator to facilitate workshops, training sessions, and coaching to promote a culture of continuous improvement.

Education and Experience Requirements

  • Diploma or degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Science, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
  • At least 5 years of experience in project coordination, preferably within the telecom or engineering industry.
  • Proven experience in identifying and implementing process improvements.
  • Strong communication skills to engage effectively with teams and stakeholders and inspire positive change.
  • Ability to work well with diverse teams and adapt to different personalities.
  • Quick aptitude for learning new tools and techniques.
  • Solution-oriented mindset with the ability to handle ambiguity.
  • Professional demeanor, sound judgment, strong organizational skills, and critical thinking abilities.
  • Capacity to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

Decision-Making and Supervision

This position supports the Lightspeed Program Delivery team through the Program Delivery Office. As a Process Specialist, you will make informed recommendations to the Lightspeed Program Delivery leadership. While this role does not include direct reports, you will interact with multi-disciplinary teams, including engineering, contracts, legal, and commercial teams.

  • Ability to maintain professionalism and high level of service through difficult customer interactions
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment

32263.title: Local to Chicago -Automation Engineer with AI/Chatbot experience(A-28964)
32263.description:
Analyst Commodity III (EI3)

3/31/2025 to 9/26/2025

Bill Rate: $ 117.90

J41, 1615 Lakeside Drive

 

Describe the primary goals, objectives or functions or outputs of this position.

One of our strategic initiatives is to make the AbbVie enterprise easier to navigate -- helping our team focus on meeting the unmet needs of patients. We’re doing that by building an advanced, AI-powered chatbot called AVA – the AbbVie Virtual Assistant.

 

The primary goal of this role is to establish and enhance rigorous quality processes, including test strategies, automated testing, test execution, and real-world data monitoring. You’ll work with technical team members on other teams to build integrations and deliver enterprise knowledge and automations to our AbbVie colleagues through AVA.

 

What does success look like? We expect to save time, create new, cost-effective ways of working, and create delightful experiences – all at the same time.

Responsibilities:

• Collaborate with designers, developers, and others to ensure the realized technology matches the stated requirements and the business opportunities identified by the product owner team.

• Determine approach and solution to scaling existing test procedures, adding automation where appropriate

• Apply analytical thinking skills to diagnose and make recommendations on systems based on stated requirements and sources of implicit requirements: user feedback, appropriate data, input from cross-functional stakeholders, and your own knowledge of business and technology.

• Develop preliminary testing strategies and execute them to formulate preliminary findings. Work is performed and technical decisions are made with a high degree of independence and performance is judged by results obtained.

• Analyze processes and needs and make recommendations that are most effective means to satisfy those needs. Analyze the most complex work procedures and job methods and present concepts to simplify those procedures within the domain of applicability for the AI-powered chatbot.

• Work effectively with a team/group to accomplish organizational goals. Actively participate in client and team meetings by offering suggestions. Provide leadership to project planning with respect to quality verification and testing.

• Exercise latitude in approach to problem and solution. Work is reviewed for soundness of business judgment and to determine if overall results and objectives have been achieved.

 

Qualifications:

List required and preferred qualifications (up to 10). Include education, skills and experience.

 

• Bachelor's degree field plus 5 years of experience in delivering information technology projects, or Master's degree plus 4 years of experience

• Experience in a Business System Analyst, test engineer, or related role

• Successfully delivered IT projects in a quality-related role

• Demonstrated ability to define test plans and procedures according to departmental standards

• Experience delivering technology using Agile processes

• Strong written and verbal communication

• Ability to work on location in Lake County on a regular basis

• Project Management experience

• Preferred: Knowledge & experience in AI-Systems or chatbots
32263.publicDescription:
Job Title: Automation Engineer (AI/Chatbot)

Location: Waukegan, IL (Hybrid)

Myticas' direct client is seeking an experienced Automation Engineer (AI/Chatbot) for a hybrid, 6+ month contract position in Waukegan, IL.

Top Skills & Experience Requirements:

  • Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field with 5+ years of experience in delivering information technology projects, or
  • Master’s degree with 4+ years of experience.
  • Relevant Experience:
  • Proven experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Test Engineer, or in a similar role.
  • Track record of successfully delivering IT projects in a quality-focused capacity.
  • Strong ability to define test plans and procedures in alignment with departmental standards.
  • Experience with Agile methodologies in software development.
  • Technical & Soft Skills:
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to work on-site in Lake County, IL, on a regular basis.
  • Project management experience.
  • Preferred:
  • Knowledge and experience with AI systems or chatbots.

    Job Summary:

    One of our key strategic initiatives is to enhance the client enterprise's efficiency—helping our teams focus on addressing the unmet needs of patients. To support this mission, we are developing an advanced AI-powered chatbot, AVA (the Client Virtual Assistant).

    The primary focus of this role is to establish and enhance rigorous quality processes, including test strategies, automation, test execution, and real-world data monitoring. You will work closely with technical teams to build integrations and deliver enterprise knowledge and automation to client colleagues through AVA.

    Job Responsibilities:

    • Collaborate with designers, developers, and stakeholders to ensure the implemented technology aligns with business requirements and objectives identified by the product owner team.
    • Define and implement scalable testing strategies, incorporating test automation where applicable.
    • Utilize analytical thinking to diagnose system issues and propose solutions based on:
    • Business requirements,
    • User feedback,
    • Data insights, and
    • Cross-functional stakeholder input.
  • Develop and execute testing strategies, analyzing results to derive actionable insights. Work is performed with a high degree of independence and is evaluated based on outcomes.
  • Assess business processes and system needs, recommending improvements that optimize efficiency, particularly in relation to the AI-powered chatbot.
  • Participate actively in client and team meetings, contributing insights and recommendations. Provide leadership in quality assurance planning and testing.
  • Exercise independent judgment in problem-solving, with work reviewed for sound business decisions and alignment with project goals.

    This role requires a proactive and detail-oriented professional who can balance quality assurance, project coordination, and AI technology implementation to enhance the capabilities of AVA.

32273.title: Hybrid Work-Senior Executive Assistant (W-7601)
32273.description:
Bill Rate: $55/hr; 
Job ID#14767601
1. Hybrid position (weekly onsite) - NY preferred but Philadelphia also okay.

2. Mention location on the resume.

3. Manager would like candidates to be tested for MS Office proficiency (Word, Excel, PPT, etc). Manager is looking for high proficiency. Please administer test before submitting candidate and mention the result on the resume along with the location.

Job Qualifications:
Education:

  • High School Degree required; College degree or higher education courses are a plus
Experience:
  • At least 5 years’ experience as an Executive Assistant to levels VP and above in a global corporation or other professional services organization working across multiple time zones
  • Experience in learning new technologies and managing large volumes of information, distribution lists
  • Experience with project support “best practices & disciplines”
  • Demonstrated experience requiring excellent planning, organizational and time management skills
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office suite including Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Essential Competencies/skills:
  • Strong multitasker with demonstrated success working in high stress environments for multiple executive leaders
  • Adapt and modifies established processes and practices to anticipate recurring operational or administrative issues and problems, enabling others to resolve issues independently and collaborating across the organization for immediate support.
  • Excellent organizational, judgment, planning and problem-solving skills, including a proactive approach to working in a matrixed environment with key stakeholders, partners, and clients.
  • Proactively learns and trains others to use workplace/ office technology tied to core responsibilities and Executives
  • Completes operational or administrative work without clear guidelines based on prior experience.
  • Excellent attention to detail, working to consistently deliver to a high standard
  • Good business discretion and awareness with sensitivity to handling highly confidential information
  • A professional and proactive approach, with the ability to prioritize and adapt to changing demands; ability to work within tight deadlines and deliver on time
  • Strong client service focus in dealing with both external and internal clients, displaying an image of professionalism, discretion, and integrity
  • Strong communication skills (verbal and written) with an ability to follow instructions from multiple leaders with different management styles to promote good relations.
  • Solid relationship-building skills to develop networks both within our highly matrixed global company and externally.

Job Description:

This role provides executive administrative support to several senior Executives within the leadership team of the Health Division.  Responsible for advanced administrative and project management support requiring excellent judgment, time management, and discretion.
Requires extensive knowledge of organization operations, procedures and personnel working within company guidelines and strong working knowledge of Microsoft office suite and enterprise systems.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manages calendar and email requests to ensure timely attention and responses with appropriate urgency based on an understanding of priorities. Professionally responds to requests for meetings, as appropriate, using discretion and judgment, processes requests, takes messages, and delegates to appropriate party in a timely and effective manner to maintain a high level of productivity and confidentiality.
  • Manages all logistics and prepares agendas for internal and external meetings, partnering with staff and vendors for onsite meetings for smooth end-to-end execution.  Obtains quality and timely briefing materials as needed, including research and intelligence; demonstrates knowledge of underlying issues and objectives, as applicable. Ensures that Executives receive all materials prior to meetings to facilitate efficient review and use of Division Executives’ time. Manages schedule to allow for sufficient time to read, analyze, and respond to short and long-term strategic work.  May also include research and analysis related to meeting preparation.
  • Assists in special projects and supports coordination of PowerPoint presentations for strategy/market segments and mergers and acquisitions and other leader presentations including internal communications, Monthly Division and annual Strategy meetings and other corporate meetings and events
  • Supports other Executive direct reports in their initiatives, as needed and requested including attendance at regular team meetings and helping with adherence to deadlines; helps to on-board new employees, as required.
  • Manages all travel arrangements and ground logistics for the Division Executives with a focus on balancing travel dates with the need for cost-efficient and seamless travel within appropriate corporate guidelines.
  • Prepares and processes employee recognition awards, monthly expense reports, and regular time off tracking for Division Executives and reviews and supports related administration tied to direct reports
  • Manages all outside vendor set up, billing, codes for payment, and ensures proper systems processing and adherence to budget.
  • Maintains paper and electronic files for Division Executives; complies with records retention policies and organizes files such that records can be retrieved efficiently.
  • Provides back up support for the Executive Assistant to the CEO of the Health Division including assistance with on-site meetings, as well as mutual coverage for each other during peak times or vacations.

31831.title: Project Manager - Azure Dev Ops
31831.description:
Project/Program Manager with Cybersecurity Experience
Clearance Required: Secret Level Government Clearance

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project/Program Manager with a strong background in cybersecurity to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing and managing complex projects and programs within the cybersecurity domain, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and budget. This role requires a Secret level government clearance and offers an opportunity to work on critical national security initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Project/Program Management:
    • Lead and manage multiple cybersecurity projects and programs simultaneously.
    • Develop project plans, including timelines, milestones, and deliverables.
    • Monitor and report on project progress, addressing any issues or risks promptly.
    • Coordinate with stakeholders, including government clients, to ensure project requirements are met.
  2. Cybersecurity Expertise:
    • Apply advanced knowledge of cybersecurity principles and practices to project management.
    • Ensure projects align with cybersecurity policies, standards, and regulations.
    • Provide guidance on cybersecurity risk management and mitigation strategies.
  3. Team Leadership:
    • Lead and mentor a team of cybersecurity professionals, ensuring effective collaboration and performance.
    • Foster a positive and productive work environment, promoting continuous learning and development.
  4. Stakeholder Communication:
    • Serve as the primary point of contact for project stakeholders, including government clients.
    • Prepare and present project status reports, proposals, and other documentation as required.
    • Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among all project stakeholders.
  5. Compliance and Documentation:
    • Ensure all projects comply with relevant cybersecurity and government regulations.
    • Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including plans, reports, and compliance records.

Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Cybersecurity, Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.
  • Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in project/program management within the cybersecurity domain.
  • Certification: PMP, Prince2, or equivalent certifications are highly desirable.
  • Security Clearance: Active Secret level government clearance required.
  • Skills:
    • Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles, practices, and frameworks.
    • Proven experience in managing complex projects and programs.
    • Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
    • Ability to work effectively with government clients and stakeholders.
    • Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

31956.title: Automation Network Architect
31956.description:
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN

The selected candidate will develop and deliver service offerings for the IP Fabric and domain controller within the Data Center Fabric solution.

  • Lead architecture discussions and requirements-gathering workshops with customers.
  • Document, present, and deliver relevant design collateral, such as high-level designs (HLD), low-level designs (LLD), and test plans.
  • Provide guidance on validated design best practices and architecture.
  • Engage in the staging and network integration phases of customer projects.
  • Consult with network deployment and integration teams on design questions and architectural guidelines.
  • Work with Product Line Management, pre-sales, and support teams to gather feedback and meet customer expectations.

These responsibilities will be carried out specifically in customer contexts, involving direct participation in defining and executing customer projects.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

This role requires cross-domain knowledge, with a familiarity in Data Center networking and Cloud concepts expected.

  • 8+ years of work experience in the IP Routing domain.
  • Strong working-level knowledge of IP Networking and Routing protocols (OSPF, ISIS, BGP), QoS, L2 and L3 VPNs, EVPN, NAT, etc.
  • Familiarity with Data Center Design principles.
  • Knowledge of Cloud Computing concepts and platforms such as Kubernetes, OpenShift, AWS, and GCP.
  • Experience in consulting and delivering professional services directly to external customers.
  • Hands-on network integration and problem-solving skills.

Additional Skills Considered Valuable:

  • Experience with Network Management & API concepts and protocols, such as NETCONF, YANG, REST, and gNMI.
  • 3rd-party router expertise, including Cisco/Juniper product lines.
  • Knowledge of public cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.

31996.title: Project Manager - Windows Server Upgrade
31996.description:
We are looking for an experienced Project Manager with a strong background in data center management, Microsoft technologies, and large-scale logistical planning to lead a Windows Server upgrade across 400+ servers. The ideal candidate will have exceptional organizational management skills, with the ability to coordinate and communicate across multiple teams, manage timelines effectively, and oversee the project from planning through completion.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Project Planning and Coordination:

    • Develop, document, and execute a comprehensive project plan for upgrading Windows servers across multiple locations.
    • Coordinate with internal teams, including IT, data center operations, and vendor partners, to establish project goals and timelines.

  • Schedule and Logistics Management:

    • Create detailed schedules to ensure minimal disruption to business operations.
    • Oversee logistics, including resource allocation, server access, and hardware/software compatibility.
    • Track progress, mitigate risks, and adjust schedules to meet changing project requirements.

  • Data Center and Microsoft Server Expertise:

    • Apply in-depth knowledge of data center best practices to ensure efficient and secure deployment of the Windows server upgrade.
    • Oversee software installations, configurations, and upgrades in compliance with Microsoft standards and organizational requirements.
    • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Windows Server infrastructure.

  • Stakeholder Communication and Reporting:

    • Regularly update stakeholders on project milestones, potential risks, and remediation steps.
    • Prepare and present status reports to management and relevant teams.

Qualifications:

  • Proven experience managing large-scale IT projects, ideally involving Windows Server upgrades or similar infrastructure projects.
  • Strong background in data center operations and Microsoft server environments.
  • Excellent organizational, time management, and logistics coordination skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively across teams and manage complex schedules.
  • Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certifications in Project Management (PMP or PRINCE2) and/or Microsoft technologies.
  • Experience with cloud or hybrid server environments is a plus.

32071.title: Network Engineer - EK
32071.description:
Job Description: Network Engineer
Position Overview
We are seeking a highly skilled Network Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing, troubleshooting, and optimizing our network infrastructure, which includes Nokia routers (7750, 7250, 7705), Cisco ASR903 routers, and Cisco switches. The role involves working with advanced networking protocols, supporting Layer 2 and Layer 3 VPN services, and ensuring network security and reliability.
Key Responsibilities
  1. Network Operations and Maintenance:
    • Monitor, configure, and troubleshoot Nokia routers (7750, 7250, 7705) and Cisco ASR903 and switching devices.
    • Manage and optimize routing protocols including OSPF and BGP to ensure optimal network performance.
    • Oversee Layer 2 and Layer 3 VPN services, ensuring high availability and reliability.
  2.  Level 2 Support:
    • Provide Level 2 support to troubleshoot and resolve complex network issues.
    • Act as an escalation point for advanced technical problems.
  3. Radio Access Network (RAN) Support:
    • Support and troubleshoot radio access network (RAN) nodes, including 3G, LTE, and 5G technologies.
    • Collaborate with RAN teams to ensure seamless network performance and integration.
  4. Network Security:
    • Implement and maintain authentication mechanisms using TACACS+ and RADIUS.
    • Ensure compliance with organizational security policies and standards.
  5. Microwave Technology Management:
    • Proficiently operate and maintain Nokia Wavence equipment and manage microwave link setups.
    • Diagnose and resolve issues in microwave technologies, ensuring seamless integration into the overall network.
  6. Network Management Tools:
    • Operate and maintain the Nokia NSP platform for efficient network service provisioning and management.
    • Use network monitoring tools to proactively identify and resolve network issues.
  7. Maintenance and On-Call Support:
    • Participate in on-call rotations and scheduled maintenance windows to support network upgrades and resolve outages.
    • Execute changes during maintenance windows following industry best practices and organizational policies.
Required Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or related field.
  • Experience:
    • Minimum 5 years of experience in network operations, with hands-on exposure to Nokia and Cisco devices.
    • Strong expertise in routing protocols (OSPF, BGP) and VPN services (L2VPN, L3VPN).
    • Proficiency in Nokia Wavence and microwave technology.
  • Skills:
    • Advanced troubleshooting and diagnostic skills for Nokia and Cisco equipment.
    • Knowledge of Nokia NSP for network provisioning and management.
    • Strong understanding of network security principles and tools, including TACACS+ and RADIUS.
  • Certifications (Preferred):
    • Nokia NRS II or equivalent certification.
    • Cisco certifications such as CCNP or CCIE.

32257.title: Part-Time Translator for Somali  (T-5585)
32257.description:
Job Title: Interpreter- Interpreter- Somali (5585) 

Pay Rate: $31.25
Start Date: ASAP

Duration: 3 months

Location: Remote

 

Work Shift: Part-time (Project-based) Avg Weekly Hours (fluctuate based on project load) Remote

NOTE:  W2 only!

  • MUST SPEAK Somali.

Job Description:

Facilitate effective communication between two parties that do not speak the same language by converting one spoken language to another. Interpreting services include but are not limited to Employment, Training & Orientation, Meetings, Human Resources, Health Services and other operational activities as assigned. This position is held to a strict code of confidentiality. Example projects include, written translation, video and phone interpretation, voice recording, translation review and editing 

Education:   

High school degree or equivalent is preferred   

Certification in interpreting/translation preferred   

 

Experience & Skills Required:

  • Must be able to pass our translation assessment with an average total score of 90% or higher.   

  • One year of interpreter/translator experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.   

  • Must have strong verbal and written communication skills in English and the target language.   

  • Working knowledge of interpreting/translating best practices preferred, including prioritizing confidentiality at all times   

  • Experience using Microsoft Office and virtual meeting platforms (e.g. Zoom, TEAMS, etc.) preferred  

Special Skills:   

  • Must be able to work independently, while simultaneously working as part of a team collaboratively and learning new skills   

  • Must be able to demonstrate strong organizational skills, prioritize deadlines, work in a fast-paced environment 

  • Must be proactive and willing to ask for help to understand projects fully and perform at one’s highest level Dependable internet connection required Basic Computer and Typing

32229.title: Local to Chicago - Application Support Analyst (A-28862)
32229.description:
Job Title: Application Support Analyst
Location: North Chicago, IL – Hybrid role
Duration: 6+ Months Contract (Possible further extension)
BR: $73.70

Top 3-5 skills requirements should this person have:
  1. Must have Lead experience and managing projects.
  2. Experience with SLAs and putting together timelines for projects.
  3. Service NOW - Ticketing and putting together dashboards and read dashboards.
  4. Good communication skills.
  5. Strong Analytical and Problem-solving Skills.

Nice to have (but not required):
  • Pharma or Regulatory application experience.
  • ITIL methodology- Service Management (ITIL is nice to have).

Job Description:
The Service Analyst is accountable for confirming that the appropriate production processes and quality metrics are executed for Client’s Applications that are scored with low risk and complexity.
The role will also provide support and prioritization for the execution of Application Maintenance and Support tasks and some critical production services.

Responsibilities:
List up to 10 main responsibilities for the job. Include information about the accountability and scope.
  • Offer oversight for some critical production services including: Incident, Problem, Service Transition and Disaster Recovery and seek assistance for other critical services such as: Audit, Validation and Compliance.
  • Participate P1- P2 MIM bridge and on call rotation and confirms business impact.
  • Provides support for audit requests for the ACOE.
  • Reviews the Disaster Recovery plan and schedule to ensure that the service providers exercise test drills and execute the plan as designed.
  • Participates with supplier personnel regarding short-term architecture strategy development and provides recommendation as it relates to Application performance or continuous improvement.
  • Performs post installation analysis including lessons learned and provides recommendations for continuous improvement implementations as needed.
  • Provides inputs to the technical reports and documentation that confirm the Root Cause Analysis for Incidents and Problems.
  • Contributes to the development of new or the refinement of existing critical Service Operations and/or Service Transition processes.
  • Assists providers in coordinating with 3rd party hosting or Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) providers on recovery capabilities.
  • Accountable for ensuring that the Service Transition process is fully executed by the provider and provides feedback into the existing Change, Release and Deployment management processes.
  • Reviews the Service Providers application and technical documentation such as Request for Change, operating procedures and technical and non-technical specifications and provides feedback and approval as appropriate.
  • Evaluates the Service Providers reported trends and the process improvement recommendations to help identify areas where preventative maintenance might be performed to improve Applications efficiency, in terms of both the performance of the Applications and any related maintenance and support efforts.
  • Responsible for reviewing the service provider Service Level Agreements on a regular basis and providing oversight for any action plans that are required to address performance issues.
  • Performs daily reviews of ticket activity: queue levels, processing efficiency, backlogs, aging levels along with prior day Incidents to ensure that ticket processing and the problem Management engines are performing within expected operating parameters.
  • Serves as primary client’s contact point and first level of escalation for Incidents and Problems.
  • Assists with the prioritization and escalation of system recovery issues with Cross-functional, Build and Infrastructure teams.
  • Assists MSPs in ensuring that all the user access to IT systems are properly controlled and authenticated and segregation of duties are maintained.
  • Will coordinate an annual access certification process ensuring that current users still require access to applications under their responsibility.
  • Seeks assistance from senior personnel in performing the initial business risk assessment for Maintenance and Support and Minor Enhancement activities.
  • Partakes in vendor performance meetings and operational reviews.
  • Supports vendor initiated continuous improvement performance plans.

Qualifications:
  • Bachelor degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or Computer Engineering.
  • Minimum of 2-4 years of combined experience in Information Technology.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Knowledge of (could be a platform or a vertical such as Oracle, or Life Sciences Pharmaceutical Research and Development or Financial application technologies, etc.).
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Strong problem resolution skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work within cross-functional teams towards task completion.

32225.title: Local to TX-Evidence Support Specialist (W-0716)
32225.description:
Bill Rate: $32/hr; 

Job Description:
This position will be about 80% Evidence Support and 20% Fulfillment--Customer Service, Admin, and Data Entry experience all helpful.

Evidence Key Responsibilities:
• Assist in the preparation and send-out of evidence for multiple jurisdictions, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
• Coordinate with relevant departments and jurisdictions to facilitate the proper handling evidence.
• Ensure all evidence documentation is accurate, complete.
• Address any discrepancies or issues that arise in the evidence handling process.
• Maintain confidentiality and integrity of sensitive evidence and related documentation.
Fulfillment floater:
• Responsible for processing filings and document orders with state government agencies. 
• The Fulfillment Associate will work closely with internal and external customers to provide excellent service and immediate responses to inquiries. 
• A successful candidate will need to be a team-oriented individual who is able to multi-task, work independently, possess strong computer skills, and participate in team meetings by offering suggestions and ideas to increase team productivity and efficiency.

Required Skills/Experience:
o High School diploma
o 1 year administrative/customer service/processing/production experience
o Ability to interact with all levels of the organization
o Ability to work independently with a minimum amount of oversight while still being an integral part of a team
o Must have knowledge of a variety of computer software and spreadsheets
o Must have poise, tact and diplomacy
o Attention to detail in composing, typing and proofing materials, establishing priorities and execution of deadlines
o Ability to read and comprehend instructions, correspondence and memos
o Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment
o When needed, working overtime is required

Evidence Support Specialist
Location: Austin, TX 78701 (On-site)
Contract Type: Contract
Employment Type: W2 Only

Job Description:

This role consists of approximately 80% evidence support and 20% fulfillment, which includes customer service, administrative tasks, and data entry. Candidates with experience in these areas will be well-suited for this position.

Key Responsibilities:

Evidence Support:

  • Prepare and distribute evidence for multiple jurisdictions, ensuring accuracy and timeliness.
  • Coordinate with relevant departments and jurisdictions to ensure proper evidence handling.
  • Verify that all evidence documentation is accurate and complete.
  • Identify and address any discrepancies or issues in the evidence-handling process.

Fulfillment Associate (Floater):

  • Work closely with internal and external customers to provide excellent service and prompt responses to inquiries.
  • Assist in administrative and clerical tasks to support overall team efficiency.
  • Actively participate in team meetings, offering suggestions to improve productivity and workflow.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • At least one year of experience in administrative support, customer service, processing, or production.
  • Strong ability to interact with all levels of the organization.

  • Professionalism, with strong communication skills including poise, tact, and diplomacy.
  • Excellent attention to detail in composing, proofing, and processing materials, as well as meeting deadlines.

This position requires a detail-oriented and organized individual with strong multitasking abilities and a commitment to maintaining the highest level of accuracy and confidentiality.

32221.title: Local to Chicago - Sr Operations Lead (Infrastructure & Facilities) (A-28794)
32221.description:
Job Title: Sr Operations Lead (Infrastructure & Facilities)
Location: North Chicago, IL – Hybrid role
Duration: 12+ Months Contract (Possible further extension)
 
Top 5 skills/experience:
  1. Deep experience with facility solutions that require personal data compliance.
  2. Experience troubleshooting and working with device communications protocols like BACnet.
  3. Strong technical background with focus on complex desktop clients and Operating Technology systems (building automation and control, fire systems, calibration).
  4. Strong written & verbal communications skills and a bias towards good institutional knowledge.
  5. Cooperation and stakeholder relationship management – works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes business drivers and business strategies across multiple business units; identifies and communicates resulting needs and opportunities for business process improvement that can be enabled via technology.
 
Job Summary:
This position will be responsible for supporting facility/building technologies including traditional information technology applications, operations technology, instruments, and client-server applications.
  • It will require hands-on work with applications, infrastructure, and networking, as well as support of GxP processes.
  • It requires a strong knowledge of communications protocols, and the corresponding network security considerations.
  • The role will be responsible also for creating strong institutional knowledge and work process documentation so that new team members can onboard successfully.
  • Project-wise, there are several required installations and upgrades of applications in our facility technology space, and this role will give the person a chance to lead and execute.
  • They will be expected to own small/medium projects end to end and follow our system lifecycle.

Experience/education and/or certifications required:
  • At least 5 years of experience serving as a technical lead or project management on complex projects.
  • At least 5 years of experience supporting GxP applications.
  • At least 5 years of experience writing and following system life cycle documentation and knowledge base solutions.
  • Business analysis and some project management experience preferred.
  • Initiative and self-starter that is motivated to do great work.
